column2: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
column3: A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the heavens on high.

column2: And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.
column3: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: It is He Who gives Life and Death; and He has Power over all things.

column2: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.
column3: They said, "Even so has thy Lord spoken: and He is full of Wisdom and Knowledge."

column2: And God saw the light, that it was good: and God divided the light from the darkness.
column3: And he said, "Truly do I love the love of good, with a view to the glory of my Lord,"- until (the sun) was hidden in the veil (of night):

column2: And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.
column3: It is He Who created the Night and the Day, and the sun and the moon: all (the celestial bodies) swim along, each in its rounded course.

column2: And God said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.
column3: And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the living creatures that He has scattered through them: and He has power to gather them together when He wills.

column2: And God made the firmament, and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament: and it was so.
column3: And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the living creatures that He has scattered through them: and He has power to gather them together when He wills.

column2: And God called the firmament Heaven. And the evening and the morning were the second day.
column3: So He completed them as seven firmaments in two Days, and He assigned to each heaven its duty and command. And We adorned the lower heaven with lights, and (provided it) with guard. Such is the Decree of (Him) the Exalted in Might, Full of Knowledge.

column2: And God said, Let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry land appear: and it was so.
column3: Then the word went forth: "O earth! swallow up thy water, and O sky! Withhold (thy rain)!" and the water abated, and the matter was ended. The Ark rested on Mount Judi, and the word went forth: "Away with those who do wrong!"

column2: And God called the dry land Earth; and the gathering together of the waters called he Seas: and God saw that it was good.
column3: And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the living creatures that He has scattered through them: and He has power to gather them together when He wills.

column2: And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.
column3: A Sign for them is the earth that is dead: We do give it life, and produce grain therefrom, of which ye do eat.

column2: And the earth brought forth grass, and herb yielding seed after his kind, and the tree yielding fruit, whose seed was in itself, after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
column3: And it is He who spread out the earth, and set thereon mountains standing firm and (flowing) rivers: and fruit of every kind He made in pairs, two and two: He draweth the night as a veil o'er the Day. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who consider!

column2: And the evening and the morning were the third day.
column3: And made the night as a covering,

column2: And God said, Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years:
column3: And it is He who spread out the earth, and set thereon mountains standing firm and (flowing) rivers: and fruit of every kind He made in pairs, two and two: He draweth the night as a veil o'er the Day. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who consider!

column2: And let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.
column3: Blessed is He Who made constellations in the skies, and placed therein a Lamp and a Moon giving light;

column2: And God made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: he made the stars also.
column3: It is He Who created the Night and the Day, and the sun and the moon: all (the celestial bodies) swim along, each in its rounded course.

column2: And God set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,
column3: Blessed is He Who made constellations in the skies, and placed therein a Lamp and a Moon giving light;

column2: And to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and God saw that it was good.
column3: And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the living creatures that He has scattered through them: and He has power to gather them together when He wills.

column2: And the evening and the morning were the fourth day.
column3: And made the night as a covering,

column2: And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.
column3: Then to eat of all the produce (of the earth), and find with skill the spacious paths of its Lord: there issues from within their bodies a drink of varying colours, wherein is healing for men: verily in this is a Sign for those who give thought.

column2: And God created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
column3: And it is He who spread out the earth, and set thereon mountains standing firm and (flowing) rivers: and fruit of every kind He made in pairs, two and two: He draweth the night as a veil o'er the Day. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who consider!

column2: And God blessed them, saying, Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth.
column3: "And grant, our Lord! that they enter the Gardens of Eternity, which Thou hast promised to them, and to the righteous among their fathers, their wives, and their posterity! For Thou art (He), the Exalted in Might, Full of Wisdom.

column2: And the evening and the morning were the fifth day.
column3: And made the night as a covering,

column2: And God said, Let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And God made the beast of the earth after his kind, and cattle after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
column3: He created the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; He set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with you; and He scattered through it beasts of all kinds. We send down rain from the sky, and produce on the earth every kind of noble creature, in pairs.

column2: And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.
column3: Behold! in the creation of the heavens and the earth; in the alternation of the night and the day; in the sailing of the ships through the ocean for the profit of mankind; in the rain which Allah Sends down from the skies, and the life which He gives therewith to an earth that is dead; in the beasts of all kinds that He scatters through the earth; in the change of the winds, and the clouds which they Trail like their slaves between the sky and the earth;- (Here) indeed are Signs for a people that are wise.

column2: So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.
column3: He Who has made everything which He has created most good: He began the creation of man with (nothing more than) clay,

column2: And God blessed them, and God said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.
column3: "Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and of all that is between them; so worship Him, and be constant and patient in His worship: knowest thou of any who is worthy of the same Name as He?"

column2: And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat.
column3: Then to eat of all the produce (of the earth), and find with skill the spacious paths of its Lord: there issues from within their bodies a drink of varying colours, wherein is healing for men: verily in this is a Sign for those who give thought.

column2: And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, I have given every green herb for meat: and it was so.
column3: He created the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; He set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with you; and He scattered through it beasts of all kinds. We send down rain from the sky, and produce on the earth every kind of noble creature, in pairs.

column2: And God saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.
column3: And in the hour of early dawn, they (were found) praying for Forgiveness;

column2: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.
column3: A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the heavens on high.

column2: And on the seventh day God ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.
column3: He Who has made everything which He has created most good: He began the creation of man with (nothing more than) clay,

column2: And God blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which God created and made.
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: These are the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the LORD God made the earth and the heavens,
column3: It is He Who created the Night and the Day, and the sun and the moon: all (the celestial bodies) swim along, each in its rounded course.

column2: And every plant of the field before it was in the earth, and every herb of the field before it grew: for the LORD God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was not a man to till the ground.
column3: He created the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; He set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with you; and He scattered through it beasts of all kinds. We send down rain from the sky, and produce on the earth every kind of noble creature, in pairs.

column2: But there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.
column3: And We send down water from the sky according to (due) measure, and We cause it to soak in the soil; and We certainly are able to drain it off (with ease).

column2: And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
column3: And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the living creatures that He has scattered through them: and He has power to gather them together when He wills.

column2: And the LORD God planted a garden eastward in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed.
column3: Blessed is He Who made constellations in the skies, and placed therein a Lamp and a Moon giving light;

column2: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.
column3: (Here is) a Parable of the Garden which the righteous are promised: in it are rivers of water incorruptible; rivers of milk of which the taste never changes; rivers of wine, a joy to those who drink; and rivers of honey pure and clear. In it there are for them all kinds of fruits; and Grace from their Lord. (Can those in such Bliss) be compared to such as shall dwell for ever in the Fire, and be given, to drink, boiling water, so that it cuts up their bowels (to pieces)?

column2: And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads.
column3: Each of those gardens brought forth its produce, and failed not in the least therein: in the midst of them We caused a river to flow.

column2: The name of the first is Pison: that is it which compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;
column3: From the land that is clean and good, by the will of its Cherisher, springs up produce, (rich) after its kind: but from the land that is bad, springs up nothing but that which is niggardly: thus do we explain the signs by various (symbols) to those who are grateful.

column2: And the gold of that land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx stone.
column3: With it He produces for you corn, olives, date-palms, grapes and every kind of fruit: verily in this is a sign for those who give thought.

column2: And the name of the second river is Gihon: the same is it that compasseth the whole land of Ethiopia.
column3: And a Sign for them is that We bore their race (through the Flood) in the loaded Ark;

column2: And the name of the third river is Hiddekel: that is it which goeth toward the east of Assyria. And the fourth river is Euphrates.
column3: (Remember also) Qarun, Pharaoh, and Haman: there came to them Moses with Clear Signs, but they behaved with insolence on the earth; yet they could not overreach (Us).

column2: And the LORD God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And the LORD God commanded the man, saying, Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat:
column3: Behold, thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man from clay:

column2: But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.
column3: We said: "O Adam! dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden; and eat of the bountiful things therein as (where and when) ye will; but approach not this tree, or ye run into harm and transgression."

column2: And the LORD God said, It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him.
column3: He said: "So (it will be): Thy Lord saith, 'that is easy for Me: and (We wish) to appoint him as a Sign unto men and a Mercy from Us': It is a matter (so) decreed."

column2: And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought them unto Adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever Adam called every living creature, that was the name thereof.
column3: He created the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; He set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with you; and He scattered through it beasts of all kinds. We send down rain from the sky, and produce on the earth every kind of noble creature, in pairs.

column2: And Adam gave names to all cattle, and to the fowl of the air, and to every beast of the field; but for Adam there was not found an help meet for him.
column3: And it is He who spread out the earth, and set thereon mountains standing firm and (flowing) rivers: and fruit of every kind He made in pairs, two and two: He draweth the night as a veil o'er the Day. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who consider!

column2: And the LORD God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam, and he slept: and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh instead thereof;
column3: So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them, and they began to sew together the leaves of the garden over their bodies. And their Lord called unto them: "Did I not forbid you that tree, and tell you that Satan was an avowed enemy unto you?"

column2: And the rib, which the LORD God had taken from man, made he a woman, and brought her unto the man.
column3: And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the living creatures that He has scattered through them: and He has power to gather them together when He wills.

column2: And Adam said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh: she shall be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.
column3: He said, "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, He Who created them (from nothing): and I am a witness to this (Truth).

column2: Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.
column3: Or He bestows both males and females, and He leaves barren whom He will: for He is full of Knowledge and Power.

column2: And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.
column3: And when the two bodies saw each other, the people of Moses said: "We are sure to be overtaken."

column2: Now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the LORD God had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?
column3: So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them, and they began to sew together the leaves of the garden over their bodies. And their Lord called unto them: "Did I not forbid you that tree, and tell you that Satan was an avowed enemy unto you?"

column2: And the woman said unto the serpent, We may eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden:
column3: "O Joseph!" (he said) "O man of truth! Expound to us (the dream) of seven fat kine whom seven lean ones devour, and of seven green ears of corn and (seven) others withered: that I may return to the people, and that they may understand."

column2: But of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God hath said, Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.
column3: We said: "O Adam! dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden; and eat of the bountiful things therein as (where and when) ye will; but approach not this tree, or ye run into harm and transgression."

column2: And the serpent said unto the woman, Ye shall not surely die:
column3: Say (to the Rejecters): "My Lord is not uneasy because of you if ye call not on Him: But ye have indeed rejected (Him), and soon will come the inevitable (punishment)!"

column2: For God doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.
column3: And those who are blessed shall be in the Garden: They will dwell therein for all the time that the heavens and the earth endure, except as thy Lord willeth: a gift without break.

column2: And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desired to make one wise, she took of the fruit thereof, and did eat, and gave also unto her husband with her; and he did eat.
column3: So We listened to him: We removed the distress that was on him, and We restored his people to him, and doubled their number,- as a Grace from Ourselves, and a thing for commemoration, for all who serve Us.

column2: And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked; and they sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.
column3: In the result, they both ate of the tree, and so their nakedness appeared to them: they began to sew together, for their covering, leaves from the Garden: thus did Adam disobey his Lord, and allow himself to be seduced.

column2: And they heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and Adam and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God amongst the trees of the garden.
column3: But when he came to the (fire), a voice was heard from the right bank of the valley, from a tree in hallowed ground: "O Moses! Verily I am Allah, the Lord of the Worlds....

column2: And the LORD God called unto Adam, and said unto him, Where art thou?
column3: And Noah called upon his Lord, and said: "O my Lord! surely my son is of my family! and Thy promise is true, and Thou art the justest of Judges!"

column2: And he said, I heard thy voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked; and I hid myself.
column3: Then Allah sent a raven, who scratched the ground, to show him how to hide the shame of his brother. "Woe is me!" said he; "Was I not even able to be as this raven, and to hide the shame of my brother?" then he became full of regrets-

column2: And he said, Who told thee that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?
column3: "Why bringest thou not angels to us if it be that thou hast the Truth?"

column2: And the man said, The woman whom thou gavest to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I did eat.
column3: He said: "He says: A heifer not trained to till the soil or water the fields; sound and without blemish." They said: "Now hast thou brought the truth." Then they offered her in sacrifice, but not with good-will.

column2: And the LORD God said unto the woman, What is this that thou hast done? And the woman said, The serpent beguiled me, and I did eat.
column3: But when He trieth him, restricting his subsistence for him, then saith he (in despair), "My Lord hath humiliated me!"

column2: And the LORD God said unto the serpent, Because thou hast done this, thou art cursed above all cattle, and above every beast of the field; upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life:
column3: And Moses chose seventy of his people for Our place of meeting: when they were seized with violent quaking, he prayed: "O my Lord! if it had been Thy will Thou couldst have destroyed, long before, both them and me: wouldst Thou destroy us for the deeds of the foolish ones among us? this is no more than Thy trial: by it Thou causest whom Thou wilt to stray, and Thou leadest whom Thou wilt into the right path. Thou art our Protector: so forgive us and give us Thy mercy; for Thou art the best of those who forgive.

column2: And I will put enmity between thee and the woman, and between thy seed and her seed; it shall bruise thy head, and thou shalt bruise his heel.
column3: "'Throw (the child) into the chest, and throw (the chest) into the river: the river will cast him up on the bank, and he will be taken up by one who is an enemy to Me and an enemy to him': But I cast (the garment of) love over thee from Me: and (this) in order that thou mayest be reared under Mine eye.

column2: Unto the woman he said, I will greatly multiply thy sorrow and thy conception; in sorrow thou shalt bring forth children; and thy desire shall be to thy husband, and he shall rule over thee.
column3: "Behold! thy sister goeth forth and saith, 'shall I show you one who will nurse and rear the (child)?' So We brought thee back to thy mother, that her eye might be cooled and she should not grieve. Then thou didst slay a man, but We saved thee from trouble, and We tried thee in various ways. Then didst thou tarry a number of years with the people of Midian. Then didst thou come hither as ordained, O Moses!

column2: And unto Adam he said, Because thou hast hearkened unto the voice of thy wife, and hast eaten of the tree, of which I commanded thee, saying, Thou shalt not eat of it: cursed is the ground for thy sake; in sorrow shalt thou eat of it all the days of thy life;
column3: And Moses chose seventy of his people for Our place of meeting: when they were seized with violent quaking, he prayed: "O my Lord! if it had been Thy will Thou couldst have destroyed, long before, both them and me: wouldst Thou destroy us for the deeds of the foolish ones among us? this is no more than Thy trial: by it Thou causest whom Thou wilt to stray, and Thou leadest whom Thou wilt into the right path. Thou art our Protector: so forgive us and give us Thy mercy; for Thou art the best of those who forgive.

column2: Thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field;
column3: "Or (until) thou have a garden of date trees and vines, and cause rivers to gush forth in their midst, carrying abundant water;

column2: In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, till thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.
column3: "Thou causest the night to gain on the day, and thou causest the day to gain on the night; Thou bringest the Living out of the dead, and Thou bringest the dead out of the Living; and Thou givest sustenance to whom Thou pleasest, without measure."

column2: And Adam called his wife's name Eve; because she was the mother of all living.
column3: (Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers from the beginning!"

column2: Unto Adam also and to his wife did the LORD God make coats of skins, and clothed them.
column3: And it is your Lord that knoweth best all beings that are in the heavens and on earth: We did bestow on some prophets more (and other) gifts than on others: and We gave to David (the gift of) the Psalms.

column2: And the LORD God said, Behold, the man is become as one of us, to know good and evil: and now, lest he put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever:
column3: "Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and of all that is between them; so worship Him, and be constant and patient in His worship: knowest thou of any who is worthy of the same Name as He?"

column2: Therefore the LORD God sent him forth from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from whence he was taken.
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubims, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.
column3: So He completed them as seven firmaments in two Days, and He assigned to each heaven its duty and command. And We adorned the lower heaven with lights, and (provided it) with guard. Such is the Decree of (Him) the Exalted in Might, Full of Knowledge.

column2: And Adam knew Eve his wife; and she conceived, and bare Cain, and said, I have gotten a man from the LORD.
column3: Before them the People of Noah rejected (their messenger): they rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!", and he was driven out.

column2: And she again bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.
column3: Truly Pharaoh elated himself in the land and broke up its people into sections, depressing a small group among them: their sons he slew, but he kept alive their females: for he was indeed a maker of mischief.

column2: And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the LORD.
column3: It brings forth its fruit at all times, by the leave of its Lord. So Allah sets forth parables for men, in order that they may receive admonition.

column2: And Abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. And the LORD had respect unto Abel and to his offering:
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: But unto Cain and to his offering he had not respect. And Cain was very wroth, and his countenance fell.
column3: "But whosoever turns away from My Message, verily for him is a life narrowed down, and We shall raise him up blind on the Day of Judgment."

column2: And the LORD said unto Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?
column3: Perchance thou mayest (feel the inclination) to give up a part of what is revealed unto thee, and thy heart feeleth straitened lest they say, "Why is not a treasure sent down unto him, or why does not an angel come down with him?" But thou art there only to warn! It is Allah that arrangeth all affairs!

column2: If thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door. And unto thee shall be his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.
column3: And Moses chose seventy of his people for Our place of meeting: when they were seized with violent quaking, he prayed: "O my Lord! if it had been Thy will Thou couldst have destroyed, long before, both them and me: wouldst Thou destroy us for the deeds of the foolish ones among us? this is no more than Thy trial: by it Thou causest whom Thou wilt to stray, and Thou leadest whom Thou wilt into the right path. Thou art our Protector: so forgive us and give us Thy mercy; for Thou art the best of those who forgive.

column2: And Cain talked with Abel his brother: and it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.
column3: And he entered the city at a time when its people were not watching: and he found there two men fighting,- one of his own religion, and the other, of his foes. Now the man of his own religion appealed to him against his foe, and Moses struck him with his fist and made an end of him. He said: "This is a work of Evil (Satan): for he is an enemy that manifestly misleads!"

column2: And the LORD said unto Cain, Where is Abel thy brother? And he said, I know not: Am I my brother's keeper?
column3: And Noah called upon his Lord, and said: "O my Lord! surely my son is of my family! and Thy promise is true, and Thou art the justest of Judges!"

column2: And he said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood crieth unto me from the ground.
column3: O Abraham! Seek not this. The decree of thy Lord hath gone forth: for them there cometh a penalty that cannot be turned back!

column2: And now art thou cursed from the earth, which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother's blood from thy hand;
column3: "But thou dost wreak thy vengeance on us simply because we believed in the Signs of our Lord when they reached us! Our Lord! pour out on us patience and constancy, and take our souls unto thee as Muslims (who bow to thy will)!

column2: When thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength; a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.
column3: Nor walk on the earth with insolence: for thou canst not rend the earth asunder, nor reach the mountains in height.

column2: And Cain said unto the LORD, My punishment is greater than I can bear.
column3: Commemorate Our Servant Job. Behold he cried to his Lord: "The Evil One has afflicted me with distress and suffering!"

column2: Behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the earth; and from thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth; and it shall come to pass, that every one that findeth me shall slay me.
column3: So from whencesoever Thou startest forth, turn Thy face in the direction of the sacred Mosque; and wheresoever ye are, Turn your face thither: that there be no ground of dispute against you among the people, except those of them that are bent on wickedness; so fear them not, but fear Me; and that I may complete My favours on you, and ye May (consent to) be guided;

column2: And the LORD said unto him, Therefore whosoever slayeth Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. And the LORD set a mark upon Cain, lest any finding him should kill him.
column3: Behold! thy Lord did declare that He would send against them, to the Day of Judgment, those who would afflict them with grievous penalty. Thy Lord is quick in retribution, but He is also Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.

column2: And Cain went out from the presence of the LORD, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.
column3: And remember David and Solomon, when they gave judgment in the matter of the field into which the sheep of certain people had strayed by night: We did witness their judgment.

column2: And Cain knew his wife; and she conceived, and bare Enoch: and he builded a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And unto Enoch was born Irad: and Irad begat Mehujael: and Mehujael begat Methusael: and Methusael begat Lamech.
column3: We gave him Isaac and Jacob: all (three) guided: and before him, We guided Noah, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron: thus do We reward those who do good:

column2: And Lamech took unto him two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.
column3: Said the chiefs of Pharaoh's people: "Wilt thou leave Moses and his people, to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon thee and thy gods?" He said: "Their male children will we slay; (only) their females will we save alive; and we have over them (power) irresistible."

column2: And Adah bare Jabal: he was the father of such as dwell in tents, and of such as have cattle.
column3: "(Deeds) after the manner of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them: They rejected the Signs of Allah, and Allah punished them for their crimes: for Allah is Strong, and Strict in punishment:

column2: And his brother's name was Jubal: he was the father of all such as handle the harp and organ.
column3: Say, "He will give them life Who created them for the first time! for He is Well-versed in every kind of creation!-

column2: And Zillah, she also bare Tubalcain, an instructer of every artificer in brass and iron: and the sister of Tubalcain was Naamah.
column3: (Remember also) Qarun, Pharaoh, and Haman: there came to them Moses with Clear Signs, but they behaved with insolence on the earth; yet they could not overreach (Us).

column2: And Lamech said unto his wives, Adah and Zillah, Hear my voice; ye wives of Lamech, hearken unto my speech: for I have slain a man to my wounding, and a young man to my hurt.
column3: And their Lord hath accepted of them, and answered them: "Never will I suffer to be lost the work of any of you, be he male or female: Ye are members, one of another: Those who have left their homes, or been driven out therefrom, or suffered harm in My Cause, or fought or been slain,- verily, I will blot out from them their iniquities, and admit them into Gardens with rivers flowing beneath;- A reward from the presence of Allah, and from His presence is the best of rewards."

column2: If Cain shall be avenged sevenfold, truly Lamech seventy and sevenfold.
column3: "But whosoever turns away from My Message, verily for him is a life narrowed down, and We shall raise him up blind on the Day of Judgment."

column2: And Adam knew his wife again; and she bare a son, and called his name Seth: For God, said she, hath appointed me another seed instead of Abel, whom Cain slew.
column3: The man in Egypt who bought him, said to his wife: "Make his stay (among us) honourable: may be he will bring us much good, or we shall adopt him as a son." Thus did We establish Joseph in the land, that We might teach him the interpretation of stories (and events). And Allah hath full power and control over His affairs; but most among mankind know it not.

column2: And to Seth, to him also there was born a son; and he called his name Enos: then began men to call upon the name of the LORD.
column3: And it is your Lord that knoweth best all beings that are in the heavens and on earth: We did bestow on some prophets more (and other) gifts than on others: and We gave to David (the gift of) the Psalms.

column2: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, in the likeness of God made he him;
column3: (This is) the Revelation of the Book in which there is no doubt,- from the Lord of the Worlds.

column2: Male and female created he them; and blessed them, and called their name Adam, in the day when they were created.
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And Adam lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat a son in his own likeness, and after his image; and called his name Seth:
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And the days of Adam after he had begotten Seth were eight hundred years: and he begat sons and daughters:
column3: To Him is due the primal origin of the heavens and the earth: How can He have a son when He hath no consort? He created all things, and He hath full knowledge of all things.

column2: And all the days that Adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years: and he died.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And Seth lived an hundred and five years, and begat Enos:
column3: And made his progeny to endure (on this earth);

column2: And Seth lived after he begat Enos eight hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters:
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years: and he died.
column3: The Night of Power is better than a thousand months.

column2: And Enos lived ninety years, and begat Cainan:
column3: And made his progeny to endure (on this earth);

column2: And Enos lived after he begat Cainan eight hundred and fifteen years, and begat sons and daughters:
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And all the days of Enos were nine hundred and five years: and he died.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And Cainan lived seventy years and begat Mahalaleel:
column3: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:

column2: And Cainan lived after he begat Mahalaleel eight hundred and forty years, and begat sons and daughters:
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And all the days of Cainan were nine hundred and ten years: and he died.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And Mahalaleel lived sixty and five years, and begat Jared:
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And Mahalaleel lived after he begat Jared eight hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters:
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And all the days of Mahalaleel were eight hundred ninety and five years: and he died.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And Jared lived an hundred sixty and two years, and he begat Enoch:
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And Jared lived after he begat Enoch eight hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And all the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty and two years: and he died.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And Enoch lived sixty and five years, and begat Methuselah:
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty and five years:
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And Enoch walked with God: and he was not; for God took him.
column3: Before them the People of Noah rejected (their messenger): they rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!", and he was driven out.

column2: And Methuselah lived an hundred eighty and seven years, and begat Lamech.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And Methuselah lived after he begat Lamech seven hundred eighty and two years, and begat sons and daughters:
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years: and he died.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And Lamech lived an hundred eighty and two years, and begat a son:
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And he called his name Noah, saying, This same shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands, because of the ground which the LORD hath cursed.
column3: And when the Word is fulfilled against them (the unjust), we shall produce from the earth a beast to (face) them: He will speak to them, for that mankind did not believe with assurance in Our Signs.

column2: And Lamech lived after he begat Noah five hundred ninety and five years, and begat sons and daughters:
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And all the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy and seven years: and he died.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And Noah was five hundred years old: and Noah begat Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
column3: We gave him Isaac and Jacob: all (three) guided: and before him, We guided Noah, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron: thus do We reward those who do good:

column2: And it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face of the earth, and daughters were born unto them,
column3: Behold! in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the alternation of night and day,- there are indeed Signs for men of understanding,-

column2: That the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were fair; and they took them wives of all which they chose.
column3: We did aforetime grant to the Children of Israel the Book the Power of Command, and Prophethood; We gave them, for Sustenance, things good and pure; and We favoured them above the nations.

column2: And the LORD said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, for that he also is flesh: yet his days shall be an hundred and twenty years.
column3: And those who are blessed shall be in the Garden: They will dwell therein for all the time that the heavens and the earth endure, except as thy Lord willeth: a gift without break.

column2: There were giants in the earth in those days; and also after that, when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, and they bare children to them, the same became mighty men which were of old, men of renown.
column3: And We made a people, considered weak (and of no account), inheritors of lands in both east and west, - lands whereon We sent down Our blessings. The fair promise of thy Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel, because they had patience and constancy, and We levelled to the ground the great works and fine buildings which Pharaoh and his people erected (with such pride).

column2: And God saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.
column3: And to Lut, too, We gave Judgment and Knowledge, and We saved him from the town which practised abominations: truly they were a people given to Evil, a rebellious people.

column2: And it repented the LORD that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him at his heart.
column3: And when the Word is fulfilled against them (the unjust), we shall produce from the earth a beast to (face) them: He will speak to them, for that mankind did not believe with assurance in Our Signs.

column2: And the LORD said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth; both man, and beast, and the creeping thing, and the fowls of the air; for it repenteth me that I have made them.
column3: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! because Thou hast put me in the wrong, I will make (wrong) fair-seeming to them on the earth, and I will put them all in the wrong,-

column2: But Noah found grace in the eyes of the LORD.
column3: Say: I seek refuge with the Lord of the Dawn

column2: These are the generations of Noah: Noah was a just man and perfect in his generations, and Noah walked with God.
column3: And in the creation of yourselves and the fact that animals are scattered (through the earth), are Signs for those of assured Faith.

column2: And Noah begat three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
column3: We have sent thee inspiration, as We sent it to Noah and the Messengers after him: we sent inspiration to Abraham, Isma'il, Isaac, Jacob and the Tribes, to Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and solomon, and to David We gave the Psalms.

column2: The earth also was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.
column3: A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the heavens on high.

column2: And God looked upon the earth, and, behold, it was corrupt; for all flesh had corrupted his way upon the earth.
column3: Before them the People of Noah rejected (their messenger): they rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!", and he was driven out.

column2: And God said unto Noah, The end of all flesh is come before me; for the earth is filled with violence through them; and, behold, I will destroy them with the earth.
column3: Except those on whom thy Lord hath bestowed His Mercy: and for this did He create them: and the Word of thy Lord shall be fulfilled: "I will fill Hell with jinns and men all together."

column2: Make thee an ark of gopher wood; rooms shalt thou make in the ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.
column3: (Commanding), "Make thou coast of mail, balancing well the rings of chain armour, and work ye righteousness; for be sure I see (clearly) all that ye do."

column2: And this is the fashion which thou shalt make it of: The length of the ark shall be three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.
column3: "Further, make him march in a chain, whereof the length is seventy cubits!

column2: A window shalt thou make to the ark, and in a cubit shalt thou finish it above; and the door of the ark shalt thou set in the side thereof; with lower, second, and third stories shalt thou make it.
column3: Remember We made the House a place of assembly for men and a place of safety; and take ye the station of Abraham as a place of prayer; and We covenanted with Abraham and Isma'il, that they should sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or use it as a retreat, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

column2: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; and every thing that is in the earth shall die.
column3: And when the Word is fulfilled against them (the unjust), we shall produce from the earth a beast to (face) them: He will speak to them, for that mankind did not believe with assurance in Our Signs.

column2: But with thee will I establish my covenant; and thou shalt come into the ark, thou, and thy sons, and thy wife, and thy sons' wives with thee.
column3: He said: "I intend to wed one of these my daughters to thee, on condition that thou serve me for eight years; but if thou complete ten years, it will be (grace) from thee. But I intend not to place thee under a difficulty: thou wilt find me, indeed, if Allah wills, one of the righteous."

column2: And of every living thing of all flesh, two of every sort shalt thou bring into the ark, to keep them alive with thee; they shall be male and female.
column3: So We inspired him (with this message): "Construct the Ark within Our sight and under Our guidance: then when comes Our Command, and the fountains of the earth gush forth, take thou on board pairs of every species, male and female, and thy family- except those of them against whom the Word has already gone forth: And address Me not in favour of the wrong-doers; for they shall be drowned (in the Flood).

column2: Of fowls after their kind, and of cattle after their kind, of every creeping thing of the earth after his kind, two of every sort shall come unto thee, to keep them alive.
column3: There is not an animal (that lives) on the earth, nor a being that flies on its wings, but (forms part of) communities like you. Nothing have we omitted from the Book, and they (all) shall be gathered to their Lord in the end.

column2: And take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten, and thou shalt gather it to thee; and it shall be for food for thee, and for them.
column3: It is He Who has made the sea subject, that ye may eat thereof flesh that is fresh and tender, and that ye may extract therefrom ornaments to wear; and thou seest the ships therein that plough the waves, that ye may seek (thus) of the bounty of Allah and that ye may be grateful.

column2: Thus did Noah; according to all that God commanded him, so did he.
column3: The similitude of Jesus before Allah is as that of Adam; He created him from dust, then said to him: "Be". And he was.

column2: And the LORD said unto Noah, Come thou and all thy house into the ark; for thee have I seen righteous before me in this generation.
column3: And when thou hast embarked on the Ark - thou and those with thee,- say: "Praise be to Allah, Who has saved us from the people who do wrong."

column2: Of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee by sevens, the male and his female: and of beasts that are not clean by two, the male and his female.
column3: (Take) eight (head of cattle) in (four) pairs: of sheep a pair, and of goats a pair; say, hath He forbidden the two males, or the two females, or (the young) which the wombs of the two females enclose? Tell me with knowledge if ye are truthful:

column2: Of fowls also of the air by sevens, the male and the female; to keep seed alive upon the face of all the earth.
column3: Then to eat of all the produce (of the earth), and find with skill the spacious paths of its Lord: there issues from within their bodies a drink of varying colours, wherein is healing for men: verily in this is a Sign for those who give thought.

column2: For yet seven days, and I will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights; and every living substance that I have made will I destroy from off the face of the earth.
column3: He created the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; He set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with you; and He scattered through it beasts of all kinds. We send down rain from the sky, and produce on the earth every kind of noble creature, in pairs.

column2: And Noah did according unto all that the LORD commanded him.
column3: So his Lord hearkened to him (in his prayer), and turned away from him their snare: Verily He heareth and knoweth (all things).

column2: And Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth.
column3: (Remember) Noah, when he cried (to Us) aforetime: We listened to his (prayer) and delivered him and his family from great distress.

column2: And Noah went in, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons' wives with him, into the ark, because of the waters of the flood.
column3: But they rejected him, and We delivered him, and those with him, in the Ark: but We overwhelmed in the flood those who rejected Our signs. They were indeed a blind people!

column2: Of clean beasts, and of beasts that are not clean, and of fowls, and of every thing that creepeth upon the earth,
column3: And the flesh of fowls, any that they may desire.

column2: There went in two and two unto Noah into the ark, the male and the female, as God had commanded Noah.
column3: But they rejected him, and We delivered him, and those with him, in the Ark: but We overwhelmed in the flood those who rejected Our signs. They were indeed a blind people!

column2: And it came to pass after seven days, that the waters of the flood were upon the earth.
column3: At length when the messengers arrived among the adherents of Lut,

column2: In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month, the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of heaven were opened.
column3: It is He Who created the Night and the Day, and the sun and the moon: all (the celestial bodies) swim along, each in its rounded course.

column2: And the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights.
column3: Yea, to Him be praise, in the heavens and on earth; and in the late afternoon and when the day begins to decline.

column2: In the selfsame day entered Noah, and Shem, and Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah's wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, into the ark;
column3: We gave him Isaac and Jacob: all (three) guided: and before him, We guided Noah, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron: thus do We reward those who do good:

column2: They, and every beast after his kind, and all the cattle after their kind, and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind, and every fowl after his kind, every bird of every sort.
column3: There is not an animal (that lives) on the earth, nor a being that flies on its wings, but (forms part of) communities like you. Nothing have we omitted from the Book, and they (all) shall be gathered to their Lord in the end.

column2: And they went in unto Noah into the ark, two and two of all flesh, wherein is the breath of life.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And they that went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God had commanded him: and the LORD shut him in.
column3: At length, behold! there came Our command, and the fountains of the earth gushed forth! We said: "Embark therein, of each kind two, male and female, and your family - except those against whom the word has already gone forth,- and the Believers." but only a few believed with him.

column2: And the flood was forty days upon the earth; and the waters increased, and bare up the ark, and it was lift up above the earth.
column3: And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, so the waters met (and rose) to the extent decreed.

column2: And the waters prevailed, and were increased greatly upon the earth; and the ark went upon the face of the waters.
column3: And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, so the waters met (and rose) to the extent decreed.

column2: And the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth; and all the high hills, that were under the whole heaven, were covered.
column3: He created the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; He set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with you; and He scattered through it beasts of all kinds. We send down rain from the sky, and produce on the earth every kind of noble creature, in pairs.

column2: Fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail; and the mountains were covered.
column3: And by the Ocean filled with Swell;-

column2: And all flesh died that moved upon the earth, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of beast, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth, and every man:
column3: He created the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; He set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with you; and He scattered through it beasts of all kinds. We send down rain from the sky, and produce on the earth every kind of noble creature, in pairs.

column2: All in whose nostrils was the breath of life, of all that was in the dry land, died.
column3: From the land that is clean and good, by the will of its Cherisher, springs up produce, (rich) after its kind: but from the land that is bad, springs up nothing but that which is niggardly: thus do we explain the signs by various (symbols) to those who are grateful.

column2: And every living substance was destroyed which was upon the face of the ground, both man, and cattle, and the creeping things, and the fowl of the heaven; and they were destroyed from the earth: and Noah only remained alive, and they that were with him in the ark.
column3: Why was there not a single township (among those We warned), which believed,- so its faith should have profited it,- except the people of Jonah? When they believed, We removed from them the penalty of ignominy in the life of the present, and permitted them to enjoy (their life) for a while.

column2: And the waters prevailed upon the earth an hundred and fifty days.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And God remembered Noah, and every living thing, and all the cattle that was with him in the ark: and God made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters assuaged;
column3: We, when the water (of Noah's Flood) overflowed beyond its limits, carried you (mankind), in the floating (Ark),

column2: The fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained;
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall be amidst (cool) shades and springs (of water).

column2: And the waters returned from off the earth continually: and after the end of the hundred and fifty days the waters were abated.
column3: And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, so the waters met (and rose) to the extent decreed.

column2: And the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of Ararat.
column3: Yea, to Him be praise, in the heavens and on earth; and in the late afternoon and when the day begins to decline.

column2: And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month: in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.
column3: And in the hour of early dawn, they (were found) praying for Forgiveness;

column2: And it came to pass at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made:
column3: And he will conclude that it was (the Time) of Parting;

column2: And he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.
column3: And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, so the waters met (and rose) to the extent decreed.

column2: Also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground;
column3: Then there came on the (garden) a visitation from thy Lord, (which swept away) all around, while they were asleep.

column2: But the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned unto him into the ark, for the waters were on the face of the whole earth: then he put forth his hand, and took her, and pulled her in unto him into the ark.
column3: Thou wouldst have seen the sun, when it rose, declining to the right from their Cave, and when it set, turning away from them to the left, while they lay in the open space in the midst of the Cave. Such are among the Signs of Allah: He whom Allah, guides is rightly guided; but he whom Allah leaves to stray,- for him wilt thou find no protector to lead him to the Right Way.

column2: And he stayed yet other seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark;
column3: And in the hour of early dawn, they (were found) praying for Forgiveness;

column2: And the dove came in to him in the evening; and, lo, in her mouth was an olive leaf plucked off: so Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.
column3: And the Moon,- We have measured for her mansions (to traverse) till she returns like the old (and withered) lower part of a date-stalk.

column2: And he stayed yet other seven days; and sent forth the dove; which returned not again unto him any more.
column3: But the Hoopoe tarried not far: he (came up and) said: "I have compassed (territory) which thou hast not compassed, and I have come to thee from Saba with tidings true.

column2: And it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from off the earth: and Noah removed the covering of the ark, and looked, and, behold, the face of the ground was dry.
column3: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it set in a spring of murky water: Near it he found a People: We said: "O Zul-qarnain! (thou hast authority,) either to punish them, or to treat them with kindness."

column2: And in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dried.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And God spake unto Noah, saying,
column3: But when He trieth him, restricting his subsistence for him, then saith he (in despair), "My Lord hath humiliated me!"

column2: Go forth of the ark, thou, and thy wife, and thy sons, and thy sons' wives with thee.
column3: "And grant, our Lord! that they enter the Gardens of Eternity, which Thou hast promised to them, and to the righteous among their fathers, their wives, and their posterity! For Thou art (He), the Exalted in Might, Full of Wisdom.

column2: Bring forth with thee every living thing that is with thee, of all flesh, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth; that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth.
column3: He created the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; He set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with you; and He scattered through it beasts of all kinds. We send down rain from the sky, and produce on the earth every kind of noble creature, in pairs.

column2: And Noah went forth, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons' wives with him:
column3: We gave him Isaac and Jacob: all (three) guided: and before him, We guided Noah, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron: thus do We reward those who do good:

column2: Every beast, every creeping thing, and every fowl, and whatsoever creepeth upon the earth, after their kinds, went forth out of the ark.
column3: There is not an animal (that lives) on the earth, nor a being that flies on its wings, but (forms part of) communities like you. Nothing have we omitted from the Book, and they (all) shall be gathered to their Lord in the end.

column2: And Noah builded an altar unto the LORD; and took of every clean beast, and of every clean fowl, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.
column3: And the people of Noah,- when they rejected the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them as a Sign for mankind; and We have prepared for (all) wrong-doers a grievous Penalty;-

column2: And the LORD smelled a sweet savor; and the LORD said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living, as I have done.
column3: And when the Word is fulfilled against them (the unjust), we shall produce from the earth a beast to (face) them: He will speak to them, for that mankind did not believe with assurance in Our Signs.

column2: While the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.
column3: Yea, to Him be praise, in the heavens and on earth; and in the late afternoon and when the day begins to decline.

column2: And God blessed Noah and his sons, and said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.
column3: So We sent this inspiration to the mother of Moses: "Suckle (thy child), but when thou hast fears about him, cast him into the river, but fear not nor grieve: for We shall restore him to thee, and We shall make him one of Our messengers."

column2: And the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon every beast of the earth, and upon every fowl of the air, upon all that moveth upon the earth, and upon all the fishes of the sea; into your hand are they delivered.
column3: He created the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; He set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with you; and He scattered through it beasts of all kinds. We send down rain from the sky, and produce on the earth every kind of noble creature, in pairs.

column2: Every moving thing that liveth shall be meat for you; even as the green herb have I given you all things.
column3: A Sign for them is the earth that is dead: We do give it life, and produce grain therefrom, of which ye do eat.

column2: But flesh with the life thereof, which is the blood thereof, shall ye not eat.
column3: A Sign for them is the earth that is dead: We do give it life, and produce grain therefrom, of which ye do eat.

column2: And surely your blood of your lives will I require; at the hand of every beast will I require it, and at the hand of man; at the hand of every man's brother will I require the life of man.
column3: "And O my people! Do whatever ye can: I will do (my part): Soon will ye know who it is on whom descends the penalty of ignominy; and who is a liar! and watch ye! for I too am watching with you!"

column2: Whoso sheddeth man's blood, by man shall his blood be shed: for in the image of God made he man.
column3: Except those on whom thy Lord hath bestowed His Mercy: and for this did He create them: and the Word of thy Lord shall be fulfilled: "I will fill Hell with jinns and men all together."

column2: And you, be ye fruitful, and multiply; bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply therein.
column3: We said: "O Adam! dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden; and eat of the bountiful things therein as (where and when) ye will; but approach not this tree, or ye run into harm and transgression."

column2: And God spake unto Noah, and to his sons with him, saying,
column3: But when He trieth him, restricting his subsistence for him, then saith he (in despair), "My Lord hath humiliated me!"

column2: And I, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your seed after you;
column3: Among His Signs in this, that He created you from dust; and then,- behold, ye are men scattered (far and wide)!

column2: And with every living creature that is with you, of the fowl, of the cattle, and of every beast of the earth with you; from all that go out of the ark, to every beast of the earth.
column3: From the land that is clean and good, by the will of its Cherisher, springs up produce, (rich) after its kind: but from the land that is bad, springs up nothing but that which is niggardly: thus do we explain the signs by various (symbols) to those who are grateful.

column2: And I will establish my covenant with you, neither shall all flesh be cut off any more by the waters of a flood; neither shall there any more be a flood to destroy the earth.
column3: Then guard yourselves against a day when one soul shall not avail another nor shall intercession be accepted for her, nor shall compensation be taken from her, nor shall anyone be helped (from outside).

column2: And God said, This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations:
column3: He said, "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, He Who created them (from nothing): and I am a witness to this (Truth).

column2: I do set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant between me and the earth.
column3: "But whosoever turns away from My Message, verily for him is a life narrowed down, and We shall raise him up blind on the Day of Judgment."

column2: And it shall come to pass, when I bring a cloud over the earth, that the bow shall be seen in the cloud:
column3: Then watch thou for the Day that the sky will bring forth a kind of smoke (or mist) plainly visible,

column2: And I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh; and the waters shall no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.
column3: So We inspired him (with this message): "Construct the Ark within Our sight and under Our guidance: then when comes Our Command, and the fountains of the earth gush forth, take thou on board pairs of every species, male and female, and thy family- except those of them against whom the Word has already gone forth: And address Me not in favour of the wrong-doers; for they shall be drowned (in the Flood).

column2: And the bow shall be in the cloud; and I will look upon it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is upon the earth.
column3: And when the Word is fulfilled against them (the unjust), we shall produce from the earth a beast to (face) them: He will speak to them, for that mankind did not believe with assurance in Our Signs.

column2: And God said unto Noah, This is the token of the covenant, which I have established between me and all flesh that is upon the earth.
column3: And (further) their Prophet said to them: "A Sign of his authority is that there shall come to you the Ark of the covenant, with (an assurance) therein of security from your Lord, and the relics left by the family of Moses and the family of Aaron, carried by angels. In this is a symbol for you if ye indeed have faith."

column2: And the sons of Noah, that went forth of the ark, were Shem, and Ham, and Japheth: and Ham is the father of Canaan.
column3: We gave him Isaac and Jacob: all (three) guided: and before him, We guided Noah, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron: thus do We reward those who do good:

column2: These are the three sons of Noah: and of them was the whole earth overspread.
column3: Before them the People of Noah rejected (their messenger): they rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!", and he was driven out.

column2: And Noah began to be an husbandman, and he planted a vineyard:
column3: (Remember) Noah, when he cried (to Us) aforetime: We listened to his (prayer) and delivered him and his family from great distress.

column2: And he drank of the wine, and was drunken; and he was uncovered within his tent.
column3: But We cast him forth on the naked shore in a state of sickness,

column2: And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brethren without.
column3: When fear had passed from (the mind of) Abraham and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with us for Lut's people.

column2: And Shem and Japheth took a garment, and laid it upon both their shoulders, and went backward, and covered the nakedness of their father; and their faces were backward, and they saw not their father's nakedness.
column3: When Moses came back to his people, angry and grieved, he said: "Evil it is that ye have done in my place in my absence: did ye make haste to bring on the judgment of your Lord?" He put down the tablets, seized his brother by (the hair of) his head, and dragged him to him. Aaron said: "Son of my mother! the people did indeed reckon me as naught, and went near to slaying me! Make not the enemies rejoice over my misfortune, nor count thou me amongst the people of sin."

column2: And Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his younger son had done unto him.
column3: Then the big Fish did swallow him, and he had done acts worthy of blame.

column2: And he said, Cursed be Canaan; a servant of servants shall he be unto his brethren.
column3: Behold! We said to the angels, "Bow down to Adam": They bowed down except Iblis. He was one of the Jinns, and he broke the Command of his Lord. Will ye then take him and his progeny as protectors rather than Me? And they are enemies to you! Evil would be the exchange for the wrong-doers!

column2: And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of Shem; and Canaan shall be his servant.
column3: Were ye witnesses when death appeared before Jacob? Behold, he said to his sons: "What will ye worship after me?" They said: "We shall worship Thy god and the god of thy fathers, of Abraham, Isma'il and Isaac,- the one (True) Allah: To Him we bow (in Islam)."

column2: God shall enlarge Japheth, and he shall dwell in the tents of Shem; and Canaan shall be his servant.
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And Noah lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years.
column3: So they stayed in their Cave three hundred years, and (some) add nine (more)

column2: And all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years: and he died.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth: and unto them were sons born after the flood.
column3: We gave him Isaac and Jacob: all (three) guided: and before him, We guided Noah, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron: thus do We reward those who do good:

column2: The sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And the sons of Gomer; Ashkenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And the sons of Javan; Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: By these were the isles of the Gentiles divided in their lands; every one after his tongue, after their families, in their nations.
column3: But people have cut off their affair (of unity), between them, into sects: each party rejoices in that which is with itself.

column2: And the sons of Ham; Cush, and Mizraim, and Phut, and Canaan.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And the sons of Cush; Seba, and Havilah, and Sabtah, and Raamah, and Sabtechah: and the sons of Raamah; Sheba, and Dedan.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be a mighty one in the earth.
column3: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:

column2: He was a mighty hunter before the LORD: wherefore it is said, Even as Nimrod the mighty hunter before the LORD.
column3: (We also sent) Lut (as a messenger): behold, He said to his people, "Do ye do what is shameful though ye see (its iniquity)?

column2: And the beginning of his kingdom was Babel, and Erech, and Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
column3: And Thamud, and the people of Lut, and the Companions of the Wood; - such were the Confederates.

column2: Out of that land went forth Asshur, and builded Nineveh, and the city Rehoboth, and Calah,
column3: And Thamud, and the people of Lut, and the Companions of the Wood; - such were the Confederates.

column2: And Resen between Nineveh and Calah: the same is a great city.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (out of whom came Philistim,) and Caphtorim.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And Canaan begat Sidon his first born, and Heth,
column3: Before them (were many who) rejected messengers,- the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Pharaoh, the Lord of Stakes,

column2: And the Jebusite, and the Amorite, and the Girgasite,
column3: And another, the third (goddess), Manat?

column2: And the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,
column3: Also mention in the Book the case of Idris: He was a man of truth (and sincerity), (and) a prophet:

column2: And the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite: and afterward were the families of the Canaanites spread abroad.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,
