column2: And Jacob asked him, and said, Tell me, I pray thee, thy name. And he said, Wherefore is it that thou dost ask after my name? And he blessed him there.
column3: If thou couldst but see when they are confronted with their Lord! He will say: "Is not this the truth?" They will say: "Yea, by our Lord!" He will say: "Taste ye then the penalty, because ye rejected Faith."

column2: And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved.
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And as he passed over Penuel the sun rose upon him, and he halted upon his thigh.
column3: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had provided no covering protection against the sun.

column2: Therefore the children of Israel eat not of the sinew which shrank, which is upon the hollow of the thigh, unto this day: because he touched the hollow of Jacob's thigh in the sinew that shrank.
column3: For those who followed the Jewish Law, We forbade every (animal) with undivided hoof, and We forbade them that fat of the ox and the sheep, except what adheres to their backs or their entrails, or is mixed up with a bone: this in recompense for their wilful disobedience: for We are true (in Our ordinances).

column2: And Jacob lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, Esau came, and with him four hundred men. And he divided the children unto Leah, and unto Rachel, and unto the two handmaids.
column3: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

column2: And he put the handmaids and their children foremost, and Leah and her children after, and Rachel and Joseph hindermost.
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: And he passed over before them, and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.
column3: So when they had both submitted their wills (to Allah), and he had laid him prostrate on his forehead (for sacrifice),

column2: And Esau ran to meet him, and embraced him, and fell on his neck, and kissed him: and they wept.
column3: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

column2: And he lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and the children; and said, Who are those with thee? And he said, The children which God hath graciously given thy servant.
column3: So the king said: "Bring ye him unto me." But when the messenger came to him, (Joseph) said: "Go thou back to thy lord, and ask him, 'What is the state of mind of the ladies who cut their hands'? For my Lord is certainly well aware of their snare."

column2: Then the handmaidens came near, they and their children, and they bowed themselves.
column3: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together:

column2: And Leah also with her children came near, and bowed themselves: and after came Joseph near and Rachel, and they bowed themselves.
column3: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

column2: And he said, What meanest thou by all this drove which I met? And he said, These are to find grace in the sight of my lord.
column3: Thus have we sent thee amongst a People before whom (long since) have (other) Peoples (gone and) passed away; in order that thou mightest rehearse unto them what We send down unto thee by inspiration; yet do they reject (Him), the Most Gracious! Say: "He is my Lord! There is no god but He! On Him is my trust, and to Him do I turn!"

column2: And Esau said, I have enough, my brother; keep that thou hast unto thyself.
column3: He said: "So (it will be) thy Lord saith, 'that is easy for Me: I did indeed create thee before, when thou hadst been nothing!'"

column2: And Jacob said, Nay, I pray thee, if now I have found grace in thy sight, then receive my present at my hand: for therefore I have seen thy face, as though I had seen the face of God, and thou wast pleased with me.
column3: So he smiled, amused at her speech; and he said: "O my Lord! so order me that I may be grateful for Thy favours, which thou hast bestowed on me and on my parents, and that I may work the righteousness that will please Thee: And admit me, by Thy Grace, to the ranks of Thy righteous Servants."

column2: Take, I pray thee, my blessing that is brought to thee; because God hath dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough. And he urged him, and he took it.
column3: So he smiled, amused at her speech; and he said: "O my Lord! so order me that I may be grateful for Thy favours, which thou hast bestowed on me and on my parents, and that I may work the righteousness that will please Thee: And admit me, by Thy Grace, to the ranks of Thy righteous Servants."

column2: And he said, Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go before thee.
column3: So he smiled, amused at her speech; and he said: "O my Lord! so order me that I may be grateful for Thy favours, which thou hast bestowed on me and on my parents, and that I may work the righteousness that will please Thee: And admit me, by Thy Grace, to the ranks of Thy righteous Servants."

column2: And he said unto him, My lord knoweth that the children are tender, and the flocks and herds with young are with me: and if men should overdrive them one day, all the flock will die.
column3: And when Our Messengers came to Lut, he was grieved on their account, and felt himself powerless (to protect) them: but they said: "Fear thou not, nor grieve: we are (here) to save thee and thy following, except thy wife: she is of those who lag behind.

column2: Let my lord, I pray thee, pass over before his servant: and I will lead on softly, according as the cattle that goeth before me and the children be able to endure, until I come unto my lord unto Seir.
column3: It is He Who has made the sea subject, that ye may eat thereof flesh that is fresh and tender, and that ye may extract therefrom ornaments to wear; and thou seest the ships therein that plough the waves, that ye may seek (thus) of the bounty of Allah and that ye may be grateful.

column2: And Esau said, Let me now leave with thee some of the folk that are with me. And he said, What needeth it? let me find grace in the sight of my lord.
column3: When My servants ask thee concerning Me, I am indeed close (to them): I listen to the prayer of every suppliant when he calleth on Me: Let them also, with a will, Listen to My call, and believe in Me: That they may walk in the right way.

column2: So Esau returned that day on his way unto Seir.
column3: The people of Lut rejected (his) warning.

column2: And Jacob journeyed to Succoth, and built him an house, and made booths for his cattle: therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.
column3: Remember We made the House a place of assembly for men and a place of safety; and take ye the station of Abraham as a place of prayer; and We covenanted with Abraham and Isma'il, that they should sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or use it as a retreat, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

column2: And Jacob came to Shalem, a city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Padanaram; and pitched his tent before the city.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And he bought a parcel of a field, where he had spread his tent, at the hand of the children of Hamor, Shechem's father, for an hundred pieces of money.
column3: The (Brethren) sold him for a miserable price, for a few dirhams counted out: in such low estimation did they hold him!

column2: And he erected there an altar, and called it EleloheIsrael.
column3: (Before this,) We sent Moses The Book, and appointed his brother Aaron with him as minister;

column2: And Dinah the daughter of Leah, which she bare unto Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, prince of the country, saw her, he took her, and lay with her, and defiled her.
column3: So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them, and they began to sew together the leaves of the garden over their bodies. And their Lord called unto them: "Did I not forbid you that tree, and tell you that Satan was an avowed enemy unto you?"

column2: And his soul clave unto Dinah the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the damsel, and spake kindly unto the damsel.
column3: And We have enjoined on man (to be good) to his parents: in travail upon travail did his mother bear him, and in years twain was his weaning: (hear the command), "Show gratitude to Me and to thy parents: to Me is (thy final) Goal.

column2: And Shechem spake unto his father Hamor, saying, Get me this damsel to wife.
column3: So the king said: "Bring him unto me; I will take him specially to serve about my own person." Therefore when he had spoken to him, he said: "Be assured this day, thou art, before our own presence, with rank firmly established, and fidelity fully proved!

column2: And Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter: now his sons were with his cattle in the field: and Jacob held his peace until they were come.
column3: But they rejected him: Then the mighty Blast seized them, and they lay prostrate in their homes by the morning.

column2: And Hamor the father of Shechem went out unto Jacob to commune with him.
column3: But We delivered him and (his nephew) Lut (and directed them) to the land which We have blessed for the nations.

column2: And the sons of Jacob came out of the field when they heard it: and the men were grieved, and they were very wroth, because he had wrought folly in Israel in lying with Jacob's daughter: which thing ought not to be done.
column3: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

column2: And Hamor communed with them, saying, The soul of my son Shechem longeth for your daughter: I pray you give her him to wife.
column3: There did Zakariya pray to his Lord, saying: "O my Lord! Grant unto me from Thee a progeny that is pure: for Thou art He that heareth prayer!

column2: And make ye marriages with us, and give your daughters unto us, and take our daughters unto you.
column3: And those who pray, "Our Lord! Grant unto us wives and offspring who will be the comfort of our eyes, and give us (the grace) to lead the righteous."

column2: And ye shall dwell with us: and the land shall be before you; dwell and trade ye therein, and get you possessions therein.
column3: We said: "O Adam! dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden; and eat of the bountiful things therein as (where and when) ye will; but approach not this tree, or ye run into harm and transgression."

column2: And Shechem said unto her father and unto her brethren, Let me find grace in your eyes, and what ye shall say unto me I will give.
column3: When My servants ask thee concerning Me, I am indeed close (to them): I listen to the prayer of every suppliant when he calleth on Me: Let them also, with a will, Listen to My call, and believe in Me: That they may walk in the right way.

column2: Ask me never so much dowry and gift, and I will give according as ye shall say unto me: but give me the damsel to wife.
column3: He said, "O my Lord! Forgive me, and grant me a kingdom which, (it may be), suits not another after me: for Thou art the Grantor of Bounties (without measure).

column2: And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father deceitfully, and said, because he had defiled Dinah their sister:
column3: Then they rejected him (as a false prophet), and they hamstrung her. So their Lord, on account of their crime, obliterated their traces and made them equal (in destruction, high and low)!

column2: And they said unto them, We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to one that is uncircumcised; for that were a reproach unto us:
column3: So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them, and they began to sew together the leaves of the garden over their bodies. And their Lord called unto them: "Did I not forbid you that tree, and tell you that Satan was an avowed enemy unto you?"

column2: But in this will we consent unto you: If ye will be as we be, that every male of you be circumcised;
column3: O ye Children of Adam! whenever there come to you messengers from amongst you, rehearsing My signs unto you,- those who are righteous and mend (their lives),- on them shall be no fear nor shall they grieve.

column2: Then will we give our daughters unto you, and we will take your daughters to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people.
column3: It is We Who will inherit the earth, and all beings thereon: to Us will they all be returned.

column2: But if ye will not hearken unto us, to be circumcised; then will we take our daughter, and we will be gone.
column3: "This day shall We save thee in the body, that thou mayest be a sign to those who come after thee! but verily, many among mankind are heedless of Our Signs!"

column2: And their words pleased Hamor, and Shechem Hamor's son.
column3: Not a Sign comes to them from among the Signs of their Lord, but they turn away therefrom.

column2: And the young man deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in Jacob's daughter: and he was more honorable than all the house of his father.
column3: And on them did Satan prove true his idea, and they followed him, all but a party that believed.

column2: And Hamor and Shechem his son came unto the gate of their city, and communed with the men of their city, saying,
column3: When Moses came back to his people, angry and grieved, he said: "Evil it is that ye have done in my place in my absence: did ye make haste to bring on the judgment of your Lord?" He put down the tablets, seized his brother by (the hair of) his head, and dragged him to him. Aaron said: "Son of my mother! the people did indeed reckon me as naught, and went near to slaying me! Make not the enemies rejoice over my misfortune, nor count thou me amongst the people of sin."

column2: These men are peaceable with us; therefore let them dwell in the land, and trade therein; for the land, behold, it is large enough for them; let us take their daughters to us for wives, and let us give them our daughters.
column3: Now when they returned to their father, they said: "O our father! No more measure of grain shall we get (unless we take our brother): So send our brother with us, that we may get our measure; and we will indeed take every care of him."

column2: Only herein will the men consent unto us for to dwell with us, to be one people, if every male among us be circumcised, as they are circumcised.
column3: So We inspired him (with this message): "Construct the Ark within Our sight and under Our guidance: then when comes Our Command, and the fountains of the earth gush forth, take thou on board pairs of every species, male and female, and thy family- except those of them against whom the Word has already gone forth: And address Me not in favour of the wrong-doers; for they shall be drowned (in the Flood).

column2: Shall not their cattle and their substance and every beast of theirs be ours? only let us consent unto them, and they will dwell with us.
column3: And their Lord hath accepted of them, and answered them: "Never will I suffer to be lost the work of any of you, be he male or female: Ye are members, one of another: Those who have left their homes, or been driven out therefrom, or suffered harm in My Cause, or fought or been slain,- verily, I will blot out from them their iniquities, and admit them into Gardens with rivers flowing beneath;- A reward from the presence of Allah, and from His presence is the best of rewards."

column2: And unto Hamor and unto Shechem his son hearkened all that went out of the gate of his city; and every male was circumcised, all that went out of the gate of his city.
column3: And it is He who spread out the earth, and set thereon mountains standing firm and (flowing) rivers: and fruit of every kind He made in pairs, two and two: He draweth the night as a veil o'er the Day. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who consider!

column2: And it came to pass on the third day, when they were sore, that two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brethren, took each man his sword, and came upon the city boldly, and slew all the males.
column3: We settled the Children of Israel in a beautiful dwelling-place, and provided for them sustenance of the best: it was after knowledge had been granted to them, that they fell into schisms. Verily Allah will judge between them as to the schisms amongst them, on the Day of Judgment.

column2: And they slew Hamor and Shechem his son with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah out of Shechem's house, and went out.
column3: But they called to their companion, and he took a sword in hand, and hamstrung (her).

column2: The sons of Jacob came upon the slain, and spoiled the city, because they had defiled their sister.
column3: Then they rejected him (as a false prophet), and they hamstrung her. So their Lord, on account of their crime, obliterated their traces and made them equal (in destruction, high and low)!

column2: They took their sheep, and their oxen, and their asses, and that which was in the city, and that which was in the field,
column3: For those who followed the Jewish Law, We forbade every (animal) with undivided hoof, and We forbade them that fat of the ox and the sheep, except what adheres to their backs or their entrails, or is mixed up with a bone: this in recompense for their wilful disobedience: for We are true (in Our ordinances).

column2: And all their wealth, and all their little ones, and their wives took they captive, and spoiled even all that was in the house.
column3: We sent against them a violent Tornado with showers of stones, (which destroyed them), except Lut's household: them We delivered by early Dawn,-

column2: And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, Ye have troubled me to make me to stink among the inhabitants of the land, among the Canaanites and the Perizzites: and I being few in number, they shall gather themselves together against me, and slay me; and I shall be destroyed, I and my house.
column3: Said the chiefs of Pharaoh's people: "Wilt thou leave Moses and his people, to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon thee and thy gods?" He said: "Their male children will we slay; (only) their females will we save alive; and we have over them (power) irresistible."

column2: And they said, Should he deal with our sister as with an harlot?
column3: They said: "Shall we believe in two men like ourselves? And their people are subject to us!"

column2: And God said unto Jacob, Arise, go up to Bethel, and dwell there: and make there an altar unto God, that appeared unto thee when thou fleddest from the face of Esau thy brother.
column3: Nor wast thou at the side of (the Mountain of) Tur when we called (to Moses). Yet (art thou sent) as Mercy from thy Lord, to give warning to a people to whom no warner had come before thee: in order that they may receive admonition.

column2: Then Jacob said unto his household, and to all that were with him, Put away the strange gods that are among you, and be clean, and change your garments:
column3: So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them, and they began to sew together the leaves of the garden over their bodies. And their Lord called unto them: "Did I not forbid you that tree, and tell you that Satan was an avowed enemy unto you?"

column2: And let us arise, and go up to Bethel; and I will make there an altar unto God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which I went.
column3: "O our Lord! I have made some of my offspring to dwell in a valley without cultivation, by Thy Sacred House; in order, O our Lord, that they may establish regular Prayer: so fill the hearts of some among men with love towards them, and feed them with fruits: so that they may give thanks.

column2: And they gave unto Jacob all the strange gods which were in their hand, and all their earrings which were in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the oak which was by Shechem.
column3: Then after them We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they wrongfully rejected them: So see what was the end of those who made mischief.

column2: And they journeyed: and the terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob.
column3: Hath not the story reached them of those before them?- the People of Noah, and 'Ad, and Thamud; the People of Abraham, the men of Midian, and the cities overthrown. To them came their messengers with clear signs. It is not Allah Who wrongs them, but they wrong their own souls.

column2: So Jacob came to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan, that is, Bethel, he and all the people that were with him.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: And he built there an altar, and called the place Elbethel: because there God appeared unto him, when he fled from the face of his brother.
column3: So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them, and they began to sew together the leaves of the garden over their bodies. And their Lord called unto them: "Did I not forbid you that tree, and tell you that Satan was an avowed enemy unto you?"

column2: But Deborah Rebekah's nurse died, and she was buried beneath Bethel under an oak: and the name of it was called Allonbachuth.
column3: And We made the son of Mary and his mother as a Sign: We gave them both shelter on high ground, affording rest and security and furnished with springs.

column2: And God appeared unto Jacob again, when he came out of Padanaram, and blessed him.
column3: When fear had passed from (the mind of) Abraham and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with us for Lut's people.

column2: And God said unto him, Thy name is Jacob: thy name shall not be called any more Jacob, but Israel shall be thy name: and he called his name Israel.
column3: When Moses came to the place appointed by Us, and his Lord addressed him, He said: "O my Lord! show (Thyself) to me, that I may look upon thee." Allah said: "By no means canst thou see Me (direct); But look upon the mount; if it abide in its place, then shalt thou see Me." When his Lord manifested His glory on the Mount, He made it as dust. And Moses fell down in a swoon. When he recovered his senses he said: "Glory be to Thee! to Thee I turn in repentance, and I am the first to believe."

column2: And God said unto him, I am God Almighty: be fruitful and multiply; a nation and a company of nations shall be of thee, and kings shall come out of thy loins;
column3: "Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and of all that is between them; so worship Him, and be constant and patient in His worship: knowest thou of any who is worthy of the same Name as He?"

column2: And the land which I gave Abraham and Isaac, to thee I will give it, and to thy seed after thee will I give the land.
column3: Except those on whom thy Lord hath bestowed His Mercy: and for this did He create them: and the Word of thy Lord shall be fulfilled: "I will fill Hell with jinns and men all together."

column2: And God went up from him in the place where he talked with him.
column3: (He left them) as they were: We completely understood what was before him.

column2: And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talked with him, even a pillar of stone: and he poured a drink offering thereon, and he poured oil thereon.
column3: "Bring me blocks of iron." At length, when he had filled up the space between the two steep mountain-sides, He said, "Blow (with your bellows)" Then, when he had made it (red) as fire, he said: "Bring me, that I may pour over it, molten lead."

column2: And Jacob called the name of the place where God spake with him, Bethel.
column3: Behold, thy Lord did call to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa:-

column2: And they journeyed from Bethel; and there was but a little way to come to Ephrath: and Rachel travailed, and she had hard labor.
column3: But the Hoopoe tarried not far: he (came up and) said: "I have compassed (territory) which thou hast not compassed, and I have come to thee from Saba with tidings true.

column2: And it came to pass, when she was in hard labor, that the midwife said unto her, Fear not; thou shalt have this son also.
column3: "Behold! thy sister goeth forth and saith, 'shall I show you one who will nurse and rear the (child)?' So We brought thee back to thy mother, that her eye might be cooled and she should not grieve. Then thou didst slay a man, but We saved thee from trouble, and We tried thee in various ways. Then didst thou tarry a number of years with the people of Midian. Then didst thou come hither as ordained, O Moses!

column2: And it came to pass, as her soul was in departing, (for she died) that she called his name Benoni: but his father called him Benjamin.
column3: He went into his garden in a state (of mind) unjust to his soul: He said, "I deem not that this will ever perish,

column2: And Rachel died, and was buried in the way to Ephrath, which is Bethlehem.
column3: (Before this,) We sent Moses The Book, and appointed his brother Aaron with him as minister;

column2: And Jacob set a pillar upon her grave: that is the pillar of Rachel's grave unto this day.
column3: And remember Abraham and Isma'il raised the foundations of the House (With this prayer): "Our Lord! Accept (this service) from us: For Thou art the All-Hearing, the All-knowing.

column2: And Israel journeyed, and spread his tent beyond the tower of Edar.
column3: When fear had passed from (the mind of) Abraham and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with us for Lut's people.

column2: And it came to pass, when Israel dwelt in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father's concubine: and Israel heard it. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve:
column3: On that account: We ordained for the Children of Israel that if any one slew a person - unless it be for murder or for spreading mischief in the land - it would be as if he slew the whole people: and if any one saved a life, it would be as if he saved the life of the whole people. Then although there came to them Our messengers with clear signs, yet, even after that, many of them continued to commit excesses in the land.

column2: The sons of Leah; Reuben, Jacob's firstborn, and Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Zebulun:
column3: We gave him Isaac and Jacob: all (three) guided: and before him, We guided Noah, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron: thus do We reward those who do good:

column2: The sons of Rachel; Joseph, and Benjamin:
column3: And Zakariya and John, and Jesus and Elias: all in the ranks of the righteous:

column2: And the sons of Bilhah, Rachel's handmaid; Dan, and Naphtali:
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And the sons of Zilpah, Leah's handmaid: Gad, and Asher: these are the sons of Jacob, which were born to him in Padanaram.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And Jacob came unto Isaac his father unto Mamre, unto the city of Arba, which is Hebron, where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And the days of Isaac were an hundred and fourscore years.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And Isaac gave up the ghost, and died, and was gathered unto his people, being old and full of days: and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: Now these are the generations of Esau, who is Edom.
column3: The people of Lut rejected (his) warning.

column2: Esau took his wives of the daughters of Canaan; Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite;
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: And Bashemath Ishmael's daughter, sister of Nebajoth.
column3: Those of Abraham and Lut;

column2: And Adah bare to Esau Eliphaz; and Bashemath bare Reuel;
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And Aholibamah bare Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah: these are the sons of Esau, which were born unto him in the land of Canaan.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And Esau took his wives, and his sons, and his daughters, and all the persons of his house, and his cattle, and all his beasts, and all his substance, which he had got in the land of Canaan; and went into the country from the face of his brother Jacob.
column3: We did aforetime grant to the Children of Israel the Book the Power of Command, and Prophethood; We gave them, for Sustenance, things good and pure; and We favoured them above the nations.

column2: For their riches were more than that they might dwell together; and the land wherein they were strangers could not bear them because of their cattle.
column3: Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the End of those before them? They were even superior to them in strength, and in the traces (they have left) in the land: but Allah did call them to account for their sins, and none had they to defend them against Allah.

column2: Thus dwelt Esau in mount Seir: Esau is Edom.
column3: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:

column2: And these are the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in mount Seir:
column3: The 'Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,

column2: These are the names of Esau's sons; Eliphaz the son of Adah the wife of Esau, Reuel the son of Bashemath the wife of Esau.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And the sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, and Gatam, and Kenaz.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And Timna was concubine to Eliphaz Esau's son; and she bare to Eliphaz Amalek: these were the sons of Adah Esau's wife.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And these are the sons of Reuel; Nahath, and Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah: these were the sons of Bashemath Esau's wife.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And these were the sons of Aholibamah, the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon, Esau's wife: and she bare to Esau Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: These were dukes of the sons of Esau: the sons of Eliphaz the firstborn son of Esau; duke Teman, duke Omar, duke Zepho, duke Kenaz,
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: Duke Korah, duke Gatam, and duke Amalek: these are the dukes that came of Eliphaz in the land of Edom; these were the sons of Adah.
column3: As also 'Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.

column2: And these are the sons of Reuel Esau's son; duke Nahath, duke Zerah, duke Shammah, duke Mizzah: these are the dukes that came of Reuel in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Bashemath Esau's wife.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And these are the sons of Aholibamah Esau's wife; duke Jeush, duke Jaalam, duke Korah: these were the dukes that came of Aholibamah the daughter of Anah, Esau's wife.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: These are the sons of Esau, who is Edom, and these are their dukes.
column3: As also 'Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.

column2: These are the sons of Seir the Horite, who inhabited the land; Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah,
column3: And Thamud, and the people of Lut, and the Companions of the Wood; - such were the Confederates.

column2: And Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan: these are the dukes of the Horites, the children of Seir in the land of Edom.
column3: As also 'Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.

column2: And the children of Lotan were Hori and Hemam; and Lotan's sister was Timna.
column3: As also 'Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.

column2: And the children of Shobal were these; Alvan, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And these are the children of Zibeon; both Ajah, and Anah: this was that Anah that found the mules in the wilderness, as he fed the asses of Zibeon his father.
column3: Allah sets forth, for an example to the Unbelievers, the wife of Noah and the wife of Lut: they were (respectively) under two of our righteous servants, but they were false to their (husbands), and they profited nothing before Allah on their account, but were told: "Enter ye the Fire along with (others) that enter!"

column2: And the children of Anah were these; Dishon, and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And these are the children of Dishon; Hemdan, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.
column3: As also 'Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.

column2: The children of Ezer are these; Bilhan, and Zaavan, and Akan.
column3: The 'Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,

column2: The children of Dishan are these; Uz, and Aran.
column3: The 'Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,

column2: These are the dukes that came of the Horites; duke Lotan, duke Shobal, duke Zibeon, duke Anah,
column3: The 'Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,

column2: Duke Dishon, duke Ezer, duke Dishan: these are the dukes that came of Hori, among their dukes in the land of Seir.
column3: The 'Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,

column2: And these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom, before there reigned any king over the children of Israel.
column3: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel, except what Israel Made unlawful for itself, before the Law (of Moses) was revealed. Say: "Bring ye the Law and study it, if ye be men of truth."

column2: And Bela the son of Beor reigned in Edom: and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
column3: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Moses: for he was specially chosen, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.

column2: And Bela died, and Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.
column3: As also 'Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.

column2: And Jobab died, and Husham of the land of Temani reigned in his stead.
column3: As also 'Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.

column2: And Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Avith.
column3: And We made a people, considered weak (and of no account), inheritors of lands in both east and west, - lands whereon We sent down Our blessings. The fair promise of thy Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel, because they had patience and constancy, and We levelled to the ground the great works and fine buildings which Pharaoh and his people erected (with such pride).

column2: And Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.
column3: As also 'Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.

column2: And Samlah died, and Saul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.
column3: But We delivered him and (his nephew) Lut (and directed them) to the land which We have blessed for the nations.

column2: And Saul died, and Baalhanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And Baalhanan the son of Achbor died, and Hadar reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Pau; and his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
column3: To Pharaoh, Haman, and Qarun; but they called (him)" a sorcerer telling lies!"...

column2: And these are the names of the dukes that came of Esau, according to their families, after their places, by their names; duke Timnah, duke Alvah, duke Jetheth,
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: Duke Aholibamah, duke Elah, duke Pinon,
column3: The 'Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,

column2: Duke Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,
column3: The 'Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,

column2: Duke Magdiel, duke Iram: these be the dukes of Edom, according to their habitations in the land of their possession: he is Esau the father of the Edomites.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: And Jacob dwelt in the land wherein his father was a stranger, in the land of Canaan.
column3: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Moses: for he was specially chosen, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.

column2: These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren; and the lad was with the sons of Bilhah, and with the sons of Zilpah, his father's wives: and Joseph brought unto his father their evil report.
column3: We appointed for Moses thirty nights, and completed (the period) with ten (more): thus was completed the term (of communion) with his Lord, forty nights. And Moses had charged his brother Aaron (before he went up): "Act for me amongst my people: Do right, and follow not the way of those who do mischief."

column2: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children, because he was the son of his old age: and he made him a coat of many colors.
column3: The man in Egypt who bought him, said to his wife: "Make his stay (among us) honourable: may be he will bring us much good, or we shall adopt him as a son." Thus did We establish Joseph in the land, that We might teach him the interpretation of stories (and events). And Allah hath full power and control over His affairs; but most among mankind know it not.

column2: And when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him.
column3: So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them, and they began to sew together the leaves of the garden over their bodies. And their Lord called unto them: "Did I not forbid you that tree, and tell you that Satan was an avowed enemy unto you?"

column2: And Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it his brethren: and they hated him yet the more.
column3: And of the two, to that one whom he consider about to be saved, he said: "Mention me to thy lord." But Satan made him forget to mention him to his lord: and (Joseph) lingered in prison a few (more) years.

column2: And he said unto them, Hear, I pray you, this dream which I have dreamed:
column3: Say: "O my Lord! if Thou wilt show me (in my lifetime) that which they are warned against,-

column2: For, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves stood round about, and made obeisance to my sheaf.
column3: And to Solomon (We made) the Wind (obedient): Its early morning (stride) was a month's (journey), and its evening (stride) was a month's (journey); and We made a Font of molten brass to flow for him; and there were Jinns that worked in front of him, by the leave of his Lord, and if any of them turned aside from our command, We made him taste of the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.

column2: And his brethren said to him, Shalt thou indeed reign over us? or shalt thou indeed have dominion over us? And they hated him yet the more for his dreams, and for his words.
column3: If thou couldst but see when they are confronted with their Lord! He will say: "Is not this the truth?" They will say: "Yea, by our Lord!" He will say: "Taste ye then the penalty, because ye rejected Faith."

column2: And he dreamed yet another dream, and told it his brethren, and said, Behold, I have dreamed a dream more; and, behold, the sun and the moon and the eleven stars made obeisance to me.
column3: Then Allah sent a raven, who scratched the ground, to show him how to hide the shame of his brother. "Woe is me!" said he; "Was I not even able to be as this raven, and to hide the shame of my brother?" then he became full of regrets-

column2: And he told it to his father, and to his brethren: and his father rebuked him, and said unto him, What is this dream that thou hast dreamed? Shall I and thy mother and thy brethren indeed come to bow down ourselves to thee to the earth?
column3: They said: "We have had (nothing but) trouble, both before and after thou camest to us." He said: "It may be that your Lord will destroy your enemy and make you inheritors in the earth; that so He may try you by your deeds."

column2: And his brethren envied him; but his father observed the saying.
column3: And (Lut) did warn them of Our Punishment, but they disputed about the Warning.

column2: And his brethren went to feed their father's flock in Shechem.
column3: The people of Lut rejected (his) warning.

column2: And Israel said unto Joseph, Do not thy brethren feed the flock in Shechem? come, and I will send thee unto them. And he said to him, Here am I.
column3: So the king said: "Bring ye him unto me." But when the messenger came to him, (Joseph) said: "Go thou back to thy lord, and ask him, 'What is the state of mind of the ladies who cut their hands'? For my Lord is certainly well aware of their snare."

column2: And he said to him, Go, I pray thee, see whether it be well with thy brethren, and well with the flocks; and bring me word again. So he sent him out of the vale of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.
column3: So the king said: "Bring ye him unto me." But when the messenger came to him, (Joseph) said: "Go thou back to thy lord, and ask him, 'What is the state of mind of the ladies who cut their hands'? For my Lord is certainly well aware of their snare."

column2: And a certain man found him, and, behold, he was wandering in the field: and the man asked him, saying, What seekest thou?
column3: So he saw the morning in the city, looking about, in a state of fear, when behold, the man who had, the day before, sought his help called aloud for his help (again). Moses said to him: "Thou art truly, it is clear, a quarrelsome fellow!"

column2: And he said, I seek my brethren: tell me, I pray thee, where they feed their flocks.
column3: Say: "O my Lord! if Thou wilt show me (in my lifetime) that which they are warned against,-

column2: And the man said, They are departed hence; for I heard them say, Let us go to Dothan. And Joseph went after his brethren, and found them in Dothan.
column3: Behold! A party among them said: "Ye men of Yathrib! ye cannot stand (the attack)! therefore go back!" And a band of them ask for leave of the Prophet, saying, "Truly our houses are bare and exposed," though they were not exposed they intended nothing but to run away.

column2: And when they saw him afar off, even before he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him.
column3: But (there were people) before them, who denied (the Signs),- the People of Noah, and the Confederates (of Evil) after them; and every People plotted against their prophet, to seize him, and disputed by means of vanities, therewith to condemn the Truth; but it was I that seized them! and how (terrible) was My Requital!

column2: And they said one to another, Behold, this dreamer cometh.
column3: The leaders of his people said: "Ah! we see thee evidently wandering (in mind)."

column2: Come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into some pit, and we will say, Some evil beast hath devoured him: and we shall see what will become of his dreams.
column3: They said: "We have had (nothing but) trouble, both before and after thou camest to us." He said: "It may be that your Lord will destroy your enemy and make you inheritors in the earth; that so He may try you by your deeds."

column2: And Reuben heard it, and he delivered him out of their hands; and said, Let us not kill him.
column3: But when he came to the fire, a voice was heard: "O Moses!

column2: And Reuben said unto them, Shed no blood, but cast him into this pit that is in the wilderness, and lay no hand upon him; that he might rid him out of their hands, to deliver him to his father again.
column3: So We sent this inspiration to the mother of Moses: "Suckle (thy child), but when thou hast fears about him, cast him into the river, but fear not nor grieve: for We shall restore him to thee, and We shall make him one of Our messengers."

column2: And it came to pass, when Joseph was come unto his brethren, that they stripped Joseph out of his coat, his coat of many colors that was on him;
column3: So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them, and they began to sew together the leaves of the garden over their bodies. And their Lord called unto them: "Did I not forbid you that tree, and tell you that Satan was an avowed enemy unto you?"

column2: And they took him, and cast him into a pit: and the pit was empty, there was no water in it.
column3: So We seized him and his hosts, and We flung them into the sea: Now behold what was the end of those who did wrong!

column2: And they sat down to eat bread: and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, behold, a company of Ishmaelites came from Gilead with their camels bearing spicery and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to Egypt.
column3: We divided them into twelve tribes or nations. We directed Moses by inspiration, when his (thirsty) people asked him for water: "Strike the rock with thy staff": out of it there gushed forth twelve springs: Each group knew its own place for water. We gave them the shade of clouds, and sent down to them manna and quails, (saying): "Eat of the good things We have provided for you": (but they rebelled); to Us they did no harm, but they harmed their own souls.

column2: And Judah said unto his brethren, What profit is it if we slay our brother, and conceal his blood?
column3: Said the chiefs of Pharaoh's people: "Wilt thou leave Moses and his people, to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon thee and thy gods?" He said: "Their male children will we slay; (only) their females will we save alive; and we have over them (power) irresistible."

column2: Come, and let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, and let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother and our flesh. And his brethren were content.
column3: Behold! We said to the angels, "Bow down to Adam": They bowed down except Iblis. He was one of the Jinns, and he broke the Command of his Lord. Will ye then take him and his progeny as protectors rather than Me? And they are enemies to you! Evil would be the exchange for the wrong-doers!

column2: Then there passed by Midianites merchantmen; and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmaelites for twenty pieces of silver: and they brought Joseph into Egypt.
column3: And We made a people, considered weak (and of no account), inheritors of lands in both east and west, - lands whereon We sent down Our blessings. The fair promise of thy Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel, because they had patience and constancy, and We levelled to the ground the great works and fine buildings which Pharaoh and his people erected (with such pride).

column2: And Reuben returned unto the pit; and, behold, Joseph was not in the pit; and he rent his clothes.
column3: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

column2: And he returned unto his brethren, and said, The child is not; and I, whither shall I go?
column3: Then Allah sent a raven, who scratched the ground, to show him how to hide the shame of his brother. "Woe is me!" said he; "Was I not even able to be as this raven, and to hide the shame of my brother?" then he became full of regrets-

column2: And they took Joseph's coat, and killed a kid of the goats, and dipped the coat in the blood;
column3: So he broke them to pieces, (all) but the biggest of them, that they might turn (and address themselves) to it.

column2: And they sent the coat of many colors, and they brought it to their father; and said, This have we found: know now whether it be thy son's coat or no.
column3: He said: "He says: A heifer not trained to till the soil or water the fields; sound and without blemish." They said: "Now hast thou brought the truth." Then they offered her in sacrifice, but not with good-will.

column2: And he knew it, and said, It is my son's coat; an evil beast hath devoured him; Joseph is without doubt rent in pieces.
column3: She said: "There before you is the man about whom ye did blame me! I did seek to seduce him from his (true) self but he did firmly save himself guiltless!.... and now, if he doth not my bidding, he shall certainly be cast into prison, and (what is more) be of the company of the vilest!"

column2: And Jacob rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his loins, and mourned for his son many days.
column3: But they rejected him: Then the mighty Blast seized them, and they lay prostrate in their homes by the morning.

column2: And all his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted; and he said, For I will go down into the grave unto my son mourning. Thus his father wept for him.
column3: The son replied: "I will betake myself to some mountain: it will save me from the water." Noah said: "This day nothing can save, from the command of Allah, any but those on whom He hath mercy! "And the waves came between them, and the son was among those overwhelmed in the Flood.

column2: And the Midianites sold him into Egypt unto Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh's, and captain of the guard.
column3: To Pharaoh, Haman, and Qarun; but they called (him)" a sorcerer telling lies!"...

column2: And it came to pass at that time, that Judah went down from his brethren, and turned in to a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.
column3: The man in Egypt who bought him, said to his wife: "Make his stay (among us) honourable: may be he will bring us much good, or we shall adopt him as a son." Thus did We establish Joseph in the land, that We might teach him the interpretation of stories (and events). And Allah hath full power and control over His affairs; but most among mankind know it not.

column2: And Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite, whose name was Shuah; and he took her, and went in unto her.
column3: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

column2: And she conceived, and bare a son; and he called his name Er.
column3: From a sperm-drop: He hath created him, and then mouldeth him in due proportions;

column2: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and she called his name Onan.
column3: When she was delivered, she said: "O my Lord! Behold! I am delivered of a female child!"- and Allah knew best what she brought forth- "And no wise is the male Like the female. I have named her Mary, and I commend her and her offspring to Thy protection from the Evil One, the Rejected."

column2: And she yet again conceived, and bare a son; and called his name Shelah: and he was at Chezib, when she bare him.
column3: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

column2: And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, whose name was Tamar.
column3: And, out of Our Mercy, We gave him his brother Aaron, (also) a prophet.

column2: And Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the LORD; and the LORD slew him.
column3: Thus did his Lord choose him and make him of the Company of the Righteous.

column2: And Judah said unto Onan, Go in unto thy brother's wife, and marry her, and raise up seed to thy brother.
column3: Said the chiefs of Pharaoh's people: "Wilt thou leave Moses and his people, to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon thee and thy gods?" He said: "Their male children will we slay; (only) their females will we save alive; and we have over them (power) irresistible."

column2: And Onan knew that the seed should not be his; and it came to pass, when he went in unto his brother's wife, that he spilled it on the ground, lest that he should give seed to his brother.
column3: They said: "We have had (nothing but) trouble, both before and after thou camest to us." He said: "It may be that your Lord will destroy your enemy and make you inheritors in the earth; that so He may try you by your deeds."

column2: And the thing which he did displeased the LORD: wherefore he slew him also.
column3: Or He can cause them to perish because of the (evil) which (the men) have earned; but much doth He forgive.

column2: Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter in law, Remain a widow at thy father's house, till Shelah my son be grown: for he said, Lest peradventure he die also, as his brethren did. And Tamar went and dwelt in her father's house.
column3: "And to you there came Joseph in times gone by, with Clear Signs, but ye ceased not to doubt of the (Mission) for which he had come: At length, when he died, ye said: 'No messenger will Allah send after him.' thus doth Allah leave to stray such as transgress and live in doubt,-

column2: And in process of time the daughter of Shuah Judah's wife died; and Judah was comforted, and went up unto his sheepshearers to Timnath, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.
column3: To the People of Pharaoh, too, aforetime, came Warners (from Allah).

column2: And it was told Tamar, saying, Behold thy father in law goeth up to Timnath to shear his sheep.
column3: For We will send the she-camel by way of trial for them. So watch them, (O Salih), and possess thyself in patience!

column2: And she put her widow's garments off from her, and covered her with a vail, and wrapped herself, and sat in an open place, which is by the way to Timnath; for she saw that Shelah was grown, and she was not given unto him to wife.
column3: "As for the wall, it belonged to two youths, orphans, in the Town; there was, beneath it, a buried treasure, to which they were entitled: their father had been a righteous man: So thy Lord desired that they should attain their age of full strength and get out their treasure - a mercy (and favour) from thy Lord. I did it not of my own accord. Such is the interpretation of (those things) over which thou wast unable to hold patience."

column2: When Judah saw her, he thought her to be an harlot; because she had covered her face.
column3: But his wife came forward (laughing) aloud: she smote her forehead and said: "A barren old woman!"

column2: And he turned unto her by the way, and said, Go to, I pray thee, let me come in unto thee; (for he knew not that she was his daughter in law.) And she said, What wilt thou give me, that thou mayest come in unto me?
column3: "Never said I to them aught except what Thou didst command me to say, to wit, 'worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord'; and I was a witness over them whilst I dwelt amongst them; when Thou didst take me up Thou wast the Watcher over them, and Thou art a witness to all things.

column2: And he said, I will send thee a kid from the flock. And she said, Wilt thou give me a pledge, till thou send it?
column3: Say: "O my Lord! if Thou wilt show me (in my lifetime) that which they are warned against,-

column2: And he said, What pledge shall I give thee? And she said, Thy signet, and thy bracelets, and thy staff that is in thine hand. And he gave it her, and came in unto her, and she conceived by him.
column3: So he smiled, amused at her speech; and he said: "O my Lord! so order me that I may be grateful for Thy favours, which thou hast bestowed on me and on my parents, and that I may work the righteousness that will please Thee: And admit me, by Thy Grace, to the ranks of Thy righteous Servants."

column2: And she arose, and went away, and laid by her vail from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood.
column3: She placed a screen (to screen herself) from them; then We sent her our angel, and he appeared before her as a man in all respects.

column2: And Judah sent the kid by the hand of his friend the Adullamite, to receive his pledge from the woman's hand: but he found her not.
column3: Then after them We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they wrongfully rejected them: So see what was the end of those who made mischief.

column2: Then he asked the men of that place, saying, Where is the harlot, that was openly by the way side? And they said, There was no harlot in this place.
column3: And when he arrived at the watering (place) in Madyan, he found there a group of men watering (their flocks), and besides them he found two women who were keeping back (their flocks). He said: "What is the matter with you?" They said: "We cannot water (our flocks) until the shepherds take back (their flocks): And our father is a very old man."

column2: And he returned to Judah, and said, I cannot find her; and also the men of the place said, that there was no harlot in this place.
column3: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

column2: And Judah said, Let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.
column3: Or do they say, "He has forged it"? Nay, it is the Truth from thy Lord, that thou mayest admonish a people to whom no warner has come before thee: in order that they may receive guidance.

column2: And it came to pass about three months after, that it was told Judah, saying, Tamar thy daughter in law hath played the harlot; and also, behold, she is with child by whoredom. And Judah said, Bring her forth, and let her be burnt.
column3: So he saw the morning in the city, looking about, in a state of fear, when behold, the man who had, the day before, sought his help called aloud for his help (again). Moses said to him: "Thou art truly, it is clear, a quarrelsome fellow!"

column2: When she was brought forth, she sent to her father in law, saying, By the man, whose these are, am I with child: and she said, Discern, I pray thee, whose are these, the signet, and bracelets, and staff.
column3: But she in whose house he was, sought to seduce him from his (true) self: she fastened the doors, and said: "Now come, thou (dear one)!" He said: "Allah forbid! truly (thy husband) is my lord! he made my sojourn agreeable! truly to no good come those who do wrong!"

column2: And Judah acknowledged them, and said, She hath been more righteous than I; because that I gave her not to Shelah my son. And he knew her again no more.
column3: They said: "If he steals, there was a brother of his who did steal before (him)." But these things did Joseph keep locked in his heart, revealing not the secrets to them. He (simply) said (to himself): "Ye are the worse situated; and Allah knoweth best the truth of what ye assert!"

column2: And it came to pass in the time of her travail, that, behold, twins were in her womb.
column3: Such is one of the stories of what happened unseen, which We reveal by inspiration unto thee; nor wast thou (present) with them then when they concerted their plans together in the process of weaving their plots.

column2: And it came to pass, when she travailed, that the one put out his hand: and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a scarlet thread, saying, This came out first.
column3: "As for the wall, it belonged to two youths, orphans, in the Town; there was, beneath it, a buried treasure, to which they were entitled: their father had been a righteous man: So thy Lord desired that they should attain their age of full strength and get out their treasure - a mercy (and favour) from thy Lord. I did it not of my own accord. Such is the interpretation of (those things) over which thou wast unable to hold patience."

column2: And it came to pass, as he drew back his hand, that, behold, his brother came out: and she said, How hast thou broken forth? this breach be upon thee: therefore his name was called Pharez.
column3: So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them, and they began to sew together the leaves of the garden over their bodies. And their Lord called unto them: "Did I not forbid you that tree, and tell you that Satan was an avowed enemy unto you?"

column2: And afterward came out his brother, that had the scarlet thread upon his hand: and his name was called Zarah.
column3: And, out of Our Mercy, We gave him his brother Aaron, (also) a prophet.

column2: And Joseph was brought down to Egypt; and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him of the hands of the Ishmaelites, which had brought him down thither.
column3: "The ways and means of (reaching) the heavens, and that I may mount up to the god of Moses: But as far as I am concerned, I think (Moses) is a liar!" Thus was made alluring, in Pharaoh's eyes, the evil of his deeds, and he was hindered from the Path; and the plot of Pharaoh led to nothing but perdition (for him).

column2: And the LORD was with Joseph, and he was a prosperous man; and he was in the house of his master the Egyptian.
column3: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

column2: And his master saw that the LORD was with him, and that the LORD made all that he did to prosper in his hand.
column3: But his Lord chose him (for His Grace): He turned to him, and gave him Guidance.

column2: And Joseph found grace in his sight, and he served him: and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had he put into his hand.
column3: But his Lord chose him (for His Grace): He turned to him, and gave him Guidance.

column2: And it came to pass from the time that he had made him overseer in his house, and over all that he had, that the LORD blessed the Egyptian's house for Joseph's sake; and the blessing of the LORD was upon all that he had in the house, and in the field.
column3: The man in Egypt who bought him, said to his wife: "Make his stay (among us) honourable: may be he will bring us much good, or we shall adopt him as a son." Thus did We establish Joseph in the land, that We might teach him the interpretation of stories (and events). And Allah hath full power and control over His affairs; but most among mankind know it not.

column2: And he left all that he had in Joseph's hand; and he knew not ought he had, save the bread which he did eat. And Joseph was a goodly person, and well favored.
column3: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

column2: And it came to pass after these things, that his master's wife cast her eyes upon Joseph; and she said, Lie with me.
column3: So the king said: "Bring ye him unto me." But when the messenger came to him, (Joseph) said: "Go thou back to thy lord, and ask him, 'What is the state of mind of the ladies who cut their hands'? For my Lord is certainly well aware of their snare."

column2: But he refused, and said unto his master's wife, Behold, my master wotteth not what is with me in the house, and he hath committed all that he hath to my hand;
column3: She said: "O my Lord! How shall I have a son when no man hath touched me?" He said: "Even so: Allah createth what He willeth: When He hath decreed a plan, He but saith to it, 'Be,' and it is!

column2: There is none greater in this house than I; neither hath he kept back any thing from me but thee, because thou art his wife: how then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?
column3: "But if they strive to make thee join in worship with Me things of which thou hast no knowledge, obey them not; yet bear them company in this life with justice (and consideration), and follow the way of those who turn to me (in love): in the end the return of you all is to Me, and I will tell you the truth (and meaning) of all that ye did."

column2: And it came to pass, as she spake to Joseph day by day, that he hearkened not unto her, to lie by her, or to be with her.
column3: So his Lord hearkened to him (in his prayer), and turned away from him their snare: Verily He heareth and knoweth (all things).

column2: And it came to pass about this time, that Joseph went into the house to do his business; and there was none of the men of the house there within.
column3: We certainly gave the Book to Moses, but differences arose therein: had it not been that a word had gone forth before from thy Lord, the matter would have been decided between them, but they are in suspicious doubt concerning it.

column2: And she caught him by his garment, saying, Lie with me: and he left his garment in her hand, and fled, and got him out.
column3: But they called to their companion, and he took a sword in hand, and hamstrung (her).

column2: And it came to pass, when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and was fled forth,
column3: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

column2: That she called unto the men of her house, and spake unto them, saying, See, he hath brought in an Hebrew unto us to mock us; he came in unto me to lie with me, and I cried with a loud voice:
column3: So the king said: "Bring ye him unto me." But when the messenger came to him, (Joseph) said: "Go thou back to thy lord, and ask him, 'What is the state of mind of the ladies who cut their hands'? For my Lord is certainly well aware of their snare."

column2: And it came to pass, when he heard that I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled, and got him out.
column3: So We listened to him: We removed the distress that was on him, and We restored his people to him, and doubled their number,- as a Grace from Ourselves, and a thing for commemoration, for all who serve Us.

column2: And she laid up his garment by her, until his lord came home.
column3: But his Lord chose him (for His Grace): He turned to him, and gave him Guidance.

column2: And she spake unto him according to these words, saying, The Hebrew servant, which thou hast brought unto us, came in unto me to mock me:
column3: They said (to Moses): "Whatever be the Signs thou bringest, to work therewith thy sorcery on us, we shall never believe in thee.

column2: And it came to pass, as I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled out.
column3: He went into his garden in a state (of mind) unjust to his soul: He said, "I deem not that this will ever perish,

column2: And it came to pass, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spake unto him, saying, After this manner did thy servant to me; that his wrath was kindled.
column3: So the king said: "Bring ye him unto me." But when the messenger came to him, (Joseph) said: "Go thou back to thy lord, and ask him, 'What is the state of mind of the ladies who cut their hands'? For my Lord is certainly well aware of their snare."

column2: And Joseph's master took him, and put him into the prison, a place where the king's prisoners were bound: and he was there in the prison.
column3: And of the two, to that one whom he consider about to be saved, he said: "Mention me to thy lord." But Satan made him forget to mention him to his lord: and (Joseph) lingered in prison a few (more) years.

column2: But the LORD was with Joseph, and showed him mercy, and gave him favor in the sight of the keeper of the prison.
column3: But his Lord chose him (for His Grace): He turned to him, and gave him Guidance.

column2: And the keeper of the prison committed to Joseph's hand all the prisoners that were in the prison; and whatsoever they did there, he was the doer of it.
column3: "That We might try them by that (means). But if any turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will cause him to undergo a severe Penalty.

column2: The keeper of the prison looked not to any thing that was under his hand; because the LORD was with him, and that which he did, the LORD made it to prosper.
column3: "That We might try them by that (means). But if any turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will cause him to undergo a severe Penalty.

column2: And it came to pass after these things, that the butler of the king of Egypt and his baker had offended their lord the king of Egypt.
column3: "The ways and means of (reaching) the heavens, and that I may mount up to the god of Moses: But as far as I am concerned, I think (Moses) is a liar!" Thus was made alluring, in Pharaoh's eyes, the evil of his deeds, and he was hindered from the Path; and the plot of Pharaoh led to nothing but perdition (for him).

column2: And Pharaoh was wroth against two of his officers, against the chief of the butlers, and against the chief of the bakers.
column3: To establish a firm place for them in the land, and to show Pharaoh, Haman, and their hosts, at their hands, the very things against which they were taking precautions.

column2: And he put them in ward in the house of the captain of the guard, into the prison, the place where Joseph was bound.
column3: They said: "Keep him and his brother in suspense (for a while); and send to the cities men to collect-

column2: And the captain of the guard charged Joseph with them, and he served them: and they continued a season in ward.
column3: We did, before them, try the people of Pharaoh: there came to them a messenger most honourable,

column2: And they dreamed a dream both of them, each man his dream in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream, the butler and the baker of the king of Egypt, which were bound in the prison.
column3: Then sent We our messengers in succession: every time there came to a people their messenger, they accused him of falsehood: so We made them follow each other (in punishment): We made them as a tale (that is told): So away with a people that will not believe!

column2: And Joseph came in unto them in the morning, and looked upon them, and, behold, they were sad.
column3: So the king said: "Bring ye him unto me." But when the messenger came to him, (Joseph) said: "Go thou back to thy lord, and ask him, 'What is the state of mind of the ladies who cut their hands'? For my Lord is certainly well aware of their snare."

column2: And he asked Pharaoh's officers that were with him in the ward of his lord's house, saying, Wherefore look ye so sadly to day?
column3: Say: "If ye had control of the Treasures of the Mercy of my Lord, behold, ye would keep them back, for fear of spending them: for man is (every) niggardly!"

column2: And they said unto him, We have dreamed a dream, and there is no interpreter of it. And Joseph said unto them, Do not interpretations belong to God? tell me them, I pray you.
column3: So the king said: "Bring ye him unto me." But when the messenger came to him, (Joseph) said: "Go thou back to thy lord, and ask him, 'What is the state of mind of the ladies who cut their hands'? For my Lord is certainly well aware of their snare."

column2: And the chief butler told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, In my dream, behold, a vine was before me;
column3: And of the two, to that one whom he consider about to be saved, he said: "Mention me to thy lord." But Satan made him forget to mention him to his lord: and (Joseph) lingered in prison a few (more) years.

column2: And in the vine were three branches: and it was as though it budded, and her blossoms shot forth; and the clusters thereof brought forth ripe grapes:
column3: And it is He who spread out the earth, and set thereon mountains standing firm and (flowing) rivers: and fruit of every kind He made in pairs, two and two: He draweth the night as a veil o'er the Day. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who consider!

column2: And Pharaoh's cup was in my hand: and I took the grapes, and pressed them into Pharaoh's cup, and I gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand.
column3: "Then he brought out (of the fire) before the (people) the image of a calf: It seemed to low: so they said: This is your god, and the god of Moses, but (Moses) has forgotten!"

column2: And Joseph said unto him, This is the interpretation of it: The three branches are three days:
column3: Before this We wrote in the Psalms, after the Message (given to Moses): My servants the righteous, shall inherit the earth."

column2: Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thine head, and restore thee unto thy place: and thou shalt deliver Pharaoh's cup into his hand, after the former manner when thou wast his butler.
column3: When some trouble toucheth man, he crieth unto his Lord, turning to Him in repentance: but when He bestoweth a favour upon him as from Himself, (man) doth forget what he cried and prayed for before, and he doth set up rivals unto Allah, thus misleading others from Allah's Path. Say, "Enjoy thy blasphemy for a little while: verily thou art (one) of the Companions of the Fire!"

column2: But think on me when it shall be well with thee, and show kindness, I pray thee, unto me, and make mention of me unto Pharaoh, and bring me out of this house:
column3: So he smiled, amused at her speech; and he said: "O my Lord! so order me that I may be grateful for Thy favours, which thou hast bestowed on me and on my parents, and that I may work the righteousness that will please Thee: And admit me, by Thy Grace, to the ranks of Thy righteous Servants."

column2: For indeed I was stolen away out of the land of the Hebrews: and here also have I done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon.
column3: "This, because ye used to take the Signs of Allah in jest, and the life of the world deceived you:" (From) that Day, therefore, they shall not be taken out thence, nor shall they be received into Grace.

column2: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said unto Joseph, I also was in my dream, and, behold, I had three white baskets on my head:
column3: And remember, Jesus, the son of Mary, said: "O Children of Israel! I am the messenger of Allah (sent) to you, confirming the Law (which came) before me, and giving Glad Tidings of a Messenger to come after me, whose name shall be Ahmad." But when he came to them with Clear Signs, they said, "this is evident sorcery!"

column2: And in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of bakemeats for Pharaoh; and the birds did eat them out of the basket upon my head.
column3: And in the earth are tracts (diverse though) neighbouring, and gardens of vines and fields sown with corn, and palm trees - growing out of single roots or otherwise: watered with the same water, yet some of them We make more excellent than others to eat. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who understand!

column2: And Joseph answered and said, This is the interpretation thereof: The three baskets are three days:
column3: And in Moses (was another Sign): Behold, We sent him to Pharaoh, with authority manifest.

column2: Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee, and shall hang thee on a tree; and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee.
column3: "'Throw (the child) into the chest, and throw (the chest) into the river: the river will cast him up on the bank, and he will be taken up by one who is an enemy to Me and an enemy to him': But I cast (the garment of) love over thee from Me: and (this) in order that thou mayest be reared under Mine eye.

column2: And it came to pass the third day, which was Pharaoh's birthday, that he made a feast unto all his servants: and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and of the chief baker among his servants.
column3: Then the people of Pharaoh picked him up (from the river): (It was intended) that (Moses) should be to them an adversary and a cause of sorrow: for Pharaoh and Haman and (all) their hosts were men of sin.

column2: And he restored the chief butler unto his butlership again; and he gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand:
column3: But (Pharaoh) turned back with his Chiefs, and said, "A sorcerer, or one possessed!"

column2: But he hanged the chief baker: as Joseph had interpreted to them.
column3: And (Lut) did warn them of Our Punishment, but they disputed about the Warning.

column2: Yet did not the chief butler remember Joseph, but forgat him.
column3: And on them did Satan prove true his idea, and they followed him, all but a party that believed.

column2: And it came to pass at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river.
column3: To Moses We did give Nine Clear Signs: As the Children of Israel: when he came to them, Pharaoh said to him: "O Moses! I consider thee, indeed, to have been worked upon by sorcery!

column2: And, behold, there came up out of the river seven well favored kine and fatfleshed; and they fed in a meadow.
column3: Behold, there were brought before him, at eventide coursers of the highest breeding, and swift of foot;

column2: And, behold, seven other kine came up after them out of the river, ill favored and leanfleshed; and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river.
column3: Behold, there were brought before him, at eventide coursers of the highest breeding, and swift of foot;

column2: And the ill favored and leanfleshed kine did eat up the seven well favored and fat kine. So Pharaoh awoke.
