I will take thee and raise thee to Myself and clear thee (of the falsehoods) of those who blaspheme; I will make those who follow thee superior to those who reject faith, to the Day of Resurrection: Then shall ye all return unto me, and I will judge between you of the matters wherein ye dispute.

column2: And he said, Thou canst not see my face: for there shall no man see me, and live.
column3: "Never said I to them aught except what Thou didst command me to say, to wit, 'worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord'; and I was a witness over them whilst I dwelt amongst them; when Thou didst take me up Thou wast the Watcher over them, and Thou art a witness to all things.

column2: And the LORD said, Behold, there is a place by me, and thou shalt stand upon a rock:
column3: We said: "O Adam! dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden; and eat of the bountiful things therein as (where and when) ye will; but approach not this tree, or ye run into harm and transgression."

column2: And it shall come to pass, while my glory passeth by, that I will put thee in a cleft of the rock, and will cover thee with my hand while I pass by:
column3: "'Throw (the child) into the chest, and throw (the chest) into the river: the river will cast him up on the bank, and he will be taken up by one who is an enemy to Me and an enemy to him': But I cast (the garment of) love over thee from Me: and (this) in order that thou mayest be reared under Mine eye.

column2: And I will take away mine hand, and thou shalt see my back parts: but my face shall not be seen.
column3: "Move thy hand into thy bosom, and it will come forth white without stain (or harm), and draw thy hand close to thy side (to guard) against fear. Those are the two credentials from thy Lord to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: for truly they are a people rebellious and wicked."

column2: And the LORD said unto Moses, Hew thee two tables of stone like unto the first: and I will write upon these tables the words that were in the first tables, which thou brakest.
column3: Nor wast thou at the side of (the Mountain of) Tur when we called (to Moses). Yet (art thou sent) as Mercy from thy Lord, to give warning to a people to whom no warner had come before thee: in order that they may receive admonition.

column2: And be ready in the morning, and come up in the morning unto mount Sinai, and present thyself there to me in the top of the mount.
column3: Bear, then, with patience, all that they say, and celebrate the praises of thy Lord, before the rising of the sun and before (its) setting.

column2: And no man shall come up with thee, neither let any man be seen throughout all the mount; neither let the flocks nor herds feed before that mount.
column3: One Day We shall remove the mountains, and thou wilt see the earth as a level stretch, and We shall gather them, all together, nor shall We leave out any one of them.

column2: And he hewed two tables of stone like unto the first; and Moses rose up early in the morning, and went up unto mount Sinai, as the LORD had commanded him, and took in his hand the two tables of stone.
column3: When Moses came to the place appointed by Us, and his Lord addressed him, He said: "O my Lord! show (Thyself) to me, that I may look upon thee." Allah said: "By no means canst thou see Me (direct); But look upon the mount; if it abide in its place, then shalt thou see Me." When his Lord manifested His glory on the Mount, He made it as dust. And Moses fell down in a swoon. When he recovered his senses he said: "Glory be to Thee! to Thee I turn in repentance, and I am the first to believe."

column2: And the LORD descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of the LORD.
column3: But his Lord chose him (for His Grace): He turned to him, and gave him Guidance.

column2: And the LORD passed by before him, and proclaimed, The LORD, The LORD God, merciful and gracious, long-suffering, and abundant in goodness and truth,
column3: Celebrate the praises of thy Lord, and pray for His Forgiveness: For He is Oft-Returning (in Grace and Mercy).

column2: Keeping mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, and that will by no means clear the guilty; visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the children's children, unto the third and to the fourth generation.
column3: This day are (all) things good and pure made lawful unto you. The food of the People of the Book is lawful unto you and yours is lawful unto them. (Lawful unto you in marriage) are (not only) chaste women who are believers, but chaste women among the People of the Book, revealed before your time,- when ye give them their due dowers, and desire chastity, not lewdness, nor secret intrigues if any one rejects faith, fruitless is his work, and in the Hereafter he will be in the ranks of those who have lost (all spiritual good).

column2: And Moses made haste, and bowed his head toward the earth, and worshipped.
column3: So the magicians were thrown down to prostration: they said, "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses".

column2: And he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O LORD, let my LORD, I pray thee, go among us; for it is a stiffnecked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.
column3: "(And to preach thus), 'Seek ye the forgiveness of your Lord, and turn to Him in repentance; that He may grant you enjoyment, good (and true), for a term appointed, and bestow His abounding grace on all who abound in merit! But if ye turn away, then I fear for you the penalty of a great day:

column2: And he said, Behold, I make a covenant: before all thy people I will do marvels, such as have not been done in all the earth, nor in any nation: and all the people among which thou art shall see the work of the LORD: for it is a terrible thing that I will do with thee.
column3: "But if they strive to make thee join in worship with Me things of which thou hast no knowledge, obey them not; yet bear them company in this life with justice (and consideration), and follow the way of those who turn to me (in love): in the end the return of you all is to Me, and I will tell you the truth (and meaning) of all that ye did."

column2: Observe thou that which I command thee this day: behold, I drive out before thee the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
column3: "And O my people! let not my dissent (from you) cause you to sin, lest ye suffer a fate similar to that of the people of Noah or of Hud or of Salih, nor are the people of Lut far off from you!

column2: Take heed to thyself, lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land whither thou goest, lest it be for a snare in the midst of thee:
column3: Perchance thou mayest (feel the inclination) to give up a part of what is revealed unto thee, and thy heart feeleth straitened lest they say, "Why is not a treasure sent down unto him, or why does not an angel come down with him?" But thou art there only to warn! It is Allah that arrangeth all affairs!

column2: But ye shall destroy their altars, break their images, and cut down their groves:
column3: The Day that the shin shall be laid bare, and they shall be summoned to bow in adoration, but they shall not be able,-

column2: For thou shalt worship no other god: for the LORD, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God:
column3: (He is) Lord of the East and the West: there is no god but He: take Him therefore for (thy) Disposer of Affairs.

column2: Lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, and they go a whoring after their gods, and do sacrifice unto their gods, and one call thee, and thou eat of his sacrifice;
column3: It is He Who has made the sea subject, that ye may eat thereof flesh that is fresh and tender, and that ye may extract therefrom ornaments to wear; and thou seest the ships therein that plough the waves, that ye may seek (thus) of the bounty of Allah and that ye may be grateful.

column2: And thou take of their daughters unto thy sons, and their daughters go a whoring after their gods, and make thy sons go a whoring after their gods.
column3: Said the chiefs of Pharaoh's people: "Wilt thou leave Moses and his people, to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon thee and thy gods?" He said: "Their male children will we slay; (only) their females will we save alive; and we have over them (power) irresistible."

column2: Thou shalt make thee no molten gods.
column3: So call not on any other god with Allah, or thou wilt be among those under the Penalty.

column2: The feast of unleavened bread shalt thou keep. Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread, as I commanded thee, in the time of the month Abib: for in the month Abib thou camest out from Egypt.
column3: Remember that morning Thou didst leave Thy household (early) to post the faithful at their stations for battle: And Allah heareth and knoweth all things:

column2: All that openeth the matrix is mine; and every firstling among thy cattle, whether ox or sheep, that is male.
column3: (Take) eight (head of cattle) in (four) pairs: of sheep a pair, and of goats a pair; say, hath He forbidden the two males, or the two females, or (the young) which the wombs of the two females enclose? Tell me with knowledge if ye are truthful:

column2: But the firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb: and if thou redeem him not, then shalt thou break his neck. All the firstborn of thy sons thou shalt redeem. And none shall appear before me empty.
column3: And Moses chose seventy of his people for Our place of meeting: when they were seized with violent quaking, he prayed: "O my Lord! if it had been Thy will Thou couldst have destroyed, long before, both them and me: wouldst Thou destroy us for the deeds of the foolish ones among us? this is no more than Thy trial: by it Thou causest whom Thou wilt to stray, and Thou leadest whom Thou wilt into the right path. Thou art our Protector: so forgive us and give us Thy mercy; for Thou art the best of those who forgive.

column2: Six days thou shalt work, but on the seventh day thou shalt rest: in earing time and in harvest thou shalt rest.
column3: O thou man! Verily thou art ever toiling on towards thy Lord- painfully toiling,- but thou shalt meet Him.

column2: And thou shalt observe the feast of weeks, of the firstfruits of wheat harvest, and the feast of ingathering at the year's end.
column3: Establish regular prayers - at the sun's decline till the darkness of the night, and the morning prayer and reading: for the prayer and reading in the morning carry their testimony.

column2: Thrice in the year shall all your men children appear before the LORD God, the God of Israel.
column3: Moses said: "I have indeed called upon my Lord and your Lord (for protection) from every arrogant one who believes not in the Day of Account!"

column2: For I will cast out the nations before thee, and enlarge thy borders: neither shall any man desire thy land, when thou shalt go up to appear before the LORD thy God thrice in the year.
column3: Behold! Allah said: "O Jesus! I will take thee and raise thee to Myself and clear thee (of the falsehoods) of those who blaspheme; I will make those who follow thee superior to those who reject faith, to the Day of Resurrection: Then shall ye all return unto me, and I will judge between you of the matters wherein ye dispute.

column2: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leaven; neither shall the sacrifice of the feast of the passover be left unto the morning.
column3: "Nor hath he any food except the corruption from the washing of wounds,

column2: The first of the firstfruits of thy land thou shalt bring unto the house of the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother's milk.
column3: It is He Who has made the sea subject, that ye may eat thereof flesh that is fresh and tender, and that ye may extract therefrom ornaments to wear; and thou seest the ships therein that plough the waves, that ye may seek (thus) of the bounty of Allah and that ye may be grateful.

column2: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write thou these words: for after the tenor of these words I have made a covenant with thee and with Israel.
column3: Nor wast thou at the side of (the Mountain of) Tur when we called (to Moses). Yet (art thou sent) as Mercy from thy Lord, to give warning to a people to whom no warner had come before thee: in order that they may receive admonition.

column2: And he was there with the LORD forty days and forty nights; he did neither eat bread, nor drink water. And he wrote upon the tables the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.
column3: We appointed for Moses thirty nights, and completed (the period) with ten (more): thus was completed the term (of communion) with his Lord, forty nights. And Moses had charged his brother Aaron (before he went up): "Act for me amongst my people: Do right, and follow not the way of those who do mischief."

column2: And it came to pass, when Moses came down from mount Sinai with the two tables of testimony in Moses' hand, when he came down from the mount, that Moses wist not that the skin of his face shone while he talked with him.
column3: The people of Moses made, in his absence, out of their ornaments, the image of calf, (for worship): it seemed to low: did they not see that it could neither speak to them, nor show them the way? They took it for worship and they did wrong.

column2: And when Aaron and all the children of Israel saw Moses, behold, the skin of his face shone; and they were afraid to come nigh him.
column3: Said Moses: "Throw ye (first)." So when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people, and struck terror into them: for they showed a great (feat of) magic.

column2: And Moses called unto them; and Aaron and all the rulers of the congregation returned unto him: and Moses talked with them.
column3: We took the Children of Israel (with safety) across the sea. They came upon a people devoted entirely to some idols they had. They said: "O Moses! fashion for us a god like unto the gods they have." He said: "Surely ye are a people without knowledge.

column2: And afterward all the children of Israel came nigh: and he gave them in commandment all that the LORD had spoken with him in mount Sinai.
column3: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel, except what Israel Made unlawful for itself, before the Law (of Moses) was revealed. Say: "Bring ye the Law and study it, if ye be men of truth."

column2: And till Moses had done speaking with them, he put a vail on his face.
column3: Then the big Fish did swallow him, and he had done acts worthy of blame.

column2: But when Moses went in before the LORD to speak with him, he took the vail off, until he came out. And he came out, and spake unto the children of Israel that which he was commanded.
column3: When Moses came to the place appointed by Us, and his Lord addressed him, He said: "O my Lord! show (Thyself) to me, that I may look upon thee." Allah said: "By no means canst thou see Me (direct); But look upon the mount; if it abide in its place, then shalt thou see Me." When his Lord manifested His glory on the Mount, He made it as dust. And Moses fell down in a swoon. When he recovered his senses he said: "Glory be to Thee! to Thee I turn in repentance, and I am the first to believe."

column2: And the children of Israel saw the face of Moses, that the skin of Moses' face shone: and Moses put the vail upon his face again, until he went in to speak with him.
column3: The people of Moses made, in his absence, out of their ornaments, the image of calf, (for worship): it seemed to low: did they not see that it could neither speak to them, nor show them the way? They took it for worship and they did wrong.

column2: And Moses gathered all the congregation of the children of Israel together, and said unto them, These are the words which the LORD hath commanded, that ye should do them.
column3: When Moses came to the place appointed by Us, and his Lord addressed him, He said: "O my Lord! show (Thyself) to me, that I may look upon thee." Allah said: "By no means canst thou see Me (direct); But look upon the mount; if it abide in its place, then shalt thou see Me." When his Lord manifested His glory on the Mount, He made it as dust. And Moses fell down in a swoon. When he recovered his senses he said: "Glory be to Thee! to Thee I turn in repentance, and I am the first to believe."

column2: Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be to you an holy day, a sabbath of rest to the LORD: whosoever doeth work therein shall be put to death.
column3: But set thou thy face to the right Religion before there come from Allah the Day which there is no chance of averting: on that Day shall men be divided (in two).

column2: Ye shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations upon the sabbath day.
column3: "And to those straying in Evil, the Fire will be placed in full view;

column2: And Moses spake unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which the LORD commanded, saying,
column3: We did send Moses aforetime, with Our Signs, to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: He said, "I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds."

column2: Take ye from among you an offering unto the LORD: whosoever is of a willing heart, let him bring it, an offering of the LORD; gold, and silver, and brass,
column3: "And (appoint him) a messenger to the Children of Israel, (with this message): "'I have come to you, with a Sign from your Lord, in that I make for you out of clay, as it were, the figure of a bird, and breathe into it, and it becomes a bird by Allah's leave: And I heal those born blind, and the lepers, and I quicken the dead, by Allah's leave; and I declare to you what ye eat, and what ye store in your houses. Surely therein is a Sign for you if ye did believe;

column2: And blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair,
column3: And Olives and Dates,

column2: And rams' skins dyed red, and badgers' skins, and shittim wood,
column3: But they turned away (from Allah), and We sent against them the Flood (released) from the dams, and We converted their two garden (rows) into "gardens" producing bitter fruit, and tamarisks, and some few (stunted) Lote-trees.

column2: And oil for the light, and spices for anointing oil, and for the sweet incense,
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

column2: And onyx stones, and stones to be set for the ephod, and for the breastplate.
column3: In addition there will be maces of iron (to punish) them.

column2: And every wise hearted among you shall come, and make all that the LORD hath commanded;
column3: And those who are blessed shall be in the Garden: They will dwell therein for all the time that the heavens and the earth endure, except as thy Lord willeth: a gift without break.

column2: The tabernacle, his tent, and his covering, his taches, and his boards, his bars, his pillars, and his sockets,
column3: For them there is Hell, as a couch (below) and folds and folds of covering above: such is Our requital of those who do wrong.

column2: The ark, and the staves thereof, with the mercy seat, and the vail of the covering,
column3: By the Firmament which returns (in its round),

column2: The table, and his staves, and all his vessels, and the showbread,
column3: It is He Who produceth gardens, with trellises and without, and dates, and tilth with produce of all kinds, and olives and pomegranates, similar (in kind) and different (in variety): eat of their fruit in their season, but render the dues that are proper on the day that the harvest is gathered. But waste not by excess: for Allah loveth not the wasters.

column2: The candlestick also for the light, and his furniture, and his lamps, with the oil for the light,
column3: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,

column2: And the incense altar, and his staves, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the door at the entering in of the tabernacle,
column3: Behold! We gave the site, to Abraham, of the (Sacred) House, (saying): "Associate not anything (in worship) with Me; and sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or stand up, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

column2: The altar of burnt offering, with his brazen grate, his staves, and all his vessels, the laver and his foot,
column3: For such the reward is forgiveness from their Lord, and Gardens with rivers flowing underneath,- an eternal dwelling: How excellent a recompense for those who work (and strive)!

column2: The hangings of the court, his pillars, and their sockets, and the hanging for the door of the court,
column3: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,

column2: The pins of the tabernacle, and the pins of the court, and their cords,
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall be amidst (cool) shades and springs (of water).

column2: The cloths of service, to do service in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office.
column3: In the past We granted to Moses and Aaron the criterion (for judgment), and a Light and a Message for those who would do right,-

column2: And all the congregation of the children of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And they came, every one whose heart stirred him up, and every one whom his spirit made willing, and they brought the LORD's offering to the work of the tabernacle of the congregation, and for all his service, and for the holy garments.
column3: And Mary the daughter of 'Imran, who guarded her chastity; and We breathed into (her body) of Our spirit; and she testified to the truth of the words of her Lord and of His Revelations, and was one of the devout (servants).

column2: And they came, both men and women, as many as were willing hearted, and brought bracelets, and earrings, and rings, and tablets, all jewels of gold: and every man that offered, offered an offering of gold unto the LORD.
column3: Upon them will be green Garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, and they will be adorned with Bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give to them to drink of a Wine Pure and Holy.

column2: And every man, with whom was found blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair, and red skins of rams, and badgers' skins, brought them.
column3: It is He Who produceth gardens, with trellises and without, and dates, and tilth with produce of all kinds, and olives and pomegranates, similar (in kind) and different (in variety): eat of their fruit in their season, but render the dues that are proper on the day that the harvest is gathered. But waste not by excess: for Allah loveth not the wasters.

column2: Every one that did offer an offering of silver and brass brought the LORD's offering: and every man, with whom was found shittim wood for any work of the service, brought it.
column3: Then to eat of all the produce (of the earth), and find with skill the spacious paths of its Lord: there issues from within their bodies a drink of varying colours, wherein is healing for men: verily in this is a Sign for those who give thought.

column2: And all the women that were wise hearted did spin with their hands, and brought that which they had spun, both of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, and of fine linen.
column3: And in the earth are tracts (diverse though) neighbouring, and gardens of vines and fields sown with corn, and palm trees - growing out of single roots or otherwise: watered with the same water, yet some of them We make more excellent than others to eat. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who understand!

column2: And all the women whose heart stirred them up in wisdom spun goats' hair.
column3: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:

column2: And the rulers brought onyx stones, and stones to be set, for the ephod, and for the breastplate;
column3: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,

column2: And spice, and oil for the light, and for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense.
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

column2: The children of Israel brought a willing offering unto the LORD, every man and woman, whose heart made them willing to bring for all manner of work, which the LORD had commanded to be made by the hand of Moses.
column3: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel, except what Israel Made unlawful for itself, before the Law (of Moses) was revealed. Say: "Bring ye the Law and study it, if ye be men of truth."

column2: And Moses said unto the children of Israel, See, the LORD hath called by name Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah;
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And he hath filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship;
column3: To Him be glory throughout the heavens and the earth: and He is Exalted in Power, Full of Wisdom!

column2: And to devise curious works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,
column3: For that they were wont to be indulged, before that, in wealth (and luxury),

column2: And in the cutting of stones, to set them, and in carving of wood, to make any manner of cunning work.
column3: It is Allah Who made your habitations homes of rest and quiet for you; and made for you, out of the skins of animals, (tents for) dwellings, which ye find so light (and handy) when ye travel and when ye stop (in your travels); and out of their wool, and their soft fibres (between wool and hair), and their hair, rich stuff and articles of convenience (to serve you) for a time.

column2: And he hath put in his heart that he may teach, both he, and Aholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: Them hath he filled with wisdom of heart, to work all manner of work, of the engraver, and of the cunning workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, and in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of them that do any work, and of those that devise cunning work.
column3: It is He Who produceth gardens, with trellises and without, and dates, and tilth with produce of all kinds, and olives and pomegranates, similar (in kind) and different (in variety): eat of their fruit in their season, but render the dues that are proper on the day that the harvest is gathered. But waste not by excess: for Allah loveth not the wasters.

column2: Then wrought Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whom the LORD put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all manner of work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that the LORD had commanded.
column3: Moreover, We gave Moses the Book, completing (Our favour) to those who would do right, and explaining all things in detail,- and a guide and a mercy, that they might believe in the meeting with their Lord.

column2: And Moses called Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whose heart the LORD had put wisdom, even every one whose heart stirred him up to come unto the work to do it:
column3: Moreover, We gave Moses the Book, completing (Our favour) to those who would do right, and explaining all things in detail,- and a guide and a mercy, that they might believe in the meeting with their Lord.

column2: And they received of Moses all the offering, which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, to make it withal. And they brought yet unto him free offerings every morning.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And all the wise men, that wrought all the work of the sanctuary, came every man from his work which they made;
column3: And when the Word is fulfilled against them (the unjust), we shall produce from the earth a beast to (face) them: He will speak to them, for that mankind did not believe with assurance in Our Signs.

column2: And they spake unto Moses, saying, The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work, which the LORD commanded to make.
column3: We appointed for Moses thirty nights, and completed (the period) with ten (more): thus was completed the term (of communion) with his Lord, forty nights. And Moses had charged his brother Aaron (before he went up): "Act for me amongst my people: Do right, and follow not the way of those who do mischief."

column2: And Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary. So the people were restrained from bringing.
column3: We appointed for Moses thirty nights, and completed (the period) with ten (more): thus was completed the term (of communion) with his Lord, forty nights. And Moses had charged his brother Aaron (before he went up): "Act for me amongst my people: Do right, and follow not the way of those who do mischief."

column2: For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.
column3: And of no avail to them was all that they did (with such art and care)!

column2: And every wise hearted man among them that wrought the work of the tabernacle made ten curtains of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: with cherubim of cunning work made he them.
column3: And in the earth are tracts (diverse though) neighbouring, and gardens of vines and fields sown with corn, and palm trees - growing out of single roots or otherwise: watered with the same water, yet some of them We make more excellent than others to eat. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who understand!

column2: The length of one curtain was twenty and eight cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: the curtains were all of one size.
column3: And was at a distance of but two bow-lengths or (even) nearer;

column2: And he coupled the five curtains one unto another: and the other five curtains he coupled one unto another.
column3: "'See ye not how Allah has created the seven heavens one above another,

column2: And he made loops of blue on the edge of one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling: likewise he made in the uttermost side of another curtain, in the coupling of the second.
column3: And the Moon,- We have measured for her mansions (to traverse) till she returns like the old (and withered) lower part of a date-stalk.

column2: Fifty loops made he in one curtain, and fifty loops made he in the edge of the curtain which was in the coupling of the second: the loops held one curtain to another.
column3: To every people is a term appointed: when their term is reached, not an hour can they cause delay, nor (an hour) can they advance (it in anticipation).

column2: And he made fifty taches of gold, and coupled the curtains one unto another with the taches: so it became one tabernacle.
column3: So He completed them as seven firmaments in two Days, and He assigned to each heaven its duty and command. And We adorned the lower heaven with lights, and (provided it) with guard. Such is the Decree of (Him) the Exalted in Might, Full of Knowledge.

column2: And he made curtains of goats' hair for the tent over the tabernacle: eleven curtains he made them.
column3: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:

column2: The length of one curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits was the breadth of one curtain: the eleven curtains were of one size.
column3: And was at a distance of but two bow-lengths or (even) nearer;

column2: And he coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
column3: And cushions set in rows,

column2: And he made fifty loops upon the uttermost edge of the curtain in the coupling, and fifty loops made he upon the edge of the curtain which coupleth the second.
column3: "Further, make him march in a chain, whereof the length is seventy cubits!

column2: And he made fifty taches of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one.
column3: "Indeed it throws about sparks (huge) as Forts,

column2: And he made a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering of badgers' skins above that.
column3: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:

column2: And he made boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood, standing up.
column3: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:

column2: The length of a board was ten cubits, and the breadth of a board one cubit and a half.
column3: And was at a distance of but two bow-lengths or (even) nearer;

column2: One board had two tenons, equally distant one from another: thus did he make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
column3: And a Sign for them is that We bore their race (through the Flood) in the loaded Ark;

column2: And he made boards for the tabernacle; twenty boards for the south side southward:
column3: Forsooth, each one of them wants to be given scrolls (of revelation) spread out!

column2: And forty sockets of silver he made under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for his two tenons, and two sockets under another board for his two tenons.
column3: To it are seven gates: for each of those gates is a (special) class (of sinners) assigned.

column2: And for the other side of the tabernacle, which is toward the north corner, he made twenty boards,
column3: Set forth to them the parable of two men: for one of them We provided two gardens of grape-vines and surrounded them with date palms; in between the two We placed corn-fields.

column2: And their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
column3: In them (each) will be two Springs flowing (free);

column2: And for the sides of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.
column3: It shall be made into a vault over them,

column2: And two boards made he for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides.
column3: It shall be made into a vault over them,

column2: And they were coupled beneath, and coupled together at the head thereof, to one ring: thus he did to both of them in both the corners.
column3: Except with those joined to them in the marriage bond, or (the captives) whom their right hands possess,- for (in their case) they are free from blame,

column2: And there were eight boards; and their sockets were sixteen sockets of silver, under every board two sockets.
column3: In them (each) will be two Springs pouring forth water in continuous abundance:

column2: And he made bars of shittim wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
column3: Forsooth, each one of them wants to be given scrolls (of revelation) spread out!

column2: And five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the sides westward.
column3: Forsooth, each one of them wants to be given scrolls (of revelation) spread out!

column2: And he made the middle bar to shoot through the boards from the one end to the other.
column3: Plucking out (his being) right to the skull!-

column2: And he overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold to be places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
column3: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,

column2: And he made a vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubim made he it of cunning work.
column3: They will recline on Carpets, whose inner linings will be of rich brocade: the Fruit of the Gardens will be near (and easy of reach).

column2: And he made thereunto four pillars of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold: their hooks were of gold; and he cast for them four sockets of silver.
column3: Upon them will be green Garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, and they will be adorned with Bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give to them to drink of a Wine Pure and Holy.

column2: And he made an hanging for the tabernacle door of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, of needlework;
column3: They will recline on Carpets, whose inner linings will be of rich brocade: the Fruit of the Gardens will be near (and easy of reach).

column2: And the five pillars of it with their hooks: and he overlaid their chapiters and their fillets with gold: but their five sockets were of brass.
column3: They worked for him as he desired, (making) arches, images, basons as large as reservoirs, and (cooking) cauldrons fixed (in their places): "Work ye, sons of David, with thanks! but few of My servants are grateful!"

column2: And Bezaleel made the ark of shittim wood: two cubits and a half was the length of it, and a cubit and a half the breadth of it, and a cubit and a half the height of it:
column3: And to Solomon (We made) the Wind (obedient): Its early morning (stride) was a month's (journey), and its evening (stride) was a month's (journey); and We made a Font of molten brass to flow for him; and there were Jinns that worked in front of him, by the leave of his Lord, and if any of them turned aside from our command, We made him taste of the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.

column2: And he overlaid it with pure gold within and without, and made a crown of gold to it round about.
column3: Upon them will be green Garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, and they will be adorned with Bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give to them to drink of a Wine Pure and Holy.

column2: And he cast for it four rings of gold, to be set by the four corners of it; even two rings upon the one side of it, and two rings upon the other side of it.
column3: And to Solomon (We made) the Wind (obedient): Its early morning (stride) was a month's (journey), and its evening (stride) was a month's (journey); and We made a Font of molten brass to flow for him; and there were Jinns that worked in front of him, by the leave of his Lord, and if any of them turned aside from our command, We made him taste of the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.

column2: And he made staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.
column3: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:

column2: And he put the staves into the rings by the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.
column3: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:

column2: And he made the mercy seat of pure gold: two cubits and a half was the length thereof, and one cubit and a half the breadth thereof.
column3: And was at a distance of but two bow-lengths or (even) nearer;

column2: And he made two cherubim of gold, beaten out of one piece made he them, on the two ends of the mercy seat;
column3: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:

column2: One cherub on the end on this side, and another cherub on the other end on that side: out of the mercy seat made he the cherubim on the two ends thereof.
column3: Behold, two (guardian angels) appointed to learn (his doings) learn (and noted them), one sitting on the right and one on the left.

column2: And the cherubim spread out their wings on high, and covered with their wings over the mercy seat, with their faces one to another; even to the mercy seatward were the faces of the cherubim.
column3: They will recline (with ease) on Thrones (of dignity) arranged in ranks; and We shall join them to Companions, with beautiful big and lustrous eyes.

column2: And he made the table of shittim wood: two cubits was the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof:
column3: And was at a distance of but two bow-lengths or (even) nearer;

column2: And he overlaid it with pure gold, and made thereunto a crown of gold round about.
column3: Upon them will be green Garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, and they will be adorned with Bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give to them to drink of a Wine Pure and Holy.

column2: Also he made thereunto a border of an handbreadth round about; and made a crown of gold for the border thereof round about.
column3: "Further, make him march in a chain, whereof the length is seventy cubits!

column2: And he cast for it four rings of gold, and put the rings upon the four corners that were in the four feet thereof.
column3: Set forth to them the parable of two men: for one of them We provided two gardens of grape-vines and surrounded them with date palms; in between the two We placed corn-fields.

column2: Over against the border were the rings, the places for the staves to bear the table.
column3: In addition there will be maces of iron (to punish) them.

column2: And he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold, to bear the table.
column3: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:

column2: And he made the vessels which were upon the table, his dishes, and his spoons, and his bowls, and his covers to cover withal, of pure gold.
column3: Upon them will be green Garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, and they will be adorned with Bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give to them to drink of a Wine Pure and Holy.

column2: And he made the candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work made he the candlestick; his shaft, and his branch, his bowls, his knops, and his flowers, were of the same:
column3: It is He Who produceth gardens, with trellises and without, and dates, and tilth with produce of all kinds, and olives and pomegranates, similar (in kind) and different (in variety): eat of their fruit in their season, but render the dues that are proper on the day that the harvest is gathered. But waste not by excess: for Allah loveth not the wasters.

column2: And six branches going out of the sides thereof; three branches of the candlestick out of the one side thereof, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side thereof:
column3: (Take) eight (head of cattle) in (four) pairs: of sheep a pair, and of goats a pair; say, hath He forbidden the two males, or the two females, or (the young) which the wombs of the two females enclose? Tell me with knowledge if ye are truthful:

column2: Three bowls made after the fashion of almonds in one branch, a knop and a flower; and three bowls made like almonds in another branch, a knop and a flower: so throughout the six branches going out of the candlestick.
column3: Among Talh trees with flowers (or fruits) piled one above another,-

column2: And in the candlestick were four bowls made like almonds, his knops, and his flowers:
column3: With goblets, (shining) beakers, and cups (filled) out of clear-flowing fountains:

column2: And a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, according to the six branches going out of it.
column3: And the parable of an evil Word is that of an evil tree: It is torn up by the root from the surface of the earth: it has no stability.

column2: Their knops and their branches were of the same: all of it was one beaten work of pure gold.
column3: Crystal-clear, made of silver: they will determine the measure thereof (according to their wishes).

column2: And he made his seven lamps, and his snuffers, and his snuffdishes, of pure gold.
column3: And to Solomon (We made) the Wind (obedient): Its early morning (stride) was a month's (journey), and its evening (stride) was a month's (journey); and We made a Font of molten brass to flow for him; and there were Jinns that worked in front of him, by the leave of his Lord, and if any of them turned aside from our command, We made him taste of the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.

column2: Of a talent of pure gold made he it, and all the vessels thereof.
column3: Then to eat of all the produce (of the earth), and find with skill the spacious paths of its Lord: there issues from within their bodies a drink of varying colours, wherein is healing for men: verily in this is a Sign for those who give thought.

column2: And he made the incense altar of shittim wood: the length of it was a cubit, and the breadth of it a cubit; it was foursquare; and two cubits was the height of it; the horns thereof were of the same.
column3: And to Solomon (We made) the Wind (obedient): Its early morning (stride) was a month's (journey), and its evening (stride) was a month's (journey); and We made a Font of molten brass to flow for him; and there were Jinns that worked in front of him, by the leave of his Lord, and if any of them turned aside from our command, We made him taste of the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.

column2: And he overlaid it with pure gold, both the top of it, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns of it: also he made unto it a crown of gold round about.
column3: Upon them will be green Garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, and they will be adorned with Bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give to them to drink of a Wine Pure and Holy.

column2: And he made two rings of gold for it under the crown thereof, by the two corners of it, upon the two sides thereof, to be places for the staves to bear it withal.
column3: Remember We made the House a place of assembly for men and a place of safety; and take ye the station of Abraham as a place of prayer; and We covenanted with Abraham and Isma'il, that they should sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or use it as a retreat, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

column2: And he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.
column3: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:

column2: And he made the holy anointing oil, and the pure incense of sweet spices, according to the work of the apothecary.
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

column2: And he made the altar of burnt offering of shittim wood: five cubits was the length thereof, and five cubits the breadth thereof; it was foursquare; and three cubits the height thereof.
column3: And to Solomon (We made) the Wind (obedient): Its early morning (stride) was a month's (journey), and its evening (stride) was a month's (journey); and We made a Font of molten brass to flow for him; and there were Jinns that worked in front of him, by the leave of his Lord, and if any of them turned aside from our command, We made him taste of the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.

column2: And he made the horns thereof on the four corners of it; the horns thereof were of the same: and he overlaid it with brass.
column3: Set forth to them the parable of two men: for one of them We provided two gardens of grape-vines and surrounded them with date palms; in between the two We placed corn-fields.

column2: And he made all the vessels of the altar, the pots, and the shovels, and the basins, and the fleshhooks, and the firepans: all the vessels thereof made he of brass.
column3: They worked for him as he desired, (making) arches, images, basons as large as reservoirs, and (cooking) cauldrons fixed (in their places): "Work ye, sons of David, with thanks! but few of My servants are grateful!"

column2: And he made for the altar a brazen grate of network under the compass thereof beneath unto the midst of it.
column3: For them there is Hell, as a couch (below) and folds and folds of covering above: such is Our requital of those who do wrong.

column2: And he cast four rings for the four ends of the grate of brass, to be places for the staves.
column3: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:

column2: And he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with brass.
column3: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:

column2: And he put the staves into the rings on the sides of the altar, to bear it withal; he made the altar hollow with boards.
column3: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:

column2: And he made the laver of brass, and the foot of it of brass, of the lookingglasses of the women assembling, which assembled at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
column3: Remember We made the House a place of assembly for men and a place of safety; and take ye the station of Abraham as a place of prayer; and We covenanted with Abraham and Isma'il, that they should sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or use it as a retreat, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

column2: And he made the court: on the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, an hundred cubits:
column3: They will recline on Carpets, whose inner linings will be of rich brocade: the Fruit of the Gardens will be near (and easy of reach).

column2: Their pillars were twenty, and their brazen sockets twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
column3: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,

column2: And for the north side the hangings were an hundred cubits, their pillars were twenty, and their sockets of brass twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
column3: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,

column2: And for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
column3: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,

column2: And for the east side eastward fifty cubits.
column3: By the sky, (displaying) the Zodiacal Signs;

column2: The hangings of the one side of the gate were fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
column3: Among Talh trees with flowers (or fruits) piled one above another,-

column2: And for the other side of the court gate, on this hand and that hand, were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
column3: Set forth to them the parable of two men: for one of them We provided two gardens of grape-vines and surrounded them with date palms; in between the two We placed corn-fields.

column2: All the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen.
column3: They will recline on Carpets, whose inner linings will be of rich brocade: the Fruit of the Gardens will be near (and easy of reach).

column2: And the sockets for the pillars were of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver; and the overlaying of their chapiters of silver; and all the pillars of the court were filleted with silver.
column3: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,

column2: And the hanging for the gate of the court was needlework, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: and twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, answerable to the hangings of the court.
column3: It is He Who produceth gardens, with trellises and without, and dates, and tilth with produce of all kinds, and olives and pomegranates, similar (in kind) and different (in variety): eat of their fruit in their season, but render the dues that are proper on the day that the harvest is gathered. But waste not by excess: for Allah loveth not the wasters.

column2: And their pillars were four, and their sockets of brass four; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their chapiters and their fillets of silver.
column3: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,

column2: And all the pins of the tabernacle, and of the court round about, were of brass.
column3: And corn-fields and noble buildings,

column2: This is the sum of the tabernacle, even of the tabernacle of testimony, as it was counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, son to Aaron the priest.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And Bezaleel the son Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And with him was Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and a cunning workman, and an embroiderer in blue, and in purple, and in scarlet, and fine linen.
column3: Remember We made the House a place of assembly for men and a place of safety; and take ye the station of Abraham as a place of prayer; and We covenanted with Abraham and Isma'il, that they should sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or use it as a retreat, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

column2: All the gold that was occupied for the work in all the work of the holy place, even the gold of the offering, was twenty and nine talents, and seven hundred and thirty shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
column3: So He completed them as seven firmaments in two Days, and He assigned to each heaven its duty and command. And We adorned the lower heaven with lights, and (provided it) with guard. Such is the Decree of (Him) the Exalted in Might, Full of Knowledge.

column2: And the silver of them that were numbered of the congregation was an hundred talents, and a thousand seven hundred and threescore and fifteen shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary:
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: A bekah for every man, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for every one that went to be numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty men.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And of the hundred talents of silver were cast the sockets of the sanctuary, and the sockets of the vail; an hundred sockets of the hundred talents, a talent for a socket.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And of the thousand seven hundred seventy and five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, and overlaid their chapiters, and filleted them.
column3: So He completed them as seven firmaments in two Days, and He assigned to each heaven its duty and command. And We adorned the lower heaven with lights, and (provided it) with guard. Such is the Decree of (Him) the Exalted in Might, Full of Knowledge.

column2: And the brass of the offering was seventy talents, and two thousand and four hundred shekels.
column3: The (Brethren) sold him for a miserable price, for a few dirhams counted out: in such low estimation did they hold him!

column2: And therewith he made the sockets to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and the brazen altar, and the brazen grate for it, and all the vessels of the altar,
column3: And (further) their Prophet said to them: "A Sign of his authority is that there shall come to you the Ark of the covenant, with (an assurance) therein of security from your Lord, and the relics left by the family of Moses and the family of Aaron, carried by angels. In this is a symbol for you if ye indeed have faith."

column2: And the sockets of the court round about, and the sockets of the court gate, and all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins of the court round about.
column3: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,

column2: And of the blue, and purple, and scarlet, they made cloths of service, to do service in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron; as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: We appointed for Moses thirty nights, and completed (the period) with ten (more): thus was completed the term (of communion) with his Lord, forty nights. And Moses had charged his brother Aaron (before he went up): "Act for me amongst my people: Do right, and follow not the way of those who do mischief."

column2: And he made the ephod of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
column3: They will recline on Carpets, whose inner linings will be of rich brocade: the Fruit of the Gardens will be near (and easy of reach).

column2: And they did beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into wires, to work it in the blue, and in the purple, and in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, with cunning work.
column3: Upon them will be green Garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, and they will be adorned with Bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give to them to drink of a Wine Pure and Holy.

column2: They made shoulderpieces for it, to couple it together: by the two edges was it coupled together.
column3: Or that the Unseen in it their hands, and they write it down?

column2: And the curious girdle of his ephod, that was upon it, was of the same, according to the work thereof; of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen; as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: And before this, was the Book of Moses as a guide and a mercy: And this Book confirms (it) in the Arabic tongue; to admonish the unjust, and as Glad Tidings to those who do right.

column2: And they wrought onyx stones inclosed in ouches of gold, graven, as signets are graven, with the names of the children of Israel.
column3: We gave Moses the Book and followed him up with a succession of messengers; We gave Jesus the son of Mary Clear (Signs) and strengthened him with the holy spirit. Is it that whenever there comes to you a messenger with what ye yourselves desire not, ye are puffed up with pride?- Some ye called impostors, and others ye slay!

column2: And he put them on the shoulders of the ephod, that they should be stones for a memorial to the children of Israel; as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And he made the breastplate of cunning work, like the work of the ephod; of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
column3: Upon them will be green Garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, and they will be adorned with Bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give to them to drink of a Wine Pure and Holy.

column2: It was foursquare; they made the breastplate double: a span was the length thereof, and a span the breadth thereof, being doubled.
column3: And was at a distance of but two bow-lengths or (even) nearer;

column2: And they set in it four rows of stones: the first row was a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle: this was the first row.
column3: When Our Decree issued, We turned (the cities) upside down, and rained down on them brimstones hard as baked clay, spread, layer on layer,-

column2: And the second row, an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
column3: And another, the third (goddess), Manat?

column2: And the third row, a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.
column3: Like unto Rubies and coral.

column2: And the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper: they were inclosed in ouches of gold in their inclosings.
column3: Crystal-clear, made of silver: they will determine the measure thereof (according to their wishes).

column2: And the stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, like the engravings of a signet, every one with his name, according to the twelve tribes.
column3: And We made a people, considered weak (and of no account), inheritors of lands in both east and west, - lands whereon We sent down Our blessings. The fair promise of thy Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel, because they had patience and constancy, and We levelled to the ground the great works and fine buildings which Pharaoh and his people erected (with such pride).

column2: And they made upon the breastplate chains at the ends, of wreathed work of pure gold.
column3: They will recline (with ease) on Thrones (of dignity) arranged in ranks; and We shall join them to Companions, with beautiful big and lustrous eyes.

column2: And they made two ouches of gold, and two gold rings; and put the two rings in the two ends of the breastplate.
column3: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,

column2: And they put the two wreathed chains of gold in the two rings on the ends of the breastplate.
column3: (They will be) on Thrones encrusted (with gold and precious stones),

column2: And the two ends of the two wreathed chains they fastened in the two ouches, and put them on the shoulderpieces of the ephod, before it.
column3: When the yokes (shall be) round their necks, and the chains; they shall be dragged along-

column2: And they made two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastplate, upon the border of it, which was on the side of the ephod inward.
column3: When the yokes (shall be) round their necks, and the chains; they shall be dragged along-

column2: And they made two other golden rings, and put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath, toward the forepart of it, over against the other coupling thereof, above the curious girdle of the ephod.
column3: And the Moon,- We have measured for her mansions (to traverse) till she returns like the old (and withered) lower part of a date-stalk.

column2: And they did bind the breastplate by his rings unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be above the curious girdle of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not be loosed from the ephod; as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: And (further) their Prophet said to them: "A Sign of his authority is that there shall come to you the Ark of the covenant, with (an assurance) therein of security from your Lord, and the relics left by the family of Moses and the family of Aaron, carried by angels. In this is a symbol for you if ye indeed have faith."

column2: And he made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue.
column3: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:

column2: And there was an hole in the midst of the robe, as the hole of an habergeon, with a band round about the hole, that it should not rend.
column3: Then, when We decreed (Solomon's) death, nothing showed them his death except a little worm of the earth, which kept (slowly) gnawing away at his staff: so when he fell down, the Jinns saw plainly that if they had known the unseen, they would not have tarried in the humiliating Penalty (of their Task).

column2: And they made upon the hems of the robe pomegranates of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen.
column3: They will recline on Carpets, whose inner linings will be of rich brocade: the Fruit of the Gardens will be near (and easy of reach).

column2: And they made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates upon the hem of the robe, round about between the pomegranates;
column3: They will recline on Carpets, whose inner linings will be of rich brocade: the Fruit of the Gardens will be near (and easy of reach).

column2: A bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, round about the hem of the robe to minister in; as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: We gave Moses the Book and followed him up with a succession of messengers; We gave Jesus the son of Mary Clear (Signs) and strengthened him with the holy spirit. Is it that whenever there comes to you a messenger with what ye yourselves desire not, ye are puffed up with pride?- Some ye called impostors, and others ye slay!

column2: And they made coats of fine linen of woven work for Aaron, and for his sons,
column3: And because they were patient and constant, He will reward them with a Garden and (garments of) silk.

column2: And a mitre of fine linen, and goodly bonnets of fine linen, and linen breeches of fine twined linen,
column3: Upon them will be green Garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, and they will be adorned with Bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give to them to drink of a Wine Pure and Holy.

column2: And a girdle of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, of needlework; as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: Upon them will be green Garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, and they will be adorned with Bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give to them to drink of a Wine Pure and Holy.

column2: And they made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote upon it a writing, like to the engravings of a signet, HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
column3: And before this, was the Book of Moses as a guide and a mercy: And this Book confirms (it) in the Arabic tongue; to admonish the unjust, and as Glad Tidings to those who do right.

column2: And they tied unto it a lace of blue, to fasten it on high upon the mitre; as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: And (further) their Prophet said to them: "A Sign of his authority is that there shall come to you the Ark of the covenant, with (an assurance) therein of security from your Lord, and the relics left by the family of Moses and the family of Aaron, carried by angels. In this is a symbol for you if ye indeed have faith."

column2: Thus was all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation finished: and the children of Israel did according to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so did they.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And they brought the tabernacle unto Moses, the tent, and all his furniture, his taches, his boards, his bars, and his pillars, and his sockets,
column3: And thy Lord taught the Bee to build its cells in hills, on trees, and in (men's) habitations;

column2: And the covering of rams' skins dyed red, and the covering of badgers' skins, and the vail of the covering,
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

column2: The ark of the testimony, and the staves thereof, and the mercy seat,
column3: By the Firmament which returns (in its round),

column2: The table, and all the vessels thereof, and the showbread,
column3: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,

column2: The pure candlestick, with the lamps thereof, even with the lamps to be set in order, and all the vessels thereof, and the oil for light,
column3: And we have, (from of old), adorned the lowest heaven with Lamps, and We have made such (Lamps) (as) missiles to drive away the Evil Ones, and have prepared for them the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.

column2: And the golden altar, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the tabernacle door,
column3: And verily, it is in the Mother of the Book, in Our Presence, high (in dignity), full of wisdom.

column2: The brazen altar, and his grate of brass, his staves, and all his vessels, the laver and his foot,
column3: For such the reward is forgiveness from their Lord, and Gardens with rivers flowing underneath,- an eternal dwelling: How excellent a recompense for those who work (and strive)!

column2: The hangings of the court, his pillars, and his sockets, and the hanging for the court gate, his cords, and his pins, and all the vessels of the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of the congregation,
column3: Behold! We gave the site, to Abraham, of the (Sacred) House, (saying): "Associate not anything (in worship) with Me; and sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or stand up, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

column2: The cloths of service to do service in the holy place, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and his sons' garments, to minister in the priest's office.
column3: In the past We granted to Moses and Aaron the criterion (for judgment), and a Light and a Message for those who would do right,-

column2: According to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so the children of Israel made all the work.
column3: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel, except what Israel Made unlawful for itself, before the Law (of Moses) was revealed. Say: "Bring ye the Law and study it, if ye be men of truth."

column2: And Moses did look upon all the work, and, behold, they had done it as the LORD had commanded, even so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.
column3: To Moses We did give Nine Clear Signs: As the Children of Israel: when he came to them, Pharaoh said to him: "O Moses! I consider thee, indeed, to have been worked upon by sorcery!

column2: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
column3: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"

column2: On the first day of the first month shalt thou set up the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation.
column3: Remember We made the House a place of assembly for men and a place of safety; and take ye the station of Abraham as a place of prayer; and We covenanted with Abraham and Isma'il, that they should sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or use it as a retreat, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

column2: And thou shalt put therein the ark of the testimony, and cover the ark with the vail.
column3: And (further) their Prophet said to them: "A Sign of his authority is that there shall come to you the Ark of the covenant, with (an assurance) therein of security from your Lord, and the relics left by the family of Moses and the family of Aaron, carried by angels. In this is a symbol for you if ye indeed have faith."

column2: And thou shalt bring in the table, and set in order the things that are to be set in order upon it; and thou shalt bring in the candlestick, and light the lamps thereof.
column3: We said: "O Adam! dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden; and eat of the bountiful things therein as (where and when) ye will; but approach not this tree, or ye run into harm and transgression."

column2: And thou shalt set the altar of gold for the incense before the ark of the testimony, and put the hanging of the door to the tabernacle.
column3: And (further) their Prophet said to them: "A Sign of his authority is that there shall come to you the Ark of the covenant, with (an assurance) therein of security from your Lord, and the relics left by the family of Moses and the family of Aaron, carried by angels. In this is a symbol for you if ye indeed have faith."

column2: And thou shalt set the altar of the burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation.
column3: And (further) their Prophet said to them: "A Sign of his authority is that there shall come to you the Ark of the covenant, with (an assurance) therein of security from your Lord, and the relics left by the family of Moses and the family of Aaron, carried by angels. In this is a symbol for you if ye indeed have faith."

column2: And thou shalt set the laver between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and shalt put water therein.
column3: And thou wilt see the sinners that day bound together in fetters;-

column2: And thou shalt set up the court round about, and hang up the hanging at the court gate.
column3: In front of the Fire will they be brought, morning and evening: And (the sentence will be) on the Day that Judgment will be established: "Cast ye the People of Pharaoh into the severest Penalty!"

column2: And thou shalt take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle, and all that is therein, and shalt hallow it, and all the vessels thereof: and it shall be holy.
column3: We said: "O Adam! dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden; and eat of the bountiful things therein as (where and when) ye will; but approach not this tree, or ye run into harm and transgression."

column2: And thou shalt anoint the altar of the burnt offering, and all his vessels, and sanctify the altar: and it shall be an altar most holy.
column3: "Our Lord! send amongst them a Messenger of their own, who shall rehearse Thy Signs to them and instruct them in scripture and wisdom, and sanctify them: For Thou art the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

column2: And thou shalt anoint the laver and his foot, and sanctify it.
column3: "Except Thy Servants amongst them, sincere and purified (by Thy Grace)."

column2: And thou shalt bring Aaron and his sons unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and wash them with water.
column3: And (further) their Prophet said to them: "A Sign of his authority is that there shall come to you the Ark of the covenant, with (an assurance) therein of security from your Lord, and the relics left by the family of Moses and the family of Aaron, carried by angels. In this is a symbol for you if ye indeed have faith."

column2: And thou shalt put upon Aaron the holy garments, and anoint him, and sanctify him; that he may minister unto me in the priest's office.
column3: Behold! Allah said: "O Jesus! I will take thee and raise thee to Myself and clear thee (of the falsehoods) of those who blaspheme; I will make those who follow thee superior to those who reject faith, to the Day of Resurrection: Then shall ye all return unto me, and I will judge between you of the matters wherein ye dispute.

column2: And thou shalt bring his sons, and clothe them with coats:
column3: "And grant, our Lord! that they enter the Gardens of Eternity, which Thou hast promised to them, and to the righteous among their fathers, their wives, and their posterity! For Thou art (He), the Exalted in Might, Full of Wisdom.

column2: And thou shalt anoint them, as thou didst anoint their father, that they may minister unto me in the priest's office: for their anointing shall surely be an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.
column3: "And grant, our Lord! that they enter the Gardens of Eternity, which Thou hast promised to them, and to the righteous among their fathers, their wives, and their posterity! For Thou art (He), the Exalted in Might, Full of Wisdom.

column2: Thus did Moses: according to all that the LORD commanded him, so did he.
column3: When the anger of Moses was appeased, he took up the tablets: in the writing thereon was guidance and Mercy for such as fear their Lord.

column2: And it came to pass in the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was reared up.
column3: On that Day shall the (Great) Event come to pass.

column2: And Moses reared up the tabernacle, and fastened his sockets, and set up the boards thereof, and put in the bars thereof, and reared up his pillars.
column3: Remember We made the House a place of assembly for men and a place of safety; and take ye the station of Abraham as a place of prayer; and We covenanted with Abraham and Isma'il, that they should sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or use it as a retreat, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

column2: And he spread abroad the tent over the tabernacle, and put the covering of the tent above upon it; as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And he took and put the testimony into the ark, and set the staves on the ark, and put the mercy seat above upon the ark:
column3: Behold! We gave the site, to Abraham, of the (Sacred) House, (saying): "Associate not anything (in worship) with Me; and sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or stand up, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

column2: And he brought the ark into the tabernacle, and set up the vail of the covering, and covered the ark of the testimony; as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: And (further) their Prophet said to them: "A Sign of his authority is that there shall come to you the Ark of the covenant, with (an assurance) therein of security from your Lord, and the relics left by the family of Moses and the family of Aaron, carried by angels. In this is a symbol for you if ye indeed have faith."

column2: And he put the table in the tent of the congregation, upon the side of the tabernacle northward, without the vail.
column3: And a Sign for them is that We bore their race (through the Flood) in the loaded Ark;

column2: And he set the bread in order upon it before the LORD; as the LORD had commanded Moses.
column3: And in Moses (was another Sign): Behold, We sent him to Pharaoh, with authority manifest.

column2: And he put the candlestick in the tent of the congregation, over against the table, on the side of the tabernacle southward.
column3: Behold! they sat over against the (fire),

column2: And he lighted the lamps before the LORD; as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: Then did (Moses) show him the Great Sign.

column2: And he put the golden altar in the tent of the congregation before the vail:
column3: Forsooth, each one of them wants to be given scrolls (of revelation) spread out!

column2: And he burnt sweet incense thereon; as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: When the anger of Moses was appeased, he took up the tablets: in the writing thereon was guidance and Mercy for such as fear their Lord.

column2: And he set up the hanging at the door of the tabernacle.
column3: Near it is the Garden of Abode.

column2: And he put the altar of burnt offering by the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation, and offered upon it the burnt offering and the meat offering; as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And he set the laver between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and put water there, to wash withal.
column3: And they will be given to drink there of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Zanjabil,-

column2: And Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet thereat:
column3: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron, with Our Signs and authority manifest,

column2: When they went into the tent of the congregation, and when they came near unto the altar, they washed; as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: And remember David and Solomon, when they gave judgment in the matter of the field into which the sheep of certain people had strayed by night: We did witness their judgment.

column2: And he reared up the court round about the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the hanging of the court gate. So Moses finished the work.
column3: (Before this,) We sent Moses The Book, and appointed his brother Aaron with him as minister;

column2: Then a cloud covered the tent of the congregation, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
column3: Then when they entered the presence of Joseph, he provided a home for his parents with himself, and said: "Enter ye Egypt (all) in safety if it please Allah."

column2: And Moses was not able to enter into the tent of the congregation, because the cloud abode thereon, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
column3: Then when they entered the presence of Joseph, he provided a home for his parents with himself, and said: "Enter ye Egypt (all) in safety if it please Allah."
