column3: And Solomon was David's heir. He said: "O ye people! We have been taught the speech of birds, and on us has been bestowed (a little) of all things: this is indeed Grace manifest (from Allah.)"

column2: Surely there is no enchantment against Jacob, neither is there any divination against Israel: according to this time it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel, What hath God wrought!
column3: Perchance thou mayest (feel the inclination) to give up a part of what is revealed unto thee, and thy heart feeleth straitened lest they say, "Why is not a treasure sent down unto him, or why does not an angel come down with him?" But thou art there only to warn! It is Allah that arrangeth all affairs!

column2: Behold, the people shall rise up as a great lion, and lift up himself as a young lion: he shall not lie down until he eat of the prey, and drink the blood of the slain.
column3: And when the Word is fulfilled against them (the unjust), we shall produce from the earth a beast to (face) them: He will speak to them, for that mankind did not believe with assurance in Our Signs.

column2: And Balak said unto Balaam, Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all.
column3: "Behold! are these not the men whom you swore that Allah with His Mercy would never bless? Enter ye the Garden: no fear shall be on you, nor shall ye grieve."

column2: But Balaam answered and said unto Balak, Told not I thee, saying, All that the LORD speaketh, that I must do?
column3: But when He trieth him, restricting his subsistence for him, then saith he (in despair), "My Lord hath humiliated me!"

column2: And Balak said unto Balaam, Come, I pray thee, I will bring thee unto another place; peradventure it will please God that thou mayest curse me them from thence.
column3: Perchance thou mayest (feel the inclination) to give up a part of what is revealed unto thee, and thy heart feeleth straitened lest they say, "Why is not a treasure sent down unto him, or why does not an angel come down with him?" But thou art there only to warn! It is Allah that arrangeth all affairs!

column2: And Balak brought Balaam unto the top of Peor, that looketh toward Jeshimon.
column3: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:

column2: And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bullocks and seven rams.
column3: The king (of Egypt) said: "I do see (in a vision) seven fat kine, whom seven lean ones devour, and seven green ears of corn, and seven (others) withered. O ye chiefs! Expound to me my vision if it be that ye can interpret visions."

column2: And Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.
column3: And in the Thamud (was another Sign): Behold, they were told, "Enjoy (your brief day) for a little while!"

column2: And when Balaam saw that it pleased the LORD to bless Israel, he went not, as at other times, to seek for enchantments, but he set his face toward the wilderness.
column3: When fear had passed from (the mind of) Abraham and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with us for Lut's people.

column2: And Balaam lifted up his eyes, and he saw Israel abiding in his tents according to their tribes; and the spirit of God came upon him.
column3: When fear had passed from (the mind of) Abraham and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with us for Lut's people.

column2: And he took up his parable, and said, Balaam the son of Beor hath said, and the man whose eyes are open hath said:
column3: But when He trieth him, restricting his subsistence for him, then saith he (in despair), "My Lord hath humiliated me!"

column2: He hath said, which heard the words of God, which saw the vision of the Almighty, falling into a trance, but having his eyes open:
column3: So his Lord hearkened to him (in his prayer), and turned away from him their snare: Verily He heareth and knoweth (all things).

column2: How goodly are thy tents, O Jacob, and thy tabernacles, O Israel!
column3: "And grant, our Lord! that they enter the Gardens of Eternity, which Thou hast promised to them, and to the righteous among their fathers, their wives, and their posterity! For Thou art (He), the Exalted in Might, Full of Wisdom.

column2: As the valleys are they spread forth, as gardens by the river's side, as the trees of lign aloes which the LORD hath planted, and as cedar trees beside the waters.
column3: And in the earth are tracts (diverse though) neighbouring, and gardens of vines and fields sown with corn, and palm trees - growing out of single roots or otherwise: watered with the same water, yet some of them We make more excellent than others to eat. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who understand!

column2: He shall pour the water out of his buckets, and his seed shall be in many waters, and his king shall be higher than Agag, and his kingdom shall be exalted.
column3: And it is He who spread out the earth, and set thereon mountains standing firm and (flowing) rivers: and fruit of every kind He made in pairs, two and two: He draweth the night as a veil o'er the Day. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who consider!

column2: God brought him forth out of Egypt; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn: he shall eat up the nations his enemies, and shall break their bones, and pierce them through with his arrows.
column3: And it is He who spread out the earth, and set thereon mountains standing firm and (flowing) rivers: and fruit of every kind He made in pairs, two and two: He draweth the night as a veil o'er the Day. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who consider!

column2: He couched, he lay down as a lion, and as a great lion: who shall stir him up? Blessed is he that blesseth thee, and cursed is he that curseth thee.
column3: When some trouble toucheth man, he crieth unto his Lord, turning to Him in repentance: but when He bestoweth a favour upon him as from Himself, (man) doth forget what he cried and prayed for before, and he doth set up rivals unto Allah, thus misleading others from Allah's Path. Say, "Enjoy thy blasphemy for a little while: verily thou art (one) of the Companions of the Fire!"

column2: And Balak's anger was kindled against Balaam, and he smote his hands together: and Balak said unto Balaam, I called thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast altogether blessed them these three times.
column3: So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them, and they began to sew together the leaves of the garden over their bodies. And their Lord called unto them: "Did I not forbid you that tree, and tell you that Satan was an avowed enemy unto you?"

column2: Therefore now flee thou to thy place: I thought to promote thee unto great honor; but, lo, the LORD hath kept thee back from honor.
column3: "Our Lord!" (they say), "Let not our hearts deviate now after Thou hast guided us, but grant us mercy from Thine own Presence; for Thou art the Grantor of bounties without measure.

column2: And Balaam said unto Balak, Spake I not also to thy messengers which thou sentest unto me, saying,
column3: But the Hoopoe tarried not far: he (came up and) said: "I have compassed (territory) which thou hast not compassed, and I have come to thee from Saba with tidings true.

column2: If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the commandment of the LORD, to do either good or bad of mine own mind; but what the LORD saith, that will I speak?
column3: He said, "O my Lord! Forgive me, and grant me a kingdom which, (it may be), suits not another after me: for Thou art the Grantor of Bounties (without measure).

column2: And now, behold, I go unto my people: come therefore, and I will advertise thee what this people shall do to thy people in the latter days.
column3: One day We shall raise from all Peoples a witness against them, from amongst themselves: and We shall bring thee as a witness against these (thy people): and We have sent down to thee the Book explaining all things, a Guide, a Mercy, and Glad Tidings to Muslims.

column2: And he took up his parable, and said, Balaam the son of Beor hath said, and the man whose eyes are open hath said:
column3: But when He trieth him, restricting his subsistence for him, then saith he (in despair), "My Lord hath humiliated me!"

column2: He hath said, which heard the words of God, and knew the knowledge of the most High, which saw the vision of the Almighty, falling into a trance, but having his eyes open:
column3: And remember, Jesus, the son of Mary, said: "O Children of Israel! I am the messenger of Allah (sent) to you, confirming the Law (which came) before me, and giving Glad Tidings of a Messenger to come after me, whose name shall be Ahmad." But when he came to them with Clear Signs, they said, "this is evident sorcery!"

column2: I shall see him, but not now: I shall behold him, but not nigh: there shall come a Star out of Jacob, and a Sceptre shall rise out of Israel, and shall smite the corners of Moab, and destroy all the children of Sheth.
column3: Said the chiefs of Pharaoh's people: "Wilt thou leave Moses and his people, to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon thee and thy gods?" He said: "Their male children will we slay; (only) their females will we save alive; and we have over them (power) irresistible."

column2: And Edom shall be a possession, Seir also shall be a possession for his enemies; and Israel shall do valiantly.
column3: O David! We did indeed make thee a vicegerent on earth: so judge thou between men in truth (and justice): Nor follow thou the lusts (of thy heart), for they will mislead thee from the Path of Allah: for those who wander astray from the Path of Allah, is a Penalty Grievous, for that they forget the Day of Account.

column2: Out of Jacob shall come he that shall have dominion, and shall destroy him that remaineth of the city.
column3: For he who hateth thee, he will be cut off (from Future Hope).

column2: And when he looked on Amalek, he took up his parable, and said, Amalek was the first of the nations; but his latter end shall be that he perish for ever.
column3: They said: "We have had (nothing but) trouble, both before and after thou camest to us." He said: "It may be that your Lord will destroy your enemy and make you inheritors in the earth; that so He may try you by your deeds."

column2: And he looked on the Kenites, and took up his parable, and said, Strong is thy dwelling place, and thou puttest thy nest in a rock.
column3: But the Hoopoe tarried not far: he (came up and) said: "I have compassed (territory) which thou hast not compassed, and I have come to thee from Saba with tidings true.

column2: Nevertheless the Kenite shall be wasted, until Asshur shall carry thee away captive.
column3: "But whosoever turns away from My Message, verily for him is a life narrowed down, and We shall raise him up blind on the Day of Judgment."

column2: And he took up his parable, and said, Alas, who shall live when God doeth this!
column3: But when He trieth him, restricting his subsistence for him, then saith he (in despair), "My Lord hath humiliated me!"

column2: And ships shall come from the coast of Chittim, and shall afflict Asshur, and shall afflict Eber, and he also shall perish for ever.
column3: It is he whom Allah guides, that is on true Guidance; but he whom He leaves astray - for such wilt thou find no protector besides Him. On the Day of Judgment We shall gather, them together, prone on their faces, blind, dumb, and deaf: their abode will be Hell: every time it shows abatement, We shall increase from them the fierceness of the Fire.

column2: And Balaam rose up, and went and returned to his place: and Balak also went his way.
column3: But they called to their companion, and he took a sword in hand, and hamstrung (her).

column2: And Israel abode in Shittim, and the people began to commit whoredom with the daughters of Moab.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: And they called the people unto the sacrifices of their gods: and the people did eat, and bowed down to their gods.
column3: So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them, and they began to sew together the leaves of the garden over their bodies. And their Lord called unto them: "Did I not forbid you that tree, and tell you that Satan was an avowed enemy unto you?"

column2: And Israel joined himself unto Baalpeor: and the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel.
column3: Then the people of Pharaoh picked him up (from the river): (It was intended) that (Moses) should be to them an adversary and a cause of sorrow: for Pharaoh and Haman and (all) their hosts were men of sin.

column2: And the LORD said unto Moses, Take all the heads of the people, and hang them up before the LORD against the sun, that the fierce anger of the LORD may be turned away from Israel.
column3: Moses prayed: "Our Lord! Thou hast indeed bestowed on Pharaoh and his chiefs splendour and wealth in the life of the present, and so, Our Lord, they mislead (men) from Thy Path. Deface, our Lord, the features of their wealth, and send hardness to their hearts, so they will not believe until they see the grievous penalty."

column2: And Moses said unto the judges of Israel, Slay ye every one his men that were joined unto Baalpeor.
column3: Behold, thy Lord called Moses: "Go to the people of iniquity,-

column2: And, behold, one of the children of Israel came and brought unto his brethren a Midianitish woman in the sight of Moses, and in the sight of all the congregation of the children of Israel, who were weeping before the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And when Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose up from among the congregation, and took a javelin in his hand;
column3: And he entered the city at a time when its people were not watching: and he found there two men fighting,- one of his own religion, and the other, of his foes. Now the man of his own religion appealed to him against his foe, and Moses struck him with his fist and made an end of him. He said: "This is a work of Evil (Satan): for he is an enemy that manifestly misleads!"

column2: And he went after the man of Israel into the tent, and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel, and the woman through her belly. So the plague was stayed from the children of Israel.
column3: "Then he brought out (of the fire) before the (people) the image of a calf: It seemed to low: so they said: This is your god, and the god of Moses, but (Moses) has forgotten!"

column2: And those that died in the plague were twenty and four thousand.
column3: And We sent him (on a mission) to a hundred thousand (men) or more.

column2: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
column3: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"

column2: Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, hath turned my wrath away from the children of Israel, while he was zealous for my sake among them, that I consumed not the children of Israel in my jealousy.
column3: "The ways and means of (reaching) the heavens, and that I may mount up to the god of Moses: But as far as I am concerned, I think (Moses) is a liar!" Thus was made alluring, in Pharaoh's eyes, the evil of his deeds, and he was hindered from the Path; and the plot of Pharaoh led to nothing but perdition (for him).

column2: Wherefore say, Behold, I give unto him my covenant of peace:
column3: Say: "O my Lord! if Thou wilt show me (in my lifetime) that which they are warned against,-

column2: And he shall have it, and his seed after him, even the covenant of an everlasting priesthood; because he was zealous for his God, and made an atonement for the children of Israel.
column3: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column2: Now the name of the Israelite that was slain, even that was slain with the Midianitish woman, was Zimri, the son of Salu, a prince of a chief house among the Simeonites.
column3: When Our decree issued, We saved Shu'aib and those who believed with him, by (special) mercy from Ourselves: But the (mighty) blast did seize the wrong-doers, and they lay prostrate in their homes by the morning,-

column2: And the name of the Midianitish woman that was slain was Cozbi, the daughter of Zur; he was head over a people, and of a chief house in Midian.
column3: The Companions of the Wood, and the People of Tubba'; each one (of them) rejected the messengers, and My warning was duly fulfilled (in them).

column2: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
column3: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"

column2: Vex the Midianites, and smite them:
column3: Instead, they shall reject their worship, and become adversaries against them.

column2: For they vex you with their wiles, wherewith they have beguiled you in the matter of Peor, and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of a prince of Midian, their sister, which was slain in the day of the plague for Peor's sake.
column3: And their Lord hath accepted of them, and answered them: "Never will I suffer to be lost the work of any of you, be he male or female: Ye are members, one of another: Those who have left their homes, or been driven out therefrom, or suffered harm in My Cause, or fought or been slain,- verily, I will blot out from them their iniquities, and admit them into Gardens with rivers flowing beneath;- A reward from the presence of Allah, and from His presence is the best of rewards."

column2: And it came to pass after the plague, that the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying,
column3: We did send Moses aforetime, with Our Signs, to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: He said, "I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds."

column2: Take the sum of all the congregation of the children of Israel, from twenty years old and upward, throughout their fathers' house, all that are able to go to war in Israel.
column3: Those who believe in Allah and the Last Day ask thee for no exemption from fighting with their goods and persons. And Allah knoweth well those who do their duty.

column2: And Moses and Eleazar the priest spake with them in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho, saying,
column3: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron, with Our Signs and authority manifest,

column2: Take the sum of the people, from twenty years old and upward; as the LORD commanded Moses and the children of Israel, which went forth out of the land of Egypt.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: Reuben, the eldest son of Israel: the children of Reuben; Hanoch, of whom cometh the family of the Hanochites: of Pallu, the family of the Palluites:
column3: We gave him Isaac and Jacob: all (three) guided: and before him, We guided Noah, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron: thus do We reward those who do good:

column2: Of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites: of Carmi, the family of the Carmites.
column3: The 'Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,

column2: These are the families of the Reubenites: and they that were numbered of them were forty and three thousand and seven hundred and thirty.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And the sons of Pallu; Eliab.
column3: The 'Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,

column2: And the sons of Eliab; Nemuel, and Dathan, and Abiram. This is that Dathan and Abiram, which were famous in the congregation, who strove against Moses and against Aaron in the company of Korah, when they strove against the LORD:
column3: We appointed for Moses thirty nights, and completed (the period) with ten (more): thus was completed the term (of communion) with his Lord, forty nights. And Moses had charged his brother Aaron (before he went up): "Act for me amongst my people: Do right, and follow not the way of those who do mischief."

column2: And the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them up together with Korah, when that company died, what time the fire devoured two hundred and fifty men: and they became a sign.
column3: The Day when the Earth will be rent asunder, from (men) hurrying out: that will be a gathering together,- quite easy for Us.

column2: Notwithstanding the children of Korah died not.
column3: The people of Lut rejected the messengers.

column2: The sons of Simeon after their families: of Nemuel, the family of the Nemuelites: of Jamin, the family of the Jaminites: of Jachin, the family of the Jachinites:
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: Of Zerah, the family of the Zarhites: of Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: These are the families of the Simeonites, twenty and two thousand and two hundred.
column3: The Companions of the Rocky Tract also rejected the messengers:

column2: The children of Gad after their families: of Zephon, the family of the Zephonites: of Haggi, the family of the Haggites: of Shuni, the family of the Shunites:
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: Of Ozni, the family of the Oznites: of Eri, the family of the Erites:
column3: And with the Thamud (people), who cut out (huge) rocks in the valley?-

column2: Of Arod, the family of the Arodites: of Areli, the family of the Arelites.
column3: The 'Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,

column2: These are the families of the children of Gad according to those that were numbered of them, forty thousand and five hundred.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: The sons of Judah were Er and Onan: and Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And the sons of Judah after their families were; of Shelah, the family of the Shelanites: of Pharez, the family of the Pharzites: of Zerah, the family of the Zarhites.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And the sons of Pharez were; of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites: of Hamul, the family of the Hamulites.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: These are the families of Judah according to those that were numbered of them, threescore and sixteen thousand and five hundred.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: Of the sons of Issachar after their families: of Tola, the family of the Tolaites: of Pua, the family of the Punites:
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: Of Jashub, the family of the Jashubites: of Shimron, the family of the Shimronites.
column3: The 'Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,

column2: These are the families of Issachar according to those that were numbered of them, threescore and four thousand and three hundred.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: Of the sons of Zebulun after their families: of Sered, the family of the Sardites: of Elon, the family of the Elonites: of Jahleel, the family of the Jahleelites.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: These are the families of the Zebulunites according to those that were numbered of them, threescore thousand and five hundred.
column3: The Companions of the Rocky Tract also rejected the messengers:

column2: The sons of Joseph after their families were Manasseh and Ephraim.
column3: Those of Abraham and Lut;

column2: Of the sons of Manasseh: of Machir, the family of the Machirites: and Machir begat Gilead: of Gilead come the family of the Gileadites.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: These are the sons of Gilead: of Jeezer, the family of the Jeezerites: of Helek, the family of the Helekites:
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: And of Asriel, the family of the Asrielites: and of Shechem, the family of the Shechemites:
column3: Of Pharaoh and the Thamud?

column2: And of Shemida, the family of the Shemidaites: and of Hepher, the family of the Hepherites.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: And Zelophehad the son of Hepher had no sons, but daughters: and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: These are the families of Manasseh, and those that were numbered of them, fifty and two thousand and seven hundred.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: These are the sons of Ephraim after their families: of Shuthelah, the family of the Shuthalhites: of Becher, the family of the Bachrites: of Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And these are the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the family of the Eranites.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: These are the families of the sons of Ephraim according to those that were numbered of them, thirty and two thousand and five hundred. These are the sons of Joseph after their families.
column3: Of the people of Moses there is a section who guide and do justice in the light of truth.

column2: The sons of Benjamin after their families: of Bela, the family of the Belaites: of Ashbel, the family of the Ashbelites: of Ahiram, the family of the Ahiramites:
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: Of Shupham, the family of the Shuphamites: of Hupham, the family of the Huphamites.
column3: Of Pharaoh and the Thamud?

column2: And the sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: of Ard, the family of the Ardites: and of Naaman, the family of the Naamites.
column3: And Thamud, and the people of Lut, and the Companions of the Wood; - such were the Confederates.

column2: These are the sons of Benjamin after their families: and they that were numbered of them were forty and five thousand and six hundred.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: These are the sons of Dan after their families: of Shuham, the family of the Shuhamites. These are the families of Dan after their families.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: All the families of the Shuhamites, according to those that were numbered of them, were threescore and four thousand and four hundred.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: Of the children of Asher after their families: of Jimna, the family of the Jimnites: of Jesui, the family of the Jesuites: of Beriah, the family of the Beriites.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: Of the sons of Beriah: of Heber, the family of the Heberites: of Malchiel, the family of the Malchielites.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And the name of the daughter of Asher was Sarah.
column3: And, out of Our Mercy, We gave him his brother Aaron, (also) a prophet.

column2: These are the families of the sons of Asher according to those that were numbered of them; who were fifty and three thousand and four hundred.
column3: Before them (were many who) rejected messengers,- the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Pharaoh, the Lord of Stakes,

column2: Of the sons of Naphtali after their families: of Jahzeel, the family of the Jahzeelites: of Guni, the family of the Gunites:
column3: And (remember) Isma'il, Idris, and Zul-kifl, all (men) of constancy and patience;

column2: Of Jezer, the family of the Jezerites: of Shillem, the family of the Shillemites.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: These are the families of Naphtali according to their families: and they that were numbered of them were forty and five thousand and four hundred.
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: These were the numbered of the children of Israel, six hundred thousand and a thousand seven hundred and thirty.
column3: And We sent him (on a mission) to a hundred thousand (men) or more.

column2: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
column3: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"

column2: Unto these the land shall be divided for an inheritance according to the number of names.
column3: In them ye have benefits for a term appointed: in the end their place of sacrifice is near the Ancient House.

column2: To many thou shalt give the more inheritance, and to few thou shalt give the less inheritance: to every one shall his inheritance be given according to those that were numbered of him.
column3: He that doeth good shall have ten times as much to his credit: He that doeth evil shall only be recompensed according to his evil: no wrong shall be done unto (any of) them.

column2: Notwithstanding the land shall be divided by lot: according to the names of the tribes of their fathers they shall inherit.
column3: And tell them that the water is to be divided between them: Each one's right to drink being brought forward (by suitable turns).

column2: According to the lot shall the possession thereof be divided between many and few.
column3: And those that distribute and apportion by Command;-

column2: And these are they that were numbered of the Levites after their families: of Gershon, the family of the Gershonites: of Kohath, the family of the Kohathites: of Merari, the family of the Merarites.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: These are the families of the Levites: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, the family of the Korathites. And Kohath begat Amram.
column3: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

column2: And the name of Amram's wife was Jochebed, the daughter of Levi, whom her mother bare to Levi in Egypt: and she bare unto Amram Aaron and Moses, and Miriam their sister.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And unto Aaron was born Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
column3: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.

column2: And Nadab and Abihu died, when they offered strange fire before the LORD.
column3: (Remember also) Qarun, Pharaoh, and Haman: there came to them Moses with Clear Signs, but they behaved with insolence on the earth; yet they could not overreach (Us).

column2: And those that were numbered of them were twenty and three thousand, all males from a month old and upward: for they were not numbered among the children of Israel, because there was no inheritance given them among the children of Israel.
column3: We settled the Children of Israel in a beautiful dwelling-place, and provided for them sustenance of the best: it was after knowledge had been granted to them, that they fell into schisms. Verily Allah will judge between them as to the schisms amongst them, on the Day of Judgment.

column2: These are they that were numbered by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who numbered the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho.
column3: Of the people of Moses there is a section who guide and do justice in the light of truth.

column2: But among these there was not a man of them whom Moses and Aaron the priest numbered, when they numbered the children of Israel in the wilderness of Sinai.
column3: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel, except what Israel Made unlawful for itself, before the Law (of Moses) was revealed. Say: "Bring ye the Law and study it, if ye be men of truth."

column2: For the LORD had said of them, They shall surely die in the wilderness. And there was not left a man of them, save Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.
column3: Hath not the story reached them of those before them?- the People of Noah, and 'Ad, and Thamud; the People of Abraham, the men of Midian, and the cities overthrown. To them came their messengers with clear signs. It is not Allah Who wrongs them, but they wrong their own souls.

column2: Then came the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph: and these are the names of his daughters; Mahlah, Noah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Tirzah.
column3: We gave him Isaac and Jacob: all (three) guided: and before him, We guided Noah, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron: thus do We reward those who do good:

column2: And they stood before Moses, and before Eleazar the priest, and before the princes and all the congregation, by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, saying,
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: Our father died in the wilderness, and he was not in the company of them that gathered themselves together against the LORD in the company of Korah; but died in his own sin, and had no sons.
column3: They said: "O our father! We went racing with one another, and left Joseph with our things; and the wolf devoured him.... But thou wilt never believe us even though we tell the truth."

column2: Why should the name of our father be done away from among his family, because he hath no son? Give unto us therefore a possession among the brethren of our father.
column3: Said the chiefs of Pharaoh's people: "Wilt thou leave Moses and his people, to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon thee and thy gods?" He said: "Their male children will we slay; (only) their females will we save alive; and we have over them (power) irresistible."

column2: And Moses brought their cause before the LORD.
column3: Then did (Moses) show him the Great Sign.

column2: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
column3: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"

column2: The daughters of Zelophehad speak right: thou shalt surely give them a possession of an inheritance among their father's brethren; and thou shalt cause the inheritance of their father to pass unto them.
column3: "And grant, our Lord! that they enter the Gardens of Eternity, which Thou hast promised to them, and to the righteous among their fathers, their wives, and their posterity! For Thou art (He), the Exalted in Might, Full of Wisdom.

column2: And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If a man die, and have no son, then ye shall cause his inheritance to pass unto his daughter.
column3: So We sent this inspiration to the mother of Moses: "Suckle (thy child), but when thou hast fears about him, cast him into the river, but fear not nor grieve: for We shall restore him to thee, and We shall make him one of Our messengers."

column2: And if he have no daughter, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his brethren.
column3: He said: "Whoever doth wrong, him shall we punish; then shall he be sent back to his Lord; and He will punish him with a punishment unheard-of (before).

column2: And if he have no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his father's brethren.
column3: He said: "Whoever doth wrong, him shall we punish; then shall he be sent back to his Lord; and He will punish him with a punishment unheard-of (before).

column2: And if his father have no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his kinsman that is next to him of his family, and he shall possess it: and it shall be unto the children of Israel a statute of judgment, as the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: Every soul that hath sinned, if it possessed all that is on earth, would fain give it in ransom: They would declare (their) repentance when they see the penalty: but the judgment between them will be with justice, and no wrong will be done unto them.

column2: And the LORD said unto Moses, Get thee up into this mount Abarim, and see the land which I have given unto the children of Israel.
column3: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"

column2: And when thou hast seen it, thou also shalt be gathered unto thy people, as Aaron thy brother was gathered.
column3: "Come back thou to thy Lord,- well pleased (thyself), and well-pleasing unto Him!

column2: For ye rebelled against my commandment in the desert of Zin, in the strife of the congregation, to sanctify me at the water before their eyes: that is the water of Meribah in Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.
column3: When Our decree issued, We saved Shu'aib and those who believed with him, by (special) mercy from Ourselves: But the (mighty) blast did seize the wrong-doers, and they lay prostrate in their homes by the morning,-

column2: And Moses spake unto the LORD, saying,
column3: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"

column2: Let the LORD, the God of the spirits of all flesh, set a man over the congregation,
column3: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all between them, if ye (but) have an assured faith.

column2: Which may go out before them, and which may go in before them, and which may lead them out, and which may bring them in; that the congregation of the LORD be not as sheep which have no shepherd.
column3: Those whom Allah (in His plan) willeth to guide,- He openeth their breast to Islam; those whom He willeth to leave straying,- He maketh their breast close and constricted, as if they had to climb up to the skies: thus doth Allah (heap) the penalty on those who refuse to believe.

column2: And the LORD said unto Moses, Take thee Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is the spirit, and lay thine hand upon him;
column3: So We sent this inspiration to the mother of Moses: "Suckle (thy child), but when thou hast fears about him, cast him into the river, but fear not nor grieve: for We shall restore him to thee, and We shall make him one of Our messengers."

column2: And set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation; and give him a charge in their sight.
column3: So, by thy Lord, without doubt, We shall gather them together, and (also) the Evil Ones (with them); then shall We bring them forth on their knees round about Hell;

column2: And thou shalt put some of thine honor upon him, that all the congregation of the children of Israel may be obedient.
column3: Say: "O People of the Book! ye have no ground to stand upon unless ye stand fast by the Law, the Gospel, and all the revelation that has come to you from your Lord." It is the revelation that cometh to thee from thy Lord, that increaseth in most of them their obstinate rebellion and blasphemy. But sorrow thou not over (these) people without Faith.

column2: And he shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall ask counsel for him after the judgment of Urim before the LORD: at his word shall they go out, and at his word they shall come in, both he, and all the children of Israel with him, even all the congregation.
column3: And (further) their Prophet said to them: "A Sign of his authority is that there shall come to you the Ark of the covenant, with (an assurance) therein of security from your Lord, and the relics left by the family of Moses and the family of Aaron, carried by angels. In this is a symbol for you if ye indeed have faith."

column2: And Moses did as the LORD commanded him: and he took Joshua, and set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation:
column3: "Then he brought out (of the fire) before the (people) the image of a calf: It seemed to low: so they said: This is your god, and the god of Moses, but (Moses) has forgotten!"

column2: And he laid his hands upon him, and gave him a charge, as the LORD commanded by the hand of Moses.
column3: We did send Moses aforetime, with Our Signs, to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: He said, "I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds."

column2: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
column3: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"

column2: Command the children of Israel, and say unto them, My offering, and my bread for my sacrifices made by fire, for a sweet savor unto me, shall ye observe to offer unto me in their due season.
column3: Allah did aforetime take a covenant from the Children of Israel, and we appointed twelve captains among them. And Allah said: "I am with you: if ye (but) establish regular prayers, practise regular charity, believe in my messengers, honour and assist them, and loan to Allah a beautiful loan, verily I will wipe out from you your evils, and admit you to gardens with rivers flowing beneath; but if any of you, after this, resisteth faith, he hath truly wandered from the path or rectitude."

column2: And thou shalt say unto them, This is the offering made by fire which ye shall offer unto the LORD; two lambs of the first year without spot day by day, for a continual burnt offering.
column3: (Joseph) said: "For seven years shall ye diligently sow as is your wont: and the harvests that ye reap, ye shall leave them in the ear,- except a little, of which ye shall eat.

column2: The one lamb shalt thou offer in the morning, and the other lamb shalt thou offer at even;
column3: "Thou causest the night to gain on the day, and thou causest the day to gain on the night; Thou bringest the Living out of the dead, and Thou bringest the dead out of the Living; and Thou givest sustenance to whom Thou pleasest, without measure."

column2: And a tenth part of an ephah of flour for a meat offering, mingled with the fourth part of an hin of beaten oil.
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

column2: It is a continual burnt offering, which was ordained in mount Sinai for a sweet savor, a sacrifice made by fire unto the LORD.
column3: Also a tree springing out of Mount Sinai, which produces oil, and relish for those who use it for food.

column2: And the drink offering thereof shall be the fourth part of an hin for the one lamb: in the holy place shalt thou cause the strong wine to be poured unto the LORD for a drink offering.
column3: And those to whom knowledge has come see that the (Revelation) sent down to thee from thy Lord - that is the Truth, and that it guides to the Path of the Exalted (in might), Worthy of all praise.

column2: And the other lamb shalt thou offer at even: as the meat offering of the morning, and as the drink offering thereof, thou shalt offer it, a sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savor unto the LORD.
column3: Nor are the two bodies of flowing water alike,- the one palatable, sweet, and pleasant to drink, and the other, salt and bitter. Yet from each (kind of water) do ye eat flesh fresh and tender, and ye extract ornaments to wear; and thou seest the ships therein that plough the waves, that ye may seek (thus) of the Bounty of Allah that ye may be grateful.

column2: And on the sabbath day two lambs of the first year without spot, and two tenth deals of flour for a meat offering, mingled with oil, and the drink offering thereof:
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

column2: This is the burnt offering of every sabbath, beside the continual burnt offering, and his drink offering.
column3: And during part of the night, (also,) celebrate His praises, and (so likewise) after the postures of adoration.

column2: And in the beginnings of your months ye shall offer a burnt offering unto the LORD; two young bullocks, and one ram, seven lambs of the first year without spot;
column3: The king (of Egypt) said: "I do see (in a vision) seven fat kine, whom seven lean ones devour, and seven green ears of corn, and seven (others) withered. O ye chiefs! Expound to me my vision if it be that ye can interpret visions."

column2: And three tenth deals of flour for a meat offering, mingled with oil, for one bullock; and two tenth deals of flour for a meat offering, mingled with oil, for one ram;
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

column2: And a several tenth deal of flour mingled with oil for a meat offering unto one lamb; for a burnt offering of a sweet savor, a sacrifice made by fire unto the LORD.
column3: (Here is) a Parable of the Garden which the righteous are promised: in it are rivers of water incorruptible; rivers of milk of which the taste never changes; rivers of wine, a joy to those who drink; and rivers of honey pure and clear. In it there are for them all kinds of fruits; and Grace from their Lord. (Can those in such Bliss) be compared to such as shall dwell for ever in the Fire, and be given, to drink, boiling water, so that it cuts up their bowels (to pieces)?

column2: And their drink offerings shall be half an hin of wine unto a bullock, and the third part of an hin unto a ram, and a fourth part of an hin unto a lamb: this is the burnt offering of every month throughout the months of the year.
column3: For those who followed the Jewish Law, We forbade every (animal) with undivided hoof, and We forbade them that fat of the ox and the sheep, except what adheres to their backs or their entrails, or is mixed up with a bone: this in recompense for their wilful disobedience: for We are true (in Our ordinances).

column2: And one kid of the goats for a sin offering unto the LORD shall be offered, beside the continual burnt offering, and his drink offering.
column3: O ye who believe! Kill not game while in the sacred precincts or in pilgrim garb. If any of you doth so intentionally, the compensation is an offering, brought to the Ka'ba, of a domestic animal equivalent to the one he killed, as adjudged by two just men among you; or by way of atonement, the feeding of the indigent; or its equivalent in fasts: that he may taste of the penalty of his deed. Allah forgives what is past: for repetition Allah will exact from him the penalty. For Allah is Exalted, and Lord of Retribution.

column2: And in the fourteenth day of the first month is the passover of the LORD.
column3: Moses said: "Your tryst is the Day of the Festival, and let the people be assembled when the sun is well up."

column2: And in the fifteenth day of this month is the feast: seven days shall unleavened bread be eaten.
column3: In front of the Fire will they be brought, morning and evening: And (the sentence will be) on the Day that Judgment will be established: "Cast ye the People of Pharaoh into the severest Penalty!"

column2: In the first day shall be an holy convocation; ye shall do no manner of servile work therein:
column3: This day are (all) things good and pure made lawful unto you. The food of the People of the Book is lawful unto you and yours is lawful unto them. (Lawful unto you in marriage) are (not only) chaste women who are believers, but chaste women among the People of the Book, revealed before your time,- when ye give them their due dowers, and desire chastity, not lewdness, nor secret intrigues if any one rejects faith, fruitless is his work, and in the Hereafter he will be in the ranks of those who have lost (all spiritual good).

column2: But ye shall offer a sacrifice made by fire for a burnt offering unto the LORD; two young bullocks, and one ram, and seven lambs of the first year: they shall be unto you without blemish:
column3: The sacrificial camels we have made for you as among the symbols from Allah: in them is (much) good for you: then pronounce the name of Allah over them as they line up (for sacrifice): when they are down on their sides (after slaughter), eat ye thereof, and feed such as (beg not but) live in contentment, and such as beg with due humility: thus have We made animals subject to you, that ye may be grateful.

column2: And their meat offering shall be of flour mingled with oil: three tenth deals shall ye offer for a bullock, and two tenth deals for a ram;
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

column2: A several tenth deal shalt thou offer for every lamb, throughout the seven lambs:
column3: By degrees shall We teach thee to declare (the Message), so thou shalt not forget,

column2: And one goat for a sin offering, to make an atonement for you.
column3: A fitting recompense (for them).

column2: Ye shall offer these beside the burnt offering in the morning, which is for a continual burnt offering.
column3: In them ye have benefits for a term appointed: in the end their place of sacrifice is near the Ancient House.

column2: After this manner ye shall offer daily, throughout the seven days, the meat of the sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savor unto the LORD: it shall be offered beside the continual burnt offering, and his drink offering.
column3: O ye who believe! Kill not game while in the sacred precincts or in pilgrim garb. If any of you doth so intentionally, the compensation is an offering, brought to the Ka'ba, of a domestic animal equivalent to the one he killed, as adjudged by two just men among you; or by way of atonement, the feeding of the indigent; or its equivalent in fasts: that he may taste of the penalty of his deed. Allah forgives what is past: for repetition Allah will exact from him the penalty. For Allah is Exalted, and Lord of Retribution.

column2: And on the seventh day ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work.
column3: "And further (thus): 'set thy face towards religion with true piety, and never in any wise be of the Unbelievers;

column2: Also in the day of the firstfruits, when ye bring a new meat offering unto the LORD, after your weeks be out, ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work:
column3: The Day ye shall see it, every mother giving suck shall forget her suckling-babe, and every pregnant female shall drop her load (unformed): thou shalt see mankind as in a drunken riot, yet not drunk: but dreadful will be the Wrath of Allah.

column2: But ye shall offer the burnt offering for a sweet savor unto the LORD; two young bullocks, one ram, seven lambs of the first year;
column3: The king (of Egypt) said: "I do see (in a vision) seven fat kine, whom seven lean ones devour, and seven green ears of corn, and seven (others) withered. O ye chiefs! Expound to me my vision if it be that ye can interpret visions."

column2: And their meat offering of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals unto one bullock, two tenth deals unto one ram,
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

column2: A several tenth deal unto one lamb, throughout the seven lambs;
column3: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

column2: And one kid of the goats, to make an atonement for you.
column3: A fitting recompense (for them).

column2: Ye shall offer them beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, (they shall be unto you without blemish) and their drink offerings.
column3: Nor are the two bodies of flowing water alike,- the one palatable, sweet, and pleasant to drink, and the other, salt and bitter. Yet from each (kind of water) do ye eat flesh fresh and tender, and ye extract ornaments to wear; and thou seest the ships therein that plough the waves, that ye may seek (thus) of the Bounty of Allah that ye may be grateful.

column2: And in the seventh month, on the first day of the month, ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work: it is a day of blowing the trumpets unto you.
column3: This day are (all) things good and pure made lawful unto you. The food of the People of the Book is lawful unto you and yours is lawful unto them. (Lawful unto you in marriage) are (not only) chaste women who are believers, but chaste women among the People of the Book, revealed before your time,- when ye give them their due dowers, and desire chastity, not lewdness, nor secret intrigues if any one rejects faith, fruitless is his work, and in the Hereafter he will be in the ranks of those who have lost (all spiritual good).

column2: And ye shall offer a burnt offering for a sweet savor unto the LORD; one young bullock, one ram, and seven lambs of the first year without blemish:
column3: The king (of Egypt) said: "I do see (in a vision) seven fat kine, whom seven lean ones devour, and seven green ears of corn, and seven (others) withered. O ye chiefs! Expound to me my vision if it be that ye can interpret visions."

column2: And their meat offering shall be of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals for a bullock, and two tenth deals for a ram,
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

column2: And one tenth deal for one lamb, throughout the seven lambs:
column3: And a Sign for them is that We bore their race (through the Flood) in the loaded Ark;

column2: And one kid of the goats for a sin offering, to make an atonement for you:
column3: And a Sign for them is that We bore their race (through the Flood) in the loaded Ark;

column2: Beside the burnt offering of the month, and his meat offering, and the daily burnt offering, and his meat offering, and their drink offerings, according unto their manner, for a sweet savor, a sacrifice made by fire unto the LORD.
column3: It is He Who produceth gardens, with trellises and without, and dates, and tilth with produce of all kinds, and olives and pomegranates, similar (in kind) and different (in variety): eat of their fruit in their season, but render the dues that are proper on the day that the harvest is gathered. But waste not by excess: for Allah loveth not the wasters.

column2: And ye shall have on the tenth day of this seventh month an holy convocation; and ye shall afflict your souls: ye shall not do any work therein:
column3: Or have ye Covenants with Us to oath, reaching to the Day of Judgment, (providing) that ye shall have whatever ye shall demand?

column2: But ye shall offer a burnt offering unto the LORD for a sweet savor; one young bullock, one ram, and seven lambs of the first year; they shall be unto you without blemish:
column3: The king (of Egypt) said: "I do see (in a vision) seven fat kine, whom seven lean ones devour, and seven green ears of corn, and seven (others) withered. O ye chiefs! Expound to me my vision if it be that ye can interpret visions."

column2: And their meat offering shall be of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals to a bullock, and two tenth deals to one ram,
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

column2: A several tenth deal for one lamb, throughout the seven lambs:
column3: Their covenants (covering) journeys by winter and summer,-

column2: One kid of the goats for a sin offering; beside the sin offering of atonement, and the continual burnt offering, and the meat offering of it, and their drink offerings.
column3: And during part of the night, (also,) celebrate His praises, and (so likewise) after the postures of adoration.

column2: And on the fifteenth day of the seventh month ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work, and ye shall keep a feast unto the LORD seven days:
column3: And remember We took a covenant from the Children of Israel (to this effect): Worship none but Allah; treat with kindness your parents and kindred, and orphans and those in need; speak fair to the people; be steadfast in prayer; and practise regular charity. Then did ye turn back, except a few among you, and ye backslide (even now).

column2: And ye shall offer a burnt offering, a sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savor unto the LORD; thirteen young bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year; they shall be without blemish:
column3: (Here is) a Parable of the Garden which the righteous are promised: in it are rivers of water incorruptible; rivers of milk of which the taste never changes; rivers of wine, a joy to those who drink; and rivers of honey pure and clear. In it there are for them all kinds of fruits; and Grace from their Lord. (Can those in such Bliss) be compared to such as shall dwell for ever in the Fire, and be given, to drink, boiling water, so that it cuts up their bowels (to pieces)?

column2: And their meat offering shall be of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals unto every bullock of the thirteen bullocks, two tenth deals to each ram of the two rams,
column3: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

column2: And a several tenth deal to each lamb of the fourteen lambs:
column3: The Thamud and the 'Ad People (branded) as false the Stunning Calamity!

column2: And one kid of the goats for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering, and his drink offering.
column3: And a Sign for them is that We bore their race (through the Flood) in the loaded Ark;

column2: And on the second day ye shall offer twelve young bullocks, two rams, fourteen lambs of the first year without spot:
column3: In them ye have benefits for a term appointed: in the end their place of sacrifice is near the Ancient House.

column2: And their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
column3: For those who followed the Jewish Law, We forbade every (animal) with undivided hoof, and We forbade them that fat of the ox and the sheep, except what adheres to their backs or their entrails, or is mixed up with a bone: this in recompense for their wilful disobedience: for We are true (in Our ordinances).

column2: And one kid of the goats for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, and the meat offering thereof, and their drink offerings.
column3: In them ye have benefits for a term appointed: in the end their place of sacrifice is near the Ancient House.

column2: And on the third day eleven bullocks, two rams, fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish;
column3: (Take) eight (head of cattle) in (four) pairs: of sheep a pair, and of goats a pair; say, hath He forbidden the two males, or the two females, or (the young) which the wombs of the two females enclose? Tell me with knowledge if ye are truthful:

column2: And their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
column3: For those who followed the Jewish Law, We forbade every (animal) with undivided hoof, and We forbade them that fat of the ox and the sheep, except what adheres to their backs or their entrails, or is mixed up with a bone: this in recompense for their wilful disobedience: for We are true (in Our ordinances).

column2: And one goat for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, and his drink offering.
column3: For such the reward is forgiveness from their Lord, and Gardens with rivers flowing underneath,- an eternal dwelling: How excellent a recompense for those who work (and strive)!

column2: And on the fourth day ten bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish:
column3: (Take) eight (head of cattle) in (four) pairs: of sheep a pair, and of goats a pair; say, hath He forbidden the two males, or the two females, or (the young) which the wombs of the two females enclose? Tell me with knowledge if ye are truthful:

column2: Their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
column3: For those who followed the Jewish Law, We forbade every (animal) with undivided hoof, and We forbade them that fat of the ox and the sheep, except what adheres to their backs or their entrails, or is mixed up with a bone: this in recompense for their wilful disobedience: for We are true (in Our ordinances).

column2: And one kid of the goats for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering, and his drink offering.
column3: And a Sign for them is that We bore their race (through the Flood) in the loaded Ark;

column2: And on the fifth day nine bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without spot:
column3: The king (of Egypt) said: "I do see (in a vision) seven fat kine, whom seven lean ones devour, and seven green ears of corn, and seven (others) withered. O ye chiefs! Expound to me my vision if it be that ye can interpret visions."

column2: And their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
column3: For those who followed the Jewish Law, We forbade every (animal) with undivided hoof, and We forbade them that fat of the ox and the sheep, except what adheres to their backs or their entrails, or is mixed up with a bone: this in recompense for their wilful disobedience: for We are true (in Our ordinances).

column2: And one goat for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, and his drink offering.
column3: For such the reward is forgiveness from their Lord, and Gardens with rivers flowing underneath,- an eternal dwelling: How excellent a recompense for those who work (and strive)!

column2: And on the sixth day eight bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish:
column3: (Take) eight (head of cattle) in (four) pairs: of sheep a pair, and of goats a pair; say, hath He forbidden the two males, or the two females, or (the young) which the wombs of the two females enclose? Tell me with knowledge if ye are truthful:

column2: And their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
column3: For those who followed the Jewish Law, We forbade every (animal) with undivided hoof, and We forbade them that fat of the ox and the sheep, except what adheres to their backs or their entrails, or is mixed up with a bone: this in recompense for their wilful disobedience: for We are true (in Our ordinances).

column2: And one goat for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering, and his drink offering.
column3: For such the reward is forgiveness from their Lord, and Gardens with rivers flowing underneath,- an eternal dwelling: How excellent a recompense for those who work (and strive)!

column2: And on the seventh day seven bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish:
column3: (Take) eight (head of cattle) in (four) pairs: of sheep a pair, and of goats a pair; say, hath He forbidden the two males, or the two females, or (the young) which the wombs of the two females enclose? Tell me with knowledge if ye are truthful:

column2: And their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
column3: For those who followed the Jewish Law, We forbade every (animal) with undivided hoof, and We forbade them that fat of the ox and the sheep, except what adheres to their backs or their entrails, or is mixed up with a bone: this in recompense for their wilful disobedience: for We are true (in Our ordinances).

column2: And one goat for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering, and his drink offering.
column3: For such the reward is forgiveness from their Lord, and Gardens with rivers flowing underneath,- an eternal dwelling: How excellent a recompense for those who work (and strive)!

column2: On the eighth day ye shall have a solemn assembly: ye shall do no servile work therein:
column3: Or have ye Covenants with Us to oath, reaching to the Day of Judgment, (providing) that ye shall have whatever ye shall demand?

column2: But ye shall offer a burnt offering, a sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savor unto the LORD: one bullock, one ram, seven lambs of the first year without blemish:
column3: "O Joseph!" (he said) "O man of truth! Expound to us (the dream) of seven fat kine whom seven lean ones devour, and of seven green ears of corn and (seven) others withered: that I may return to the people, and that they may understand."

column2: Their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullock, for the ram, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
column3: For those who followed the Jewish Law, We forbade every (animal) with undivided hoof, and We forbade them that fat of the ox and the sheep, except what adheres to their backs or their entrails, or is mixed up with a bone: this in recompense for their wilful disobedience: for We are true (in Our ordinances).

column2: And one goat for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, and his drink offering.
column3: For such the reward is forgiveness from their Lord, and Gardens with rivers flowing underneath,- an eternal dwelling: How excellent a recompense for those who work (and strive)!

column2: These things ye shall do unto the LORD in your set feasts, beside your vows, and your freewill offerings, for your burnt offerings, and for your meat offerings, and for your drink offerings, and for your peace offerings.
column3: And among His Signs is the sleep that ye take by night and by day, and the quest that ye (make for livelihood) out of His Bounty: verily in that are signs for those who hearken.

column2: And Moses told the children of Israel according to all that the LORD commanded Moses.
column3: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel, except what Israel Made unlawful for itself, before the Law (of Moses) was revealed. Say: "Bring ye the Law and study it, if ye be men of truth."

column2: And Moses spake unto the heads of the tribes concerning the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which the LORD hath commanded.
column3: Nor wast thou at the side of (the Mountain of) Tur when we called (to Moses). Yet (art thou sent) as Mercy from thy Lord, to give warning to a people to whom no warner had come before thee: in order that they may receive admonition.

column2: If a man vow a vow unto the LORD, or swear an oath to bind his soul with a bond; he shall not break his word, he shall do according to all that proceedeth out of his mouth.
column3: If ye are on a journey, and cannot find a scribe, a pledge with possession (may serve the purpose). And if one of you deposits a thing on trust with another, Let the trustee (Faithfully) discharge His trust, and let him fear his Lord. Conceal not evidence; for whoever conceals it,- His heart is tainted with sin. And Allah Knoweth all that ye do.

column2: If a woman also vow a vow unto the LORD, and bind herself by a bond, being in her father's house in her youth;
column3: But it would avert the punishment from the wife, if she bears witness four times (with an oath) By Allah, that (her husband) is telling a lie;

column2: And her father hear her vow, and her bond wherewith she hath bound her soul, and her father shall hold his peace at her; then all her vows shall stand, and every bond wherewith she hath bound her soul shall stand.
column3: Say: "My Lord hath commanded justice; and that ye set your whole selves (to Him) at every time and place of prayer, and call upon Him, making your devotion sincere as in His sight: such as He created you in the beginning, so shall ye return."

column2: But if her father disallow her in the day that he heareth; not any of her vows, or of her bonds wherewith she hath bound her soul, shall stand: and the LORD shall forgive her, because her father disallowed her.
column3: Or lest ye should say: "If the Book had only been sent down to us, we should have followed its guidance better than they." Now then hath come unto you a clear (sign) from your Lord,- and a guide and a mercy: then who could do more wrong than one who rejecteth Allah's signs, and turneth away therefrom? In good time shall We requite those who turn away from Our signs, with a dreadful penalty, for their turning away.

column2: And if she had at all an husband, when she vowed, or uttered ought out of her lips, wherewith she bound her soul;
column3: In them will be (Maidens), chaste, restraining their glances, whom no man or Jinn before them has touched;-

column2: And her husband heard it, and held his peace at her in the day that he heard it: then her vows shall stand, and her bonds wherewith she bound her soul shall stand.
column3: So his Lord hearkened to him (in his prayer), and turned away from him their snare: Verily He heareth and knoweth (all things).

column2: But if her husband disallowed her on the day that he heard it; then he shall make her vow which she vowed, and that which she uttered with her lips, wherewith she bound her soul, of none effect: and the LORD shall forgive her.
column3: Every soul that hath sinned, if it possessed all that is on earth, would fain give it in ransom: They would declare (their) repentance when they see the penalty: but the judgment between them will be with justice, and no wrong will be done unto them.

column2: But every vow of a widow, and of her that is divorced, wherewith they have bound their souls, shall stand against her.
column3: Such are they against whom is proved the sentence among the previous generations of Jinns and men, that have passed away; for they will be (utterly) lost.

column2: And if she vowed in her husband's house, or bound her soul by a bond with an oath;
column3: But it would avert the punishment from the wife, if she bears witness four times (with an oath) By Allah, that (her husband) is telling a lie;

column2: And her husband heard it, and held his peace at her, and disallowed her not: then all her vows shall stand, and every bond wherewith she bound her soul shall stand.
column3: So his Lord hearkened to him (in his prayer), and turned away from him their snare: Verily He heareth and knoweth (all things).

column2: But if her husband hath utterly made them void on the day he heard them; then whatsoever proceeded out of her lips concerning her vows, or concerning the bond of her soul, shall not stand: her husband hath made them void; and the LORD shall forgive her.
column3: Every soul that hath sinned, if it possessed all that is on earth, would fain give it in ransom: They would declare (their) repentance when they see the penalty: but the judgment between them will be with justice, and no wrong will be done unto them.

column2: Every vow, and every binding oath to afflict the soul, her husband may establish it, or her husband may make it void.
column3: O ye who believe! the law of equality is prescribed to you in cases of murder: the free for the free, the slave for the slave, the woman for the woman. But if any remission is made by the brother of the slain, then grant any reasonable demand, and compensate him with handsome gratitude, this is a concession and a Mercy from your Lord. After this whoever exceeds the limits shall be in grave penalty.

column2: But if her husband altogether hold his peace at her from day to day; then he establisheth all her vows, or all her bonds, which are upon her: he confirmeth them, because he held his peace at her in the day that he heard them.
column3: And (with passion) did she desire him, and he would have desired her, but that he saw the evidence of his Lord: thus (did We order) that We might turn away from him (all) evil and shameful deeds: for he was one of Our servants, sincere and purified.

column2: But if he shall any ways make them void after that he hath heard them; then he shall bear her iniquity.
column3: And when the Word is fulfilled against them (the unjust), we shall produce from the earth a beast to (face) them: He will speak to them, for that mankind did not believe with assurance in Our Signs.

column2: These are the statutes, which the LORD commanded Moses, between a man and his wife, between the father and his daughter, being yet in her youth in her father's house.
column3: We appointed for Moses thirty nights, and completed (the period) with ten (more): thus was completed the term (of communion) with his Lord, forty nights. And Moses had charged his brother Aaron (before he went up): "Act for me amongst my people: Do right, and follow not the way of those who do mischief."

column2: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
column3: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"

column2: Avenge the children of Israel of the Midianites: afterward shalt thou be gathered unto thy people.
column3: We did deliver aforetime the Children of Israel from humiliating Punishment,

column2: And Moses spake unto the people, saying, Arm some of yourselves unto the war, and let them go against the Midianites, and avenge the LORD of Midian.
column3: Behold, thy Lord called Moses: "Go to the people of iniquity,-

column2: Of every tribe a thousand, throughout all the tribes of Israel, shall ye send to the war.
column3: One day We shall gather together from every people a troop of those who reject our Signs, and they shall be kept in ranks,-

column2: So there were delivered out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand of every tribe, twelve thousand armed for war.
column3: Before them (were many who) rejected messengers,- the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Pharaoh, the Lord of Stakes,

column2: And Moses sent them to the war, a thousand of every tribe, them and Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, to the war, with the holy instruments, and the trumpets to blow in his hand.
column3: In the past We granted to Moses and Aaron the criterion (for judgment), and a Light and a Message for those who would do right,-

column2: And they warred against the Midianites, as the LORD commanded Moses; and they slew all the males.
column3: Before them the People of Noah rejected (their messenger): they rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!", and he was driven out.

column2: And they slew the kings of Midian, beside the rest of them that were slain; namely, Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, five kings of Midian: Balaam also the son of Beor they slew with the sword.
column3: And Thamud, and the people of Lut, and the Companions of the Wood; - such were the Confederates.

column2: And the children of Israel took all the women of Midian captives, and their little ones, and took the spoil of all their cattle, and all their flocks, and all their goods.
column3: Said the chiefs of Pharaoh's people: "Wilt thou leave Moses and his people, to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon thee and thy gods?" He said: "Their male children will we slay; (only) their females will we save alive; and we have over them (power) irresistible."

column2: And they burnt all their cities wherein they dwelt, and all their goodly castles, with fire.
column3: And how many cities, with more power than thy city which has driven thee out, have We destroyed (for their sins)? and there was none to aid them.

column2: And they took all the spoil, and all the prey, both of men and of beasts.
column3: So We took him and his forces, and threw them into the sea; and his was the blame.

column2: And they brought the captives, and the prey, and the spoil, unto Moses, and Eleazar the priest, and unto the congregation of the children of Israel, unto the camp at the plains of Moab, which are by Jordan near Jericho.
column3: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

column2: And Moses, and Eleazar the priest, and all the princes of the congregation, went forth to meet them without the camp.
column3: We did send Moses aforetime, with Our Signs, to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: He said, "I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds."

column2: And Moses was wroth with the officers of the host, with the captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, which came from the battle.
column3: And before Solomon were marshalled his hosts,- of Jinns and men and birds, and they were all kept in order and ranks.

column2: And Moses said unto them, Have ye saved all the women alive?
column3: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"

column2: Behold, these caused the children of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to commit trespass against the LORD in the matter of Peor, and there was a plague among the congregation of the LORD.
column3: We appointed for Moses thirty nights, and completed (the period) with ten (more): thus was completed the term (of communion) with his Lord, forty nights. And Moses had charged his brother Aaron (before he went up): "Act for me amongst my people: Do right, and follow not the way of those who do mischief."

column2: Now therefore kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman that hath known man by lying with him.
column3: "For, if Thou dost leave (any of) them, they will but mislead Thy devotees, and they will breed none but wicked ungrateful ones.

column2: But all the women children, that have not known a man by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves.
column3: Those who avoid great sins and shameful deeds, only (falling into) small faults,- verily thy Lord is ample in forgiveness. He knows you well when He brings you out of the earth, And when ye are hidden in your mothers' wombs. Therefore justify not yourselves: He knows best who it is that guards against evil.

column2: And do ye abide without the camp seven days: whosoever hath killed any person, and whosoever hath touched any slain, purify both yourselves and your captives on the third day, and on the seventh day.
column3: O ye who believe!
